loans.name: Gerber Antonio

texts.es:
Gerber, sigue mejorando su carpintería, actualmente tiene mayor demanda de sus productos y servicios por lo que requiere de un nuevo préstamo para comprar madera, clavos, barniz, bisagras, chapas, lijas, etc., son materiales importantes para realizar un buen trabajo.
Con el financiamiento anterior ha logrado mantener su negocio funcionando con un mejor equipo de trabajo y mejorar la situación económica, la vida que ofrece a su familia es más confortable.
texts.en:
Gerber keeps improving his carpentry. Currently, he has a lot of demand for his products and services and so he needs a new loan to buy wood, nails, varnish, hinges, sheeting, sandpaper, etc. They are important materials for doing a good job.
With his last loan, he kept his business going with better work equipment and improved his economic situation - the life that he offers his family is more comfortable.

loans.use: to buy wood, nails, varnish, hinges, sheeting, sandpaper, etc.

loans.name: Franklin Jehovany

texts.es:
Frankin de 20 años de edad, es  una persona muy respetada y conocida en la comunidad se ha creció con sus padres quienes le han inculcado buenos principios, y enseñado el negocio de venta de comida rápida,  ya que es una actividad que han desempeñado la mayor parte de su vida. 

Después de haber cursado sus estudios de educación básica en la escuela de su comunidad sus padres decidieron que lo mejor para él era que comenzara a desempeñarse en su propio negocio en lugar que continuara con sus estudios superiores.  Desde temprana edad el joven Frankin mostraba su afición por la cocina mientas cumplía con sus tareas de la escuela y quehaceres en el hogar ya que es un joven muy dedicado y disciplinado, de esa manera ha salido adelante  y ahora administra su propio negocio de venta de comida rápida en su comunidad.   

Franklin tiene una experiencia de 5 años en elaboración de comida rápida, es una actividad que ha aprendido de sus padres que han dedicado parte de su vida a realizar este negocio que hoy se ha convertido en su principal fuente de ingresos, así fue que a la edad de 15 años entra como mesero en el negocio de su padre, en poco tiempo aprendió todo lo necesario y creyó que la cocina ya no tenía secretos para él y fue así como inicio su propio negocio con el apoyo de sus padres.

El espíritu emprendedor y apasionado del joven Franklin lo han llevado a adquirir un financiamiento que será invertido en compra de mesas metálicas y una cámara refrigerante,  lo que vendrá  a mejorar y ampliar su negocio y dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes lo que mejorara sus ingresos y le dará una ganancia para cumplir con sus compromisos crediticios.

Sus sueños y aspiraciones lo han llevado más allá de la vida rural en la cual se encontraba inmerso,  por esa razón las metas que tiene son las de ampliar su negocio y montar una sucursal en el centro del pueblo, que cuente con el servicio a domicilio, y entre sus proyectos está el de renovar el financiamiento para la compra de un vehículo el cual le sirva para viajar y dar movilidad a sus empleados.
texts.en:
Franklin, 20 years old, is a very respected and well-known person in the community. He grew up with his parents who instilled in him good principles and taught him the business of fast food sales, since that has been their line of work for most of his life.

After having finished his basic education in the community school, his parents decided that the best for him would be to begin to develop his own business instead of continuing with further education. From an early age, young Franklin showed an interest in cooking while he completed his school work and household chores. He is already a very dedicated and disciplined young man, and in this way he has gotten ahead and now he runs his own business selling fast food in his community. 

Franklin has 5 years of experience making fast food; it is a line of work that he learned from his parents who have spent part of their lives doing this business that today has become their primary source of income. So, at age 15, he started working as a waiter in his father's business, and in a short time he learned everything necessary and believed that the kitchen no longer held any secrets for him, and in this way he began his own business with his parents' support. 

Young Franklin's enterprising and passionate spirit has brought him to secure a loan that will be invested in the purchase of metal tables and a large display refrigerator, which will improve and expand his business and provide better service for his customers, which will improve his income and give him the earnings to meet his loan commitments. 

His dreams and aspirations have carried him further than the rural life in which he is immersed, for this reason the goals that he has are to expand his business and set up a branch in the center of town, that has a delivery service, and among his projects will be to renew the loan to purchase a vehicle which will serve him to travel and give his employees mobility.

loans.use: to purchase metal tables and a large display refrigerator, which will improve and expand his business to provide better service for his customers.

loans.name: Juan Guillermo

texts.es:
Juan es un pequeño productor de café desde hace 20 años. Junto a su esposa y su hijo mayor manejan las actividades productivas de café en su pequeña finca, ubicada al norte de Nicaragua.

Para este nuevo ciclo, él está solicitando un financiamiento para la compra de  insumos agrícolas que le ayuden a mejorar el estado nutricional de sus cafetos. Estas actividades forman parte de un plan de manejo integral de su finca, con el cual se ha propuesto alcanzar mejores resultados este año.

Este pequeño productor, es un líder ejemplar en su comunidad, maneja su finca bajo criterios de certificación de comercio justo y ha logrado cosechar a lograr cosechar hasta 450 quintales de café, lo cual pretender incrementar para mejorar sus ingresos y con ello las condiciones de su familia.
texts.en:
Juan has been a small-scale coffee producer for 20 years. Along with his wife and their oldest son, he handles the coffee production activities of his small farm, located in the north of Nicaragua.
For this new cycle, he is requesting a loan to buy agricultural supplies that help to improve the nutritional status of his coffee crops. This is part of a comprehensive management plan for his farm that he has proposed in order to achieve better results this year. 
This small producer is an exemplary leader in his community. He manages his farm under the certification criteria for fair trade and has been able to harvest up to 450 quintales de cafe (45,000 kilos). He wants to increase this so that he can improve his income and his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies that help him to improve the nutritional status of his coffee crops.

loans.name: Maria Vidalia

texts.es:
Maria ha tenido que enfrentar en su vida dos grandes tragedias que nublaron su vida durante algún tiempo, la primera fue la muerte de su pequeña hija de 4 años a causa de una grave enfermedad, desde ese momento tuvo que empezar a trabajar duramente ya que tenía otro bebe en camino.
Ella se dedica a la confección en contratación con terceros, una actividad muy común en el municipio de Puerto Berrio.
El segundo incidente fue el fallecimiento de su tercera hija cuando tenía 5 meses de nacida, sintió que su mundo se derrumbaba y todo lo que había construido se venía abajo.
Pero gracias a su coraje y tenacidad pudo superar esta crisis y comenzó a darle más fuerza a su negocio, tanto así que alterna su actividad con la venta de comidas.
Ella solicita un crédito para la compra de una maquina recubridora y la compra de insumos para sus dos negocios, de esta forma podrá iniciar con un negocio de línea propia, confeccionando pijamas y blusas, es una idea muy emprendedora y quiere poner todo su amor en esta actividad.
texts.en:
Maria has had to face two big tragedies in her life that have clouded her life for some time. The first was the death of her young daughter at 4 years old due to a serious illness; from that moment she had to begin to work very hard since she had another baby on the way.

She works in dressmaking with third-party contracts, a very common line of work in the municipality of Puerto Berrio.

The second incident was the death of her third daughter when she was 5 months old. She felt that the world had fallen apart and everything she had made was falling down. 

But, thanks to her courage and tenacity, she was able to overcome this crisis and she began to put more effort into her business, as much so that she splits her working time, also selling food.

She asks for a loan to purchase a coverstitch machine and to purchase supplies for both businesses, and in this way she will be able to begin a business of her own line, making pajamas and blouses. It is a very enterprising idea and she wants to put all her love into this activity.

loans.use: to purchase a coverstitch machine and supplies for her businesses.

loans.name: Santos Marvin

texts.es:
Santos, es un pequeño caficultor con 7 años de experiencia. Desde pequeño soñó con dedicarse a la producción de este rubro, lo cual ha logrado manteniendo siempre su entusiasmo por lo que hace. En su pequeña finca genera 3 empleos temporales en tiempo de cosecha, pero sueña con tener una finca modelo en la que pueda generar más empleos en su comunidad.

El ciclo pasado su cafetal fue afectado por una plaga llamada roya, disminuyendo su producción de café significativamente. Para este año, él está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de  insumos agrícolas que le permitan continuar realizando actividades de mantenimiento en su cafetal, para contrarrestar los efectos de la roya y contribuir a garantizar una mejor cosecha en este ciclo y con ello mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Santos is a small-time coffee grower with seven years of experience. Dreaming of doing this work from a young age, he has reached this goal and still is enthusiastic about it. At his small farm, Santos has three seasonal employees at harvest but dreams of having an exemplary farm where he can generate more jobs in his community.

Last season Santos' farm was affected by a disease where his crops became corroded and his coffee production was reduced greatly. This year Santos is applying for a loan in order to buy farming supplies that will allow him to continue looking after his crops and stop the effects of corrosion. This will help guarantee a better harvest this season and, with it, Santos will have a higher income for his family.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies for looking after coffee crops.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio es un productor de café de la zona norte de Nicaragua. Con 48 años de edad, trabaja duramente, junto a su esposa, en la producción de café bajo la certificación de Comercio Justo. Este pequeño productor  se caracteriza por implementar Buenas Prácticas Agrícolas (BPA) en su finca, lo cual le ha permitido tener buenos rendimientos en los últimos años.

Para este ciclo, él está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de fertilizantes y abonos que requiere su plantación y poder tener una buena cosecha. Su meta es continuar incrementando su producción, mediante el manejo adecuado de sus plantaciones. Además, sueña con incrementar el área de producción y de esta forma su cosecha, para generar más ingresos para su familia y empleos en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Julio is a coffee producer from the north of Nicaragua. He is 48 years old and works hard alongside his wife. The couple produces coffee under the Fair Trade label. This small-time coffee producer has implemented good farming practices at his farm, allowing him to have a good yield in recent years.

This season Julio is applying for a loan in order to buy the fertilisers and manures that his plantation needs, and to have a good harvest. Julio's goal is to continue increasing production by managing his crops well. Julio also dreams of increasing his production space and, in turn, his harvest in order to generate a higher income for his family, and jobs in his community.

loans.use: to buy the fertilisers and manures that his plantations needs, and to have a good harvest.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 34 years old and lives in the town of Fort Portal in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. He is married, and has one child. For the past seven years, Patrick has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells spare parts. 

To help expand his business, Patrick has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more spare parts to sell, and will help Patrick to generate greater profits and take care of his family with all necessary basic needs. 

Patrick hopes that in the future he will be able to expand the business and become a big supplier in the whole town. 

Patrick is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Patrick who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more spare parts

loans.name: Baxtiyar

texts.en:
Baxtiyar is 27 year old, a young client. He is married and has two kids. Baxtiyar is  an IDP (internally displaced person), and lives with his wife in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement.  He  is a Fuzulu refugee. 

He has been growing vegetables and fruits for more than five years. He is very hardworking and passionate about his work. He considers it fun to grow potatoes, tomatoes, and cucumbers, and to plant fruit trees with his wife. 

He sells his crops in the central bazaar to make profits in order to support his family. Baxtiyar’s income from the business is 130 AZN. In order to improve the living conditions of his family, he plans to expand his business. This requires a lot of dedication and effort. He believes that, in the near future, his sons will help him to grow the business. Since the vegetable and fruit business is profitable and fun, he wants the business to continue and prosper. 

He has applied to Aqroinvest for a loan of 600 AZN. This loan is for the purpose of buying seeds. 

It will help him to grow more vegetables and fruits in order to obtain more revenue in the coming autumn, which will help him to cover his family’s needs.

loans.use: to buy seeds

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en:
Priscilla is 28 years old and lives in the town of Fort Portal in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is married and has one child who is currently in school. For the past five years, Priscilla has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells essential commodities. 

To help expand her business, Priscilla has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential goods like sugar and salt for the business, and will help Priscilla to generate greater profits and improve on her family standards of living. 

Priscilla hopes that in the future she will be able to expand the business into a wholesale shop. 

Priscilla is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Priscilla who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more essential goods like sugar and salt for the business,

loans.name: Jose Adgusto

texts.es:
José es un productor de la zona norte de Nicaragua, dedicado a la producción de café desde hace más de 10 años. Es conocido en su comunidad como un hombre honesto y comprometido con su trabajo.

El ciclo pasado su cosecha se vio en riesgo debido a la afectación de la roya en su plantación, siendo su producción 30% menor al ciclo anterior. Para hacer frente a la afectación de esta plaga y lograr un mejor rendimiento en su cosecha, para este año él está solicitando un financiamiento para la adquisición de fertilizantes y abonos que le ayudarán a cumplir con la meta que se ha propuesto.

Este emprendedor ha trabajado con el apoyo del equipo técnico de la asociación, un plan de mejoramiento nutricional para sus cafetos, a fin de aumentar los niveles de producción de su café. Él está seguro que con un manejo adecuado, logrará tener una mejor cosecha y mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
José is a coffee producer in the north of Nicaragua. He has been making a living growing coffee for over ten years and is known in the community as an honest man who is dedicated to his work.

Last season José's crops were at risk of becoming affected by disease, and his yield was 30 per cent lower than the previous year. In order to deal with this disease and have a higher yield at this season's harvest, José is applying for a loan in order to buy the fertilisers and manure that will help him to achieve his self-set goal.

This entrepreneur, José, has worked with the support of a technical team at the coffee cooperative and a plan that will help improve nutrition for the crops with the aim of increasing coffee production. José is confident that with good management he will have a better harvest and a higher income for his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilisers and manure.

loans.name: Charline

texts.en:
She is single and a mother of three children. They all live in a two bedroom house in Bamenda, in the northwest region of Cameroon.  She has faced so many difficulties in life, some of which are the death of her younger brother by electrification, sickness in her father with a heart attack, and the general poverty in her family. 

With the new loan requested she will buy clothes, and provision store items like oil, savons, Maggi and groundnuts. Secondly, she will also buy a phone sim card and airtime to start her call box business market.  She believes her business will succeed because her business is located in the center of the town; she has been in this line of business for the past six years, and has the experience on the type of clothes to buy and sell when needs arises. 

With this business activity, the community will benefit from the moderate prices she will offer to her customers, providing dresses, exploitation from others sellers, and lastly, the distance to buy from the market will be reduced. 

With the profit made from this loan, she will expand her farming business, pay her children school fees and save some. She will also provide medication for her family. 

She prefers a GHAPE loan because of the low interest rates, convenient repayment intervals, and the training on marketing and management skills before the loans are disbursed

loans.use: To buy clothes, open a provision store, and start a credit transfer business.

loans.name: Isaya

texts.en:
Isaya a married man who deals in general merchandise like cosmetics, sugar and biscuits among others alongside a bar business in Hoima, Uganda. 

He started his business in 2010 so as to improve his standard of living. He has hopes of business expansion though competition hinders his business.

Isaya is acquiring a loan to buy more cosmetics, sugar and soap to sell.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics, sugar and soap to sell.

loans.name: Tungteeya - Kpatari-Bugu Group

texts.en:
Asana, 45, is an active woman from Demonayili, in the northern part of Ghana. She is married and has six children. In the group picture, she is squatting with both hands in the shea nuts. 

Asana is a member of a local rice processing group that has been harvesting and processing shea nuts over the last four years. The group is called Tungteeya--Kpatari-Bugu Women Association. 

Asana makes good profits from the business, since she and every member of her group have been trained by Grameen Ghana on how to improve their ways of processing quality nuts for both the local market in Ghana and export markets. 

Asana and the group have asked for a loan of 2,800 Ghanaian Cedi. Her share of the loan will help her to hire 10 people to harvest and process six bags of premium quality shea nuts. By so doing, she will earn more income, hence repay this loan and support her children’s education and health needs.

loans.use: To hire 10 people to harvest and process six bags of premium quality shea nuts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase groceries in bulk from wholesalers.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary lives in Hoima, Uganda. She is a single woman charged with a responsibility of taking care of four children between 5 and 17, all of whom attend school. 

She deals in produce such as rice, beans, groundnuts and maize alongside farming. She started business to develop herself. She hopes to excel in farming and business as well. Her clientele is composed of schools majorly. Her challenges are competition, price changes and low capital.

Mary will use the loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Chiengkonpang J Group

texts.en:
Hatzaneng is the featured member of the group Chiengkonpang J. 

She runs a petty business in her restaurant by selling items like local wine, chow, meat, etc. She and her husband run the business in order to generate more income in the family. They live in a rural hilly area of Manipur in India. Their monthly family income is approximately 20,000 INR. There are four children going to school in their family. 

The family needed solar lighting at home since there is an irregular supply of power in their area. The children could not continue their studies past sunset, therefore it hampers their daily studies. Hatzaneng took the solar loan so that the children will not be disturbed during their study hours after sunset and at the same time she herself and her husband will also do the household chores and run their business hassle free.
 
The featured group member was picked from the area because she shared a common goal with the other group members. The other group members too needed solar loans for their business purposes and also for household use. The rest of the group members are engaged in weaving, variety store, vegetable vending, etc.

loans.use: To purchase solar home lighting that will help the members of the family in performing their duties, especially for the children’s study and running the family business after sunset.

loans.name: Dakhel

texts.en:
Dakhel, 28, is married and lives with his family in the capital city of Sana'a, Yemen.  

Dakhel has a university education. Because of the high rates of unemployment in his country, he couldn't find a job to look after his family. He is a talented, respected, professional young man. He has great determination and doesn't surrender easily to his obstacles and problems. As a result, he started his own telecommunication center, selling mobile phones, rechargers and phone accessories. Step-by- step, he developed his business and opened a grocery store, selling groceries and goods to his customers. 

Since 2005, Dakhel has sold groceries and food products as his family's source of income. He started this business with a small amount of capital. Thanks to his hard work, he has been able to develop and expand his merchandise. The profits from this business have allowed him to expand his sales volume. 

To further develop his business, Dakhel has turned to Al-Amal Microfinance Bank. He is requesting a loan of 400,000 Yemeni rial to buy more goods and items for the grocery store to meet all of his customers' demands.

Dakhel plans to invest the earnings from this loan to further increase his business. He also intends to expand his business by opening other branches.

loans.use: to buy more goods and items for the grocery store to meet his customers' demands.

loans.name: Constance

texts.en:
Constance is 26 years old. She lives with her two children in Binga District, Zimbabwe, where she has been running a flea market stall selling shoes, ladies' clothes and men’s clothes. Constance also does volunteer work with other members of Cama, Camfed’s alumnae network. She volunteers visiting children in school and encouraging them to go to school. 

With the requested loan from Kiva, she intends to increase her business by making bulk purchases of clothes so that her sales and profit volumes may increase. With additional profits, she hopes to open her own clothing store, create employment in her community and provide for her child and family.

loans.use: to make bulk purchases of clothing products.

loans.name: Shpetime

texts.en:
Shpetime is an Egyptian Albanian who was born with a disability as was her sister, yet she has a more advanced type of disability that has left her paralyzed completely. They have lived together forever, according to them. Shpetime, who never got married, has been looking after her sister.

Shpetime now wants to repair the roofing of their little house that has been leaking throughout the last winter’s rains.
 
Here it is what she said during the interview: “All the water rain got inside our only sleeping room and in the kitchen also and everywhere else. We must do some repairs to the leaking roof before fall season starts. We really need the money and will very much appreciate any help from lenders.”

loans.use: to repair the leaking roof of her house.

loans.name: Dromo Naa Group

texts.en:
Mary is married with one dependent son. She runs a frozen food store. She is the featured borrower of this group of five members who work selling kenkey (cooked corn paste), fish, maize, ground nuts and other provisions. 

Mary started her business with the support of her mother, who also had a frozen food store at the market. She decided to start out on her own after many years. She joined ID Ghana a year and a half ago at the invitation of a sister-in-law who is a member of the institution. When asked what she likes about ID Ghana, Mary identifies the training that the institution offers her.

The group loan will benefit small micro-businesses like Mary's. She will use her portion of the loan to purchase wholesale frozen foods to sell to her customers at the market. Her loan will enable her to generate resources to maintain her family's living standards.

loans.use: To purchase wholesale frozen foods to sell to her customers at the market.

loans.name: Reshat

texts.en:
This is Reshat, a father of four children who is requesting your financial help to pay for a medical visitation to a clinic in the capital city of Tirana. He has been suffering from a severe anemia that has made him receive blood every month. To do this procedure, he’s got to go to the capital city.
 
Reshat does agriculture for earning a living. He plants grains such as corn, wheat and barley and also beans. He sells all this produce in a dried form to wholesalers who cover transportation themselves so he doesn’t have to worry about it.
 
Reshat’s village has the coldest climate in the region and the country. The village was built after drying an existing marsh. Agriculture and livestock (cows and sheep) are the villagers' favorite activities since the soil is very fertile and the terrain allows great grazing for animals.

loans.use: pay for the blood he receives every month due to severe anemia.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys, 38, is married and blessed with three school-going children. She has been running a mobile-phone money transfer business (M-PESA) for the last six years and earns a monthly income of 30,000 Kenyan shillings, which she uses to support her family.

Gladys has applied for her second loan with Vision Fund Kenya. She will use the loan to add to her working float for M-PESA services. She will use her anticipated income to pay school fees for her children.

She would like to grow her business and be financially stable.

loans.use: to add to the float of her mobile-phone money transfer service (M-PESA)

loans.name: Rufina Felicita

texts.es:
Rufina es una mujer luchadora, tiene 51 años de edad, es soltera y vive en San Vicente junto a su familia.
Tiene dos hijos quienes son su mayor orgullo y su mayor inspiración para salir adelante. Desde hace muchos años trabaja como obrera en los Campos Agrícolas de la zona, le va muy bien porque es una persona responsable, trabajadora, honesta y porque a lo largo de los años ha sabido ganarse el respeto y la confianza de las personas.
Rufina está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mercadería para iniciar un pequeño negocio de venta de ropa, de esta manera obtendrá mayores ingresos y podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Así poco a poco cumplirá su más grande sueño: "Tener su propio negocio".
texts.en:
Rufina is a fighter, she is 51, single and lives in San Vicente with her family. 

She has two children who are her biggest pride and inspiration to keep getting ahead. For many years she has worked as a day laborer in the farms in the area. It has gone very well for her because she is a responsible, hard working and honest person and because over the years she has earned the respect and confidence from people. 

Rufina is thankful to the Kiva lenders because with their support she has been able to buy merchandise to start a small business selling clothes. 

This way she will have a higher income and will be able to improve the quality of life of her family.
 
Little by little she will fulfill her biggest dream: "to have her own business".

loans.use: to buy merchandise to start a small business selling clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a wider variety of clothes.

loans.name: Balabeyim

texts.en:
Balabeyim is 58 years old. She is married and has two children. Both of her children were married and little of them living with Balabeyim and her husband. She is a refugee from Fuzuli city and now lives in the Fuzuli Region, in the village of Bala Behmenli. 

For a long time, Balabeyim has been running a cafe. She offers to her customers national Azerbaijan dishes made from mutton and organic vegetables. Those foods are delicious and of good quality, and for that Balabeyim has a lot of customers. 

At present Balabeyim needs 2,100 AZN to buy products useful for her cafe. Balabeyim says, “Thanks, dear Kiva lenders, for your help and support."

loans.use: to pay for products for her cafe.

loans.name: Bonsong - Kpatari-Bugu Group

texts.en:
Kubura is an active woman of 35 years from Kpataribogu in the northern part of Ghana. Kubura is married and has five children. She is the person squatting and having a hand placed on the shea nuts in their group picture.
 
Kubura is a member of a shea nut pickers and shea butter processing group that has been doing the business over the last three years. Their group is called Bonsong - Kpatari-Bugu Women's Association. She makes good profits from the business since she and every member of her group have been trained by Grameen Ghana and Planet Finance on how to process high quality premium shea nuts and butter for Planet Finance (a shea butter marketing company) to buy and export.

Kubura and the group have asked for a loan of GHS 2,400. The share of the loan to Kubura would pay the cost of gathering six bags of shea nuts to extract shea butter.  By so doing, she would increase productivity and hence repay the loan and support her children’s educational and health needs.

loans.use: to pay the cost of gathering six bags of shea nuts to extract shea butter.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en: Nelly is self-employed from Vayk town. She lives there with her two children (one son and one daughter). Nelly's husband is an army officer and lives away from his family. Nelly has been involved in beekeeping for eight years already. As Nelly's daughter is 10 years old, only two family members (Nelly and her son) are fully engaged in beekeeping. In order to expand her agribusiness Nelly has applied for a loan of USD 3000. The requested amount will be used to buy 25 bee colonies and hives. This hard working woman needs assistance to grow her agribusiness. Let's help Nelly and her family make their goal come true. They will be grateful to all the lenders.

loans.use: to purchase 25 bee colonies and hives

loans.name: Özlem

texts.en:
Özlem is married and has two children. Her husband works in a factory. Özlem does multi-level marketing from home to her friends and neighbors. With the loan from Maya, she’ll increase the variety of her products to increase her sales and buy cosmetics. She wants to save the money she earns to open a shop. She is a hardworking and clever woman. She wants to ensure a good future for her children.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 
Özlem Hanım, evli iki çocuk annesi esi fabrikada işci olarak çalışıyor.  Özlem Hanım Network sistemiyle evinden satiş yapiyor arkadaşlarına ve komşularına ulaşıyor .  Maya'dan aldığı kredi ile ürün çeşidini artırarak satışlarını artırmayı hedefliyor ve kozmetik ürünleri alacak.  Yaptığı satışlardan para biriktirerek dükkan açmayı hedefliyor.  Çalışkan ve zeki bir kadın.  Çocuklarına iyi bir gelecek hazırlamayı istiyor.

loans.use: to buy products

loans.name: Everce

texts.en:
Everce has a retail shop in Hoima, Uganda. She is a hardworking married woman with one child, aged four years. She started business so as to take care of her basic necessities. She dreams of expanding her business into new markets although competition hinders her business.
Everce will use the loan to buy more soap, detergent and toilet paper to sell.

loans.use: to buy more soap, detergent and toilet paper  to sell.

loans.name: Fatma

texts.en:
Fatma is married and has raised two children. After they married and left home, she began buying and selling clothing and children’s wear from her home to contribute to her family’s budget as well as the national economy. She developed confidence in herself. With the loan from Maya, she’ll increase the variety of her products to grow her sales. Fatma is an example of a 50-year-old woman achieving what she sets out to.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 
Fatma Hanım, evli iki cocuk annesi. Çocuklarını yetistirmis çocukları evlenip yanından ayrıldıktan sonra evinde çamaşır ve çocuk giysileri alarak satış yapmaya başlamış. Aile ve ülke ekonomisine katkı sağlaması kendisine özguven oluşturmus.  Maya'dan kullandığı kredi ile ürün çeşidini artırıp satışlarını artırmak. Elli yaşındaki bir kadının da isterse neleri basaracağına bir örnek Fatma Hanım.

loans.use: to buy products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy another dairy cow

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
"Rebecca is 38 years old and lives in the town of Mukono in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is divorced and has three children. For the past three years, Rebecca has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells essential commodities. 

To help expand her business, Rebecca has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential goods like sugar and salt for the business, and will help Rebecca to generate greater profits and see her children in better schools. Rebecca hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business into a wholesale shop. 

Rebecca is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Rebecca who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.


"

loans.use: to buy more essential goods like sugar and salt for the business.

loans.name: Tamar

texts.en: Tamar is a 49-year-old married woman. She lives with her family in the small village of Gori district. The family owns agricultural land, where they grow different kinds of fruit to sell. Tamar decided to cultivate an unused part of the land and sow tomatoes. She requested a loan to purchase tomato seeds. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 800 GEL. Tamar will purchase tomato seeds with the received credit and she will sell the harvested tomatoes as well use some for her family. Tamar awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase tomato seeds.

loans.name: Mtvarisa

texts.en:
Mtvarisa is a 47-year-old woman from Senaki district. She isn't married and lives alone. Mtvarisa doesn't have her own business and she earns her living with the help of her daughter, who is married and has her own family. Mtvarisa has a great desire to be involved in her own business and not depend on her daughter's charity. 

Mtvarisa requested a loan from MFO Credo and was approved with the start-up program that gives people a chance to start or re-start businesses. She plans to purchase stock of clothing and various home products and will sell the products among her community at increased prices. This new business will be a really good motivator for this hard-working woman and will greatly assist her in living better. She will highly appreciate your help.

loans.use: to start a trading business with clothing and various home products.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is a 44 year-old single mother of two teenagers. She has been making detergent soap for the past year and makes a profit of KES.40,000 ,which she uses to support her family.  She has applied for her first loan of KES. 50,000 from Visionfund Kenya and intends to buy more materials for making detergents to sell to her customers.

She plans to grow her business and build a station for work in the near future.

loans.use: to buy more materials for making detergents

loans.name: Saniye

texts.en:
Saniye lives with her mother and siblings. She began working ten years ago, selling clothing for babies and children at the city market. After two years, she bought a car to go to the markets in the provinces with her mother each day. 

With her first loan, Saniye bought additional products and increased her sales. She opened a store. She is planning to use her second loan to buy goods for her store to increase her sales further and improve her position. Saniye goes to the markets four days a week, while her mother stays at the store to help her.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff

loans.use: to purchase children's clothing for resale

loans.name: Meral

texts.en:
Meral is married and the mother of two children. For 20 years, she and her husband have sold fresh flowers. She arranges the flowers and designs them in accordance with customers’ requests. She used her first loan from Maya to develop her business. She’ll use her second one to develop it as well. Her goal is to ensure a good future for her children.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 
Meral Hanım, evli iki çocuk annesi. Yirmi yıldır  eşiyle beraber canlı çicek işini yapıyor.  Çiçekleri tanzim ediyor müşteriden gelen istek üzere onları dizayn ederek satışlarını yapıyor.  Maya'dan kullandığı kredi ile islerini geliştirdi .  İkinci kredisini de kullanarak işlerini geliştirmeyi hedefliyor.  çocuklarına iyi bir gelecek hazırlamayı hedefliyor.

loans.use: to buy flowers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to make bulk purchases of shoes and clothes

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es:
La socia Alejandra se sigue dedicando al negocio de crianza de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas, la socia los hace engordar y crecer y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias y mercados, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 4 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los animales. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuyes y gallinas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member Alejandra continues working at the business of small animal raising like guinea pigs and hens. The member fattens them and makes them grow and later sells them in different fairs and markets. The member works from 8:00 AM until 6:00 PM. The member already has 4 years in this business and it's going very well for her. The member's dream is to have a storefront where she can sell the animals. The member is applying for the loan to buy guinea pigs and hens.

The member is happy for the loan and commits herself to fulfilling the installment payments.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and hens.

loans.name: Eveline

texts.en:
Eveline is married and a mother of six children. They all live in a two bedroom house in Bamenda, North West Region of Cameroon.  She has faced so many challenges in life, among which are the death of family members, sickness and general poverty.

With this new loan, she will buy three piglets, five bags of feed, a bag of fertilizer and a bag of flour. She holds a positive view of this business succeeding because she has a good side for farming.  She has been doing it for a long period of time and jointly works alongside her husband. With this business activity, the community will benefit from her moderate prices and she will sensitize the community about the importance of GHAPE.  Secondly, the waste from pigs will be used as manure,

Concerning the profit made from this loan, she will expand her farming size, pay her children's school fees and save some in order to undertake a bigger investment. She prefers a GHAPE loan because of low interest rates, convenient repayment intervals and also because the members are trained in marketing and management skills before the loans are disbursed.

loans.use: To buy piglets, feed, flour and fertilizer

loans.name: Sevgi

texts.en:
Sevgi is divorced and lives with her son. She sells flowers from a shop for weddings, engagements, and bridal arrangements. She makes and arranges her own designs. With her first loan she bought and arranged flowers to increase her business, and plans to use this loan the same way.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 
Sevgi Hanım, eşinden ayrılmıs oğlu ile beraber yaşıyor.  Yapma çiçek satışı yaptığı dukkanı var. Müşterileri yeni evlenecek çiftler.  Nikah şekeri gelin çiceği yapıyor.  Dizaynını kendisi planlayıp üretiyor.  Aldığı kredi ile çiçek alıp tanzimini gercekleştirip işini geliştiriyor.  Kullandığı ikinci kredisinde de aynı sekilde faydalanmayı düşünüyor.

loans.use: to buy artificial flower products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more kapenta (dried sardines) and fish

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase the plastic buckets in bulk.

loans.name: Omaira De Jesus

texts.es:
Omaira es una persona que siempre está dispuesta a ayudar a las personas de su comunidad en lo que necesiten. En este momento tiene a dos mujeres contratadas como operarias para trabajar en su pequeño taller de confección a terceros. Allí fabrican diferentes prendas con el objetivo de obtener ingresos para sacar a sus respectivas familias adelante.
Ella tiene el taller ubicado en una habitación de su casa, pero últimamente se ha sentido muy estrecha allí, por esta razón solicita un préstamo pues desea realizar algunas adecuaciones para trasladar su taller al segundo piso de la casa donde puede trabajar más cómodamente, adicionalmente desea comprar una maquina fileteadora para aumentar su producción y mejorar sus ventas.
Este trabajo es el único medio de ingresos que tiene y de él dependen estas dos personas, por eso quiere sacarlo adelante y no desistir de él.
texts.en:
Omaira is a person who is always available to help people in her community who need it. Currently, she has two women contracted as operators to work in her small sewing workshop for third parties. There, they make different clothes with the object of obtaining income to get their respective families ahead.

She has the workshop located in a room of her house, but lately she has felt very cramped there. For this reason, she is applying for a loan; she wants to carry out some adaptations to move her workshop to the second floor of the house where she can work more comfortably. Additionally, she wishes to buy an overlock sewing machine to increase her production and improve her sales.

This work is the only source of income that she has and these two people depend upon it, thus she wants to move forward with it and not give up on it.

loans.use: to adapt her house to locate her workshop there and to buy an overlock sewing machine.

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en:
Emilia is married and a mother of six children. They live in a four-bedroom house in the Bamenda northwest region of Cameroon.  She has faced so many challenges in life, among which is the death of her daughter who was supportive to her and her children. She is unable to send her children to school due to poverty.

With this new loan requested, she will buy manure for farm product. She will also use part of the loan to buy feed for her pigs and fertilizer to enable her crops to do well. Also she will buy piglets. She holds a positive view of this business succeeding because she has a good talent for farming; she has been doing it for a long period of time. With this business activity, the community will benefit from her moderate prices and she will share with the community the importance of GHAPE  

With the profit made from this loan, she will expand her farm size, pay her children's school fees, and save some other funds to undertake bigger investments. She prefers GHAPE loans because of the low interest rates, convenient repayment intervals, and also, because the members are trained on marketing and management skills before the loans are disbursed.

loans.use: to assist with rearing pigs and farming

loans.name: Portia

texts.en:
Portia is a 21-year-old, young woman living in the Muzarabani District of Zimbabwe. She volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide, working with students at local schools to help improve their learning and overall well-being. She also volunteers by assisting the elderly in her community. 

Portia’s ambition to become financially independent led her to rent and run a shop in a local business center, where she sells clothing, accessories, and shoes. Currently, Portia’s profits barely meet her family’s needs and she would like to expand her business. With a Kiva loan, Portia will purchase large bales of clothing to increase her stock and expand her profits. This will enable her to provide for herself and her family. Her hope is to grow the business and create employment in her community as well as further her education.

loans.use: to purchase large bales of clothing

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a widow and a mother of seven children. They live in a three bedroom house in Bamenda North West Region of Cameroon. Mary has faced so many difficulties in life, including the death of her husband, brother and sister, sickness of her mother, and poverty in her family, that caused her to drop out of school.

With the new loan requested, she will buy food such as cocoyam, yams, beans, bananas, vegetables, and vegetable oil for retail. Also, she will invest part of the loan in a small poultry farm and will buy three weeks old chicks and feed. She believes her business will succeed because she has being selling for long a time and has regular customers. With this business activity, the community will benefit from the moderate prices she will offer on the food crops. The population will not suffer malnutrition again and the distance to buy food will be reduced. She will encourage more to join the business line.
 
With the profit made from this loan, she will expand her business, pay her children's school fees, and pay bills. She will also provide medication for her family. She prefers a GHAPE loan because of the low interest rates and convenient repayment intervals, because the members are trained on marketing and management skills before the loans are disbursed, and because the social needs of the members are a concern to the organization.

loans.use: to buy cocoyams, beans, bananas, vegetables, fowl and vegetable oil.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is married and a mother of five children. They live in a three bedroom house in Bamenda North West Region of Cameroon.  She has faced so many difficulties in life some of which are the death of family members, sickness in her family, accidents and, worst of all, a civil war that caused them to stay in their house.

With the new loan requested, she will pay for her farm work such as clearing, working and weeding, buy fertilizer and will also pay for a phone, a sim card and air time to open a call box. She believes her business will succeed because she has vast and fertile farmland for the cultivation of crops, because she has regular customers that buy from her, and because her call box is located at the village square. With this business activity, the community will benefit from the moderate prices she will offer on the crops. They will also benefit from better communication through her credit transfer.

With the profit raised from this loan, she will expand her farming business, pay her children's school fees and save some. She will also provide medication for her family. She prefers a GHAPE loan because of low interest rates and convenient repayment intervals and also because the members are trained on marketing and management skills before the loans are disbursed

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seedlings, a phone and airtime

loans.name: Perihan

texts.en:
Perihan is a single mother of two children. She makes and sells baby clothes and booties from her home to provide for her family. She fills orders for acquaintances and relatives abroad. She’ll use the loan from Maya to buy thread and build up her stock to increase her sales. Her goal is to ensure a good future for her children.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 
Perihan Hanım, iki cocuk annesi eşi yok.  Evinde bebe giysi ve patik örüyor, satışını gerçekleştiriyor.  Evinin geçimini sağlıyor.  Yurtdışında çalışan tanıdık ve akrabalarından aldığı siparişleri değerlendiriyor.  Maya'dan aldığı kredi ile iplerini alarak stok yapip, üretip satışlarını artırıyor.  çocuklarına iyi bir gelecek hazırlamayı hedefliyor.

loans.use: to buy knitting supplies.

loans.name: Tiessiri Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre femmes du groupe Tiessiri  vivent toutes dans des familles nucléaires. Elles ont en moyenne 37 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier de Darsalam l’un des quartiers de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le quartier. Elles font le petit commerce d’habillement et fruits et légumes. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur  16eme cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Zénabou  (la femme assise dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse d’habillement dans le quartier et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter  5 douzaines de complets pour bébé à Bamako et à Ségou. La vente se fait au comptant et souvent à crédit à la maison, au marché  et en ambulant à  une clientèle mixte.
 Madame Zénabou  espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de 50 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé pour aider son mari et augmenter également  son fonds de commerce. Elle souhaite continuer le partenariat  avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The four women who make up the Tiessiri group all live in monogamous families.  On average, they are 37 years old and have three children each.  They all live in Darsalam, one of the neighborhoods of Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).  These women know one another through neighborhood, kinship and marriage ties and also through their income-generating activities in the neighborhood.  They are involved in small retail, selling clothes, fruits and vegetables.  In order to increase their businesses, they have decided to join Kiva's partner, Soro Yiriwaso, and they are on their 16th cycle of solidarity loan.

Zénabou (seated in the photo) is a major retailer of clothing items in and around her neighborhood.   She is planning to use her loan to buy five dozen sets of clothes for infants in Bamako and Ségou.  She sells her merchandise from home, at the market and as an itinerant seller, and is paid in cash and also often on credit.  Her customers are both men and women.

Zénabou is hoping to make an average monthly profit of 50,000 CFA francs, which will be used to help her husband and also to increase her own business.  She wants to continue her partnership with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: to buy baby clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more grocery products

loans.name: Fatma

texts.en:
Fatma is married with two children. Since her husband retired, the couple has opened a flower shop. She likes going to work and arranging the flowers. Now she devotes all of her time and energy to the store. She used her first loan from Maya to expand her business and aims to do the same with the second.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 
Fatma Hanım,evli iki çocuk annesi. Eşi emekli olduktan sonra çiçekçi dükkanı açıyorlar.  Dukkanı açtıklarında ara sıra giderken çiceklerle uğrasmak ve tanzim etmek hoşuna gidiyor.  Şimdi tüm zamanını ve enerjisini işine harcıyor.  Maya'dan aldığı kredi ile ışlerini geliştiriyor.  İkinci çektiği kredi de işlerini geliştirmeyi hedefliyor.

loans.use: to buy flowers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase groceries in bulk from wholesalers.

loans.name: Previous

texts.en: Previous is 25 years old. She is married with one child and resides in the Muzarabani District of Zimbabwe. Previous has been working as a Camfed Learner Guide, teaching life skills education in local schools to improve the well-being of students by enhancing their learning environment. In addition, Previous rents a shop at the local business center where she sells products such as bags, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, track suits, and t-shirts. She has been running this business for one year now and it has enabled her to support her family.  With the Kiva loan ,Previous will purchase additional clothing to increase her stock. Her hope is to grow the business and open her own store one day. This will bring stability to her business and will enable her to provide for her family’s basic needs.

loans.use: to  increase her stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase dried sardines in bulk.

loans.name: Edina

texts.en: Edina is a 25-year-old, married mother of one. She lives in the Muzarabani District of Zimbabwe and is a source of inspiration to young people in her community because she is determined to succeed. She often volunteers at the local secondary school as a Camfed Learner Guide facilitating study and life skills sessions. Edina operates a grocery shop at the local business center where she sells sugar, cooking oil, rice, flour, washing soap, soft drinks and snacks. She hopes to expand her business into a larger store if profits allow. She wishes to improve herself financially and give her family a higher standard of living. Her greatest hope is to see vulnerable children being cared for. Edina will use the Kiva loan to purchase her products in bulk to reduce costs as well as boost sales and profits.

loans.use: to increase her stock.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les six femmes du groupe Danaya vivent toutes dans des familles nucléaires. Elles ont en moyenne 39 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier de Bagadadji  l’un des quartiers de  Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le quartier. Elles font de la restauration et petit commerce d’habillement,de condiment. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur  2eme cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Nana (la 2eme femme debout de la gauche vers la droite dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse de farine sucrée et pâté dans le quartier et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter  2 sacs de farine au marché de Ségou. La vente se fait au comptant et souvent à crédit à la maison et au marché à  une clientèle mixte.
 Madame Nana espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de 15 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé pour des petits besoins de ses enfants et augmenter également  son fonds de commerce. Elle souhaite continuer la collaboration  avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The six women who make up the Danaya group all live in monogamous families. On average, they are 39 years old and have four children each. They all live in Bagadadji, one of the neighborhoods of Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). These women know one another through neighborhood, kinship and marriage ties and also through their income-generating activities in the neighborhood. They prepare meals and are also involved in small retail, selling clothes and condiments.  In order to increase their businesses, they have decided to join Kiva's partner, Soro Yiriwaso, and they are on their second cycle of solidarity loan.

Nana (in the standing row, second from the left, in the photo) is a major seller of sweet flour and paste in and around her neighborhood. She is planning to use her loan to buy two bags of flour at the Ségou market. She sells her merchandise from home and at the market, and is paid in cash and also often on credit. Her customers are both men and women.

Nana is hoping to make an average monthly profit of 15,000 CFA francs, which will be used to cover some of the day-to-day needs of her children, and also to increase her own business. She wants to continue her partnership with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: to buy flour.

loans.name: Phyllis

texts.en: Phyllis is a 25-year-old, single mother. She currently resides in the Muzarabani District of Zimbabwe where she operates a small clothing shop at the local business center. She started her business with the savings she made as a part-time farm laborer. She sells cosmetics, accessories, jackets, shirts, bags, and shoes. Phyllis inspires young women in her community as both a Camfed Learner Guide, who teaches students about their well-being, and as an entrepreneur. She intends to use the loan to increase her stock and improve sales by purchasing her products in bulk. An increase in income will enable her to support herself and improve her family’s well-being.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics, accessories, and clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase grocery products in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase clothes and shoes in bulk.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es:
Sandra es una mujer de 44 años de edad soltera y madre de dos hijos.
Su hijo mayor se encuentra estudiando contabilidad en un instituto superior, su hijo menor estudia en la escuela secundaria y todavía le faltan dos años para terminar. Ella es una mujer emprendedora, dentro del comercio siempre se encuentra haciendo negocios, buscando la manera de lograr su sueño; que sus hijos estudien y se preparen para el futuro.
Sandra tiene un negocio que vienen llevando hace más de 10 años, se trata de una tienda de barrio con suministros de primera necesidad, los gastos en educación superior y secundaria de sus hijos la dejaron sin capital de compra para su negocio, ella necesita comprar insumos de primera necesidad para la canasta familiar de sus clientes.
Es por ese motivo que Sandra solicita un préstamo para abastecer su tienda y continuar pagando el estudio de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Sandra is a 44-year-old woman, single and mother of two children.

Her older child is studying accounting in an institute of higher education, and her younger child is a secondary school student and still has two years until he finishes.  She is an enterprising woman, within the business, she can always be found taking care of business and looking for a way to achieve her dream: that her children study and prepare themselves for the future.

Sandra has a business that she has been running for over 10 years. It is a neighborhood store with basic necessities. Her children's education costs, in higher education and secondary school, leave her without capital to purchase goods for her store. She needs to purchase basic necessities for her customers' pantries.

For this reason, Sandra asks for a loan to stock her store and continue paying for her children's education.

loans.use: to stock her store and continue paying for her childrens' education.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her stock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more clothing and linen.

loans.name: Polite

texts.en: At the age of 24, Polite is a married mother of two children. She resides in Zimbabwe’s Buhera District where she also volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide teaching life skills education in local schools. Since 2013, Polite has been operating a grocery shop at the local town center selling popular necessities, such as cooking oil, sugar, salt and flour. She is very proud of her business since it has enabled her to support her family. With a Kiva loan, she will buy more products in bulk and expand her selection. Increased profits will help her better provide for her family and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery products.

loans.name: Precious

texts.en: Precious is 20 years old and living in Zimbabwe’s Buhera district. She is operating her own small business selling clothing at the local flea market. She also is volunteering as a Camfed learner guide in the local schools, offering guidance to students. With a Kiva loan, she plans to buy more clothing and merchandise to expand her selection and increase her profit margin. She hopes her increased profits will improve the standard of living for her family.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to sell

loans.name: Maritza Ibon

texts.es:
Maritza de 36 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato. Esta acompañada, su compañero de vida trabaja de albañil,tienen dos hijos ya adolescentes viven en casa propia.


Maritza es secretaria desde hace 17 años en un consultorio medico,empezó a trabajar porque tenia sus dos hijos pequeños y conforme van creciendo necesitan darles todo lo necesario,el trabajo le queda a unos cinco minutos de su hogar de lunes a sábado.

El préstamo lo utilizara para una operación de su hija que es muy cara. De esa forma cubrirá la necesidad de que su hija se recupere y siga con su vida normal.

El sueño de Maritza es que sus hijos tengan una mejor calidad de vida,darles el estudio hasta que ellos se ganen la vida por si solos y eso lo lograra por medio de credicampo.
texts.en:
Maritza is 36 years old and completed her secondary education. She is partnered, and her life partner works in construction. They have two adolescent children and live in their own house.

Maritza has been a secretary for 17 years in a medical clinic. She began to work because she had two small children and as they grew, she needed to give them everything necessary. The work is five minutes from her home and from Monday to Saturday.

The loan will be used to pay for an operation for her daughter, which is very expensive.  In this way she will pay for the necessity for her daughter to recover and continue with her normal life. 

Maritza's dream is that her children have a better quality of life, permit them to study until they earn their living on their own, and she will do this through Credicampo.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's operation that is very expensive.

loans.name: Izahura Twimukye Group

texts.en:
Heziron is 48 years old and married with 5 children aged between 15 and 9, and all of them attend school.

Heziron is a produce dealer who operates in arrears of Izahura and Rugashari, a rural sub county. He has been involved in this business since 1999.

He has applied for a loan through his group, Izahura Twimukye Group, to buy more agriculture produce to sell.

His dream is to complete his family house but he is challenged by limited capital and price fluctuations.

He is a hardworking and honest person who appreciates the good work done by the Kiva lenders through UGAFODE.

loans.use: To buy agricultural produce

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase her stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase grocery products in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more stock

loans.name: Tracy

texts.en: Tracy is 21 and single. She resides in the Muzarabani District of Zimbabwe. Ever since she left school she has been running a business buying and selling groceries from her homestead. She has managed to save and expand the business to the small shop that she now operates at the local business center. She serves as a Peer Educator in her community and as a Camfed Learner Guide at the local secondary school. She supplies the community with sugar, rice, tea, stationery, sanitary items, cooking oil, and potato chips. With this Kiva loan Tracy is going to make bulk purchases to reduce her costs and increase sale volume and profits. She hopes to be economically stable so that she can support her siblings through school.

loans.use: to increase her stock.

loans.name: Sekai

texts.en: Sekai is a 25-year-old, married mother of two living in Zimbabwe’s Buhera District. She is currently operating a business from her home, in which she sells sugar, salt, cooking oil, nuts, and maize. Sekai works hard to support her family through her earnings and is very proud of the progress she has made so far. In her free time she volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide, helping improve the wellbeing of students within her community. Sekai will purchase more groceries with the requested Kiva loan. This will boost her business and enable her to further her education.

loans.use: to increase her stock

loans.name: Dorotea

texts.es:
Dorotea es una mujer de 43 años de edad soltera y madre de dos hijos.
Su hijo mayor terminó sus estudios secundarios y se dedica a trabajar en el comercio, el menor este año entrará a la escuela primaria, ambos acompañan las labores de su madre en su trabajo.
Dorotea se ocupa del comercio de colchones y la venta de muebles en una feria de la ciudad de ‘El Alto’, el clima del lugar es bastante frío los rayos solares golpean muy fuerte este lugar se encuentra a una altitud de 4100 metros sobre el nivel del mar, su negocio es al aire libre y sufre todas las inclemencias del estado del tiempo.
Dorotea a trabajado de esa manera por los últimos quince años y así logra mantener a su familia, ella sueña tener su propia tienda y dejar de vender en la calle. La necesidad principal del momento es aumentar los productos a la venta, ella necesita incrementar sus ingresos para poder pagar la escuela primaria de su hijo.
Es por esos motivos que Dorotea solicita un préstamo para incrementar la oferta de muebles y colchones a la venta y con los beneficios pagar la escuela primaria de su hijo.
texts.en:
Dorotea is a 43 year old single mother of two sons. Her eldest son finished high school and makes a living working in trade. The younger one will go to primary school this year. Both help their mother in her work. 

Dorotea deals in trading mattresses and selling furniture in one of the markets in the city 'El Alto'. The climate of this location is quite cold and the sun's rays are very strong. The city is located at an altitude of 4100 meters above sea level. Her business is outside and endures all of the inclement weather. Dorotea has worked this way for the last 15 years and thus manages to support her family. She dreams of having her own store and no longer selling in the street. 

Her primary need at this time is to increase the amount of products for sale. She needs to increase her income in order to be able to pay for her son's primary school. 

Dorotea is requesting a loan in order to increase the supply of furniture and mattresses for sale and use the profits to pay for her son's primary school.

loans.use: increase the supply of furniture for sale and use the profits to pay for her son's primary school.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 27 years old and a mother of two children living in Buhera, Zimbabwe. She is currently volunteering as a Camfed Learner Guide, offering life skills education to local students.

She also operates a flea market where she sells blankets and other linens. She started the business when she realized that she could not support her children without having an extra source of income. With the Kiva loan, she intends to purchase more clothes and blankets to boost her business and create employment in her community.

loans.use: To increase her stock

loans.name: Chipo

texts.en:
At the age of 20, Chipo is living in Hurungwe District, Zimbabwe, where she volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide, teaching life skills in local schools to improve the well-being of students by enhancing their learning environment.

She started her business selling groceries six months ago. With the requested loan from Kiva, she intends to purchase more sugar, salt, cooking oil and other groceries. She would like to expand into a large retail business and create more employment in her community.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Naume

texts.en: Naume is a 25-year-old married mother of two children. She lives in the Buhera District of Zimbabwe and serves as a volunteer Learner Guide, providing life skills lessons to local school children. She is operating a poultry project at her homestead selling broiler chickens. With a Kiva loan, she intends to build a large, fenced building for her chicks to produce larger quantities of broiler chicks. Increasing her income will help improve her quality of life and help pay for her children’s education.

loans.use: to build a fenced chicken run

loans.name: Cathrine

texts.en: Catherine is a 19-year-old living in Zimbabwe’s Buhera District. As a clothing merchant at a local flea market, Catherine sells shirts, shoes, pants and other items. On top of that she also volunteers as a Learner Guide at the local school teaching life skills to students. With a Kiva loan she wants to boost her business by purchasing jeans, shoes, shirts, skirts, blouses and suits in bulk quantities to increase her profit margin. This would take Catherine one step closer to achieving her dream of opening her own shop and creating employment in the community.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing products in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more spares for her truck.

loans.name: Nyasha

texts.en:
Nyasha, 19 years old, is an active member of Cama, Camfed’s alumnae network. She lives in Hurungwe district in Zimbabwe, where she is involved in her community. Nyasha has been working as a Camfed learner guide teaching life skills education in local schools to improve the well-being of students by enhancing their learning environment. She also runs a business selling eggs. She earns a small amount of money and profits. Nyasha has been running her business for the past 8 months now. 

With the requested Kiva loan, Nyasha wants to purchase more eggs to expand her business and her profits. She is expecting to raise more profits through this loan. She wants to earn money so that she can look after herself and help needy people.

loans.use: To purchase more eggs to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more clothes for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more chicks and chick feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more chicks and chick feeds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more chicks and chick feed.

loans.name: Top Clan Group

texts.en:
Top Clan is a group consisting of five members, all of whom are women. These entrepreneurs are very humble, hardworking, and responsible people with good manners and lots of enthusiasm to improve their lives. They are selling general goods, provisions, cosmetics, and soft drinks.

One of the members is Gifty, who was selected as the featured borrower of this group. Gifty is a 42-year-old lady living with her husband and her two children, who are attending school. She runs a general store to help her husband financially. She sells rice, grains, lentils, edible oils, spices, biscuits, soap, detergent, hair oil, etc. in her shop. She has developed a very good relationship with her customers in the city. 

Gifty has a plan to make her shop bigger and keep multiple things in her shop to satisfy her customers. She also wants to purchase the items for her shop in bulk, directly from the wholesalers. For this reason, she has requested a loan to purchase items like toothbrushes, toothpaste, soft drinks, wheat flour, grains, and other household consumables.

loans.use: to buy rice, grains, lentils, edible oils, spices, biscuits, soap, detergent, hair oil, etc. to sell to customers

loans.name: Melody

texts.en:
Melody is 25 years old and is already a successful entrepreneur. She is volunteering as a Camfed Learner Guide under the Better World Program, which teaches students about their well-being. She lives in the Hurungwe District of Zimbabwe where she has been successfully operating a poultry project that she started a year ago. She has managed to employ one person to assist her since she started.

With the requested loan, Melody intends to buy more broiler concentrate, broiler starter mash, and chemicals to prevent diseases to reduce loss. She also wishes to increase her sales volume and profits.  She hopes to expand into a large business and create employment in her community. Her desire is also to upgrade her life and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase more broiler starter mash and chicks

loans.name: Life

texts.en: Life is a 30-year-old mother of three. She resides in Buhera District, Zimbabwe with her family. She is currently operating a gardening business from her home, selling vegetables such as tomatoes and onions. Life volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide, helping improve the well-being of students through life skills education. With the Kiva loan, Life will purchase more seeds and supplies for her garden. This will greatly improve production and increase her income. She also plans to use the profits for her children’s school fees.

loans.use: to purchase more seeds and supplies for her garden

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
She is a widow and a mother of six children. They live in a three bedroom house in Bamenda North West Region of Cameroon. She has faced so many difficulties in life, a few to mention are sickness of her family members, disrespect from her first daughter and the death of her husband.

With the new loan requested, she will buy yam seedlings, manure and feed and will also rent a piece of farm land. She believes her business will succeed because she has a vast and fertile farm land for the cultivation of crops. She has regular customers that buy from her. With this business activity, the community will benefit from her moderate prices she will offer on the crops. 

With the profit raised from this loan, she will expand her farming business, pay her children's school fees, save some and dig a good pit toilet for her family. She will also provide medication for her family. She prefers GHAPE loan because of low interest rates, convenient repayment intervals and also the members are trained in marketing and management skills before the loans are disbursed

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seedlings, and part used to buy a phone and airtime

loans.name: Kotognontala Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre femmes du groupe Kotognontala  vivent toutes dans des familles nucléaires. Elles ont en moyenne 30 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier de Sebougou l’un des quartiers de  Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le quartier. Elles font petit le commerce de produit cosmétique, artisanal  et de fruit et légume. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur  2eme cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Nana (la 1ere femme debout de la gauche vers la droite dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse de produit cosmétique dans le quartier et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter  3 douzaines de parfums smart et 2 douzaines de pommade bébé et maman à Ségou. La vente se fait au comptant et souvent à crédit à la maison, au marché et en ambulant à  une clientèle mixte.
 Madame Nana espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de 15 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé pour aider son mari et augmenter également  son fonds de commerce. Elle souhaite continuer la collaboration  avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The four women who make up the Kotognontola group all live in monogamous families. On average, they are 30 years old and have four children each. They all live in Sebougou, one of the neighborhoods of Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). These women know one another through neighborhood, kinship and marriage ties and also through their income-generating activities in the neighborhood. They are involved in small retail, selling cosmetic products, handicrafts, fruits and vegetables.  In order to increase their businesses, they have decided to join Kiva's partner, Soro Yiriwaso, and they are on their second cycle of solidarity loan.

Nana (first from the left in the photo) is an important seller of cosmetic products in and around her neighborhood. She is planning to use her loan to buy three dozen perfumes (Smart Collection) and two dozen creams for infants and young mothers.  She will buy these products in Ségou.  She sells her merchandise from home and at the market, and is paid in cash and also often on credit. Her customers are both men and women.

Thanks to this loan, Nana is hoping to make an average monthly profit of 15,000 CFA francs, which will be used to help her husband, and also to increase her own business. She would like to continue her partnership with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products.

loans.name: Tariro

texts.en: Tariro is 28 years old and living in Zimbabwe’s Buhera District. To earn a living, she sells clothing at a local flea market. In her spare time, Tariro also volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide at the local secondary school, teaching life skills. She started her business in 2013. With this Kiva loan, she will purchase clothes, jewelry, and shoes to eventually build her own shop. She also wants to create employment in her community while elevating her own standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase more stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more clothes and bags

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is an entrepreneur from Armavir town. She lives there with her husband. This couple owns a small cafe in the neighborhood of their house. Jointly with her husband, Aida has been engaged in a cafe business for 20 years already. They now want to expand it a little bit by making some investments. Aida has taken a loan from a financial institution before, but because of the family's poor conditions, she wasn't able to pay it back.
