However, over these years of tireless work, she was able to own her cafe, which is profitable enough to cover monthly payments. 

Aida has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have bad credit history behind them and have no access to credit products. With the loan's help, she will buy new chairs and tables, as well as purchase food and drinks. This cafe is the only revenue source for Aida and her husband. They really hope to receive support from the lenders. Let's help this hard working family sustain their business and grow it further.

loans.use: to pay for chairs, tables, and to buy food and drinks

loans.name: Ulita

texts.en: Ulita is a 23-year-old, young woman living in the Buhera District of Zimbabwe. She is an aspiring entrepreneur running a small grocery shop at the local business center. She sells products such as rice, sugar, cooking oil, bread, sweets, and flour. Ulita volunteers at the local secondary school as a Camfed Learner Guide, teaching life skills to students and encouraging them to stay in school. With the Kiva loan she will purchase more supplies to boost her business and improve her current standard of living.

loans.use: to increase her stock

loans.name: Pariseyi Group

texts.fr:
Les six femmes du groupe Pariseyi vivent toutes dans des familles nucléaires. Elles ont en moyenne 30 ans et 3  enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier de Sebougou l’un des quartiers de  Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le quartier. Elles font petit le commerce de boisson sucrée, de restauration et de condiment. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur  1er cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Odile (la 1ere femme debout de la gauche vers la droite dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse de boisson de sucrée dans le quartier et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 7 casiers de boisson sucrée  chez les fournisseurs au marché de Ségou. La vente se fait au comptant et souvent à crédit à la maison et au marché  à  une clientèle mixte.
 Madame Odile  espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de 17 500 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé pour aider son mari et augmenter également  son fonds de commerce. Elle souhaite continuer la collaboration  avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The six women who make up the Pariseyi group all live in monogamous families. On average, they are 30 years old and have three children each. They all live in Sebougou, one of the neighborhoods of Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). These women know one another through neighborhood, kinship and marriage ties and also through their income-generating activities in the neighborhood. They are involved in small retail, selling soft drinks and condiments, and preparing meals. In order to increase their businesses, they have decided to join Kiva's partner, Soro Yiriwaso, and they are on their first cycle of solidarity loan.

Odile (standing first from the left in the photo) is an important seller of soft drinks in and around her neighborhood. She is planning to use her loan to buy seven crates of soft drinks from suppliers at the Ségou market. She sells her goods from home and at the market, and is paid in cash and also often on credit. Her customers are both men and women.

Thanks to this loan, Odile is hoping to make an average monthly profit of 17,500 CFA francs, which will be used to help her husband, and also to increase her own business. She would like to continue her partnership with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks.

loans.name: Francisco Antonio

texts.es:
Francisco proviene de una humilde familia de carpinteros y ebanistas del municipio de Sincelejo, desde que era un niño ayudaba a su padre a trabajar en un taller de carpintería realizando trabajos de limpieza y mandados; poco a poco fue aprendiendo y evolucionando en este oficio consiguiendo su propio capital para trabajar. Un día decidió ser independiente y empezar a comprar sus propias herramientas de trabajo con las cuales ha podido progresar y salir adelante.
El solicita un préstamo para la compra de materia prima como triplex y pagar mano de obra; esto es porque tiene un pedido bastante grande por un cliente y quiere poder fidelizarlo.
Hoy en día es un joven muy trabajador y dedicado con grandes sueños como el de poder sacar sus carpintería adelante y ayudar a sus padres en todo lo que necesiten.
texts.en: Francisco comes from a humble family of carpenters and cabinetmakers from the municipality of Sincelejo. Since he was a child, he has helped his father in a carpentry workshop by cleaning and running errands. Little by little he kept learning and evolving in this trade acquiring his own capital for work. One day he decided to become independent and to begin to buy his own tools so that he could progress and move forward. He is requesting a loan to purchase raw materials and pay for labor because he has a fairly large request from a client and wants to be able to gain their loyalty. Francisco is a hardworking and dedicated youth with big dreams of being able to move forward with his carpentry and help his parents with whatever they need.

loans.use: purchase raw materials and pay for labor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more stock

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en: Patricia is an 18-year-old, young woman living in the Buhera District of Zimbabwe. She inspires other young women by successfully running her general store at the local town center. She sells products such as rice, sugar, cooking oil, bread, sweets, and flour. Patricia volunteers at the local secondary school as a Camfed Learner Guide, teaching life skills to students to improve their well-being. With the Kiva loan, she will purchase stock in bulk so she can increase her profits and boost her business. Higher profits and income will improve her current standard of living and help her become more financially independent.

loans.use: to increase her stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase the production of chickens

loans.name: Eter

texts.en:
Eter, who is a 39-year-old widowed woman, lives in small village Kvakhvreli, Gori district. She has one daughter (a student) and one school-aged son. Eter was unable to attain a high level of education, one of the reason why she can't find a stable job. To take care her family's increased needs Eter started working abroad. She goes to Turkey and is involved in private activities. She generates insignificant income. Also the work is really hard for her, considering that she is away from her children during the week. 

Eter decided to start her own activity in her hometown and requested a loan to assist. Her application was approved by the joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The initiative gives poor people, like Eter, who don't have access to the major bank products, a chance to start or re-start businesses. Eter was approved with the loan of 850 USD for purchasing a motorized quadrocycle and then rent it with private orders.

The family will receive an additional source of income and will more effectively meet daily expenses. Eter and her children rely on the goodwill of lenders and will highly appreciate your help.

loans.use: to purchase a motorized quadrocycle and rent it out

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more chicks and expand her fowl run

loans.name: Enia

texts.en: Enia is a 30-year-old, married mother of two living in the Buhera District of Zimbabwe. She is operating a general store, selling items including salt, flour, and sugar. She got the money to start her business from her husband, but she is looking to contribute monetarily to the family herself. With a Kiva loan, she will purchase more salt, flour, sugar and other inventory to increase her profits and improve her family's quality of life. Enia has a strong desire to make her community a safe place for youth. With this in mind, she also volunteers as a Learner Guide, providing guidance and lessons on life skills to youth in her village.

loans.use: to increase her stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more farming inputs .

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more stock for her shop to maximize potential profits

loans.name: Wongai

texts.en: Wongai is a 21-year-old, married mother of one. She resides in Zimbabwe’s Buhera District where she earns her living selling fish. Wongai also volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide, providing support to young students. With a Kiva loan, Wongai intends to grow her business by increasing the stock she has available for sale. Increasing her income will benefit the whole family and help her pay for the school fees for her child’s education.

loans.use: to purchase more stock

loans.name: Top Class 2 Group

texts.en:
The Top Class 2 group consists predominantly of women. They are on average 47 years old with two children. They all live in Chorkor, one of the neighborhoods of Accra, and became acquainted through neighborhood ties.

Group members are small retail merchants dealing in all kinds of foodstuffs, underwear, cassava dough and gari (cassava flour).

To increase their stock supply, the group decided to work with ID-Ghana and are in their fourth group loan cycle. 

Irene has a great reputation at selling foodstuffs. She intends to use her loan to buy foodstuffs to sell to customers from the wholesale market.

Irene hopes to achieve with this loan a good monthly profit to be reinvested in the business. She aims to buy a plot of land for residential use through her relationship with ID-Ghana.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs to sell to customers.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a 25-year-old young single mother of one living in the Buhera District of Zimbabwe. She is operating a flea market stand where she sells products such as suits, shirts and hats. Alice has also been volunteering as a Learner Guide, teaching life skills education in local schools.

With a Kiva loan she will purchase more clothing to increase her range of products. She also wants to open her own shop and create employment. This increase in profits will help to improve her standard of living and educate her son.

loans.use: To purchase more stock.

loans.name: Medeune

texts.en:
Medeune is a 22-year-old business woman. She lives in the Hurungwe District of Zimbabwe. She is also a member of Cama, Camfed’s alumnae network of school graduates. Through Cama, Medeune supports young rural women with life skills. She had been successfully operating a clothing business for over a year.   

With the requested loan from Kiva, Medeune intends to make bulk purchases of clothes and shoes to reduce costs and boost her sales volume and profits. With additional profit, she hopes to expand into a large retail business, create even more employment in her community and provide for her family’s basic needs.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 27 years old, married and has two children. She lives in the Buhera District of Zimbabwe where she operates a poultry business from her home. The business management training she has received from Camfed has helped Alice successfully operate her business and support her family. She also volunteers as a Learner Guide teaching life skills to local students. 

With the requested Kiva loan she will buy more chicks, feed and supplies to increase her revenue. The additional income will help her grow the business and improve her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase more chicks and chick feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more chick feeds and chicks

loans.name: Ivy

texts.en:
Ivy of Hurungwe district in Zimbabwe is a member of Cama, Camfed’s alumnae network. She is a volunteer Learner Guide who provides life skills coaching through the My Better World program. She is married with one child and she is 18 years old. 

To support herself and her child, she sells school stationery such as books, pens and also food including biscuits, drinks, sugar, rice, cooking oil and soap. Ivy started her business last year as a mobile trader. 

With the requested Kiva loan, Ivy will finish building her shop and purchase more stock. She hopes that this will bring stability to her business as well as improve sales and profits.

loans.use: To purchase more stock.

loans.name: Mitchel

texts.en:
Mitchel is 21 years of age and living in Zimbabwe’s Buhera District. She is successfully operating a poultry business in her village. Mitchel is also volunteering as a Camfed Leaner Guide assisting students in her community by teaching life skills and helping with their studies. 

With a Kiva loan, she will purchase more broiler chicks along with the feed and supplies needed to raise them. This will help her increase her sales and allow her to serve more customers. She also wants to buy a stand at a nearby business center. Her business success will help her to become more financially independent and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase more chicks and chick feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more bread, eggs, cooking oil and biscuits.

loans.name: Merlin

texts.en:
At the young age of 19, Merlin is already a successful entrepreneur who has worked hard to set up her poultry business in Hurungwe District, Zimbabwe. Merlin is a member of Cama, Camfed’s alumnae network. As a Cama member, she encourages self-directed learning in local schools. 

She is operating a poultry business, which she started in 2013. She produces over 65 birds every six week cycle and would very much love to improve her production. 

With the requested Kiva loan Merlin intends to purchase more broiler chicks, feed and chemicals. She hopes to expand her business and be able to supply local supermarkets with chickens. Merlin will also use the proceeds from her business to further her education.

loans.use: To purchase more broiler chicks, feed and chemicals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her stock.

loans.name: Nyasha

texts.en:
Nyasha is a 27-year-old single mother of one, residing in the Buhera District of Zimbabwe. Nyasha rents a table at the local flea market where she sells clothing such as skits, trousers, and shirts. She has also been volunteering as a Learner Guide teaching life skills education in local schools.

With a Kiva loan Nyasha will purchase clothing in bulk to resell at higher profit margins. Her increased income will help her provide for her child and become more financially independent.

loans.use: To purchase more stock.

loans.name: Precious

texts.en:
Precious is a 22-year-old young lady who resides in the Hurungwe district of  Zimbabwe. She volunteers in her community and school as a member of Camfed’s alumnae network. She offers life and leadership skills and guidance and counseling to children in her community. Currently, she is a mobile trader selling clothes and groceries. She has successfully run this business for a year.

She requests a Kiva loan to purchase stock items for her business and open her own shop to bring stability to her business. She intends to use the proceeds from the business to further her education.

loans.use: to purchase stock items for her business and open her own shop to bring stability to her business.

loans.name: Choice

texts.en:
Choice is a 27-year-old married mother of three. She lives in the Buhera District of Zimbabwe where she in an entrepreneur who operates a stand at a local flea market selling clothing. She loves her business and would like to see it expand with the support of a loan from Kiva. 

With a Kiva loan, Choice will purchase jeans, shoes, shirts, blouses and suits to sell to local customers. She also hopes to open her own shop and create employment in her community. By creating employment in the community, Choice is working to break the cycle of poverty that is very common in her rural village. Her increased income will help improve her standard of living and pay for her three children’s education.

loans.use: To increase her stock.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a 20 year old married woman with one child. She resides in Buhera  District, Zimbabwe. She is operating a flea market (buying and selling monarch, blankets, clothes, jeans, t-shirts, shorts etc.) at local shopping centre. She is a learner Guide at local Secondary School. 

With the Kiva loan she is planning to boost her flea market stall and to improve her educational level standard.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing for resale.

loans.name: Nyashadzashe

texts.en:
Nyashadzashe is young woman living in the Hurungwe District of Zimbabwe. She is volunteering as a member of Cama, Camfed’s alumnae network, as a Learner Guide who teaches students valuable life skills. She offers life and leadership skills in her community.  

As the primary breadwinner in her family, she is working hard at her poultry business, producing 50 chickens per cycle. Nyashadzashe has been successfully running her poultry project and would love to see it grow. With the Kiva loan she intends to purchase more chick feed, chicks and vaccines. This will improve production considerably.

loans.use: To purchase more chick feed, chicks and vaccines.

loans.name: Tracy

texts.en:
Tracy is a young lady aged 23 living in Hurungwe district, Zimbabwe. Over the last year, she has grown her poultry business to its current capacity – producing about 50 broiler birds every six weeks and selling them to the local residents. 

With the requested Kiva loan, Tracy wants to purchase more chickens and chick feed. She looks forward to expanding her business in the near future.

loans.use: To purchase more broiler chicks.

loans.name: Marcelene

texts.en:
Marcelene is a 19-year-old single mother with one child. She resides in the Buhera District of Zimbabwe and operates a poultry project raising broiler chickens to help feed her community. 

She is also a volunteer Learner Guide teaching life skills education in the local schools.

She will use a Kiva loan to purchase more broiler chicks, feed, and supplies. This will help to increase her production and revenue. She wishes to better provide for herself and child and to become financially independent.

loans.use: to purchase  chicks and  feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more braids, weaves and hair relaxers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more broiler chicks and chick feed.

loans.name: Maggie

texts.en:
At age 19, Maggie is an active member of Cama, Camfed’s alumnae network of graduates. Through this network, she is a volunteer Learner Guide in Hurungwe district of Zimbabwe where she teaches students life skills. She started her poultry project in 2013. Over the last year, she has grown her poultry business to its current capacity – producing about 47 broiler birds every six weeks and selling them to the local residents.

Maggie is requesting a loan to purchase more chick feed and chicks. She intends to boost her business. With her additional profits, Maggie wishes to further her education, send her siblings to school and improve the standard of living for her family. Her desire is to improve the well-being of her community by giving back. As time moves on, her wish is to expand her poultry business.

loans.use: To purchase more chicks.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a 20-year-old entrepreneur living in Hurungwe District, Zimbabwe. She is a member of Cama, Camfed’s alumnae network, who volunteers at her local Secondary School. Caroline has been working as a Camfed Learner Guide, teaching life skills education in local schools to improve the well-being of students by enhancing their learning environment.

She started her business as a mobile trader, buying and selling clothes. She is requesting a loan so that she can purchase more bags, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, track suits, and t-shirts to increase her supplies. Her hope is to grow the business and open her own store. This will bring stability to her business and will enable her to provide for her family’s basic needs. Her desire is to expand into a large boutique.

loans.use: To purchase more bags, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, track suits, and t-shirts to increase her supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more stock to increase sales and profits.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more chicks and chick feeds.

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana is a 49-year-old married woman from the village of Rukhi. She has a husband, 2 daughters and a son. Svetlana's husband works at a block factory and earns 300 GEL monthly. Her daughter works  in a nuts factory and earns an insignificant salary. The family doesn't have any other source of income to meet daily costs, so they find it hard to earn a living. 

Svetlana has a great desire to support the family's welfare and start her own business. She requested 2,000 GEL to purchase various kind of fruits and vegetables for resell.   She has already rented a counter at a good location at the local market and will sell her products at a good price. 

The family's income will significantly increase because of this new activity and they will be able more easily cover daily expenses. Svetlana will get an  opportunity to have a better lifestyle for her family and expand her business in the future. 

She awaits your support.

loans.use: to start a retail  fruits and vegetable business.

loans.name: Bridget

texts.en:
Bridget is a 22-year-old married mother with one child. She lives in Zimbabwe’s Buhera District where she volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide at her local secondary school.  She assists students with their studies. 

To support her child, Briget sells pay-as-you-go data cards and calling minutes for mobile phones.  This is a very popular business in Africa. She will use the loan to increase her supply of cards and serve more customers. More income will help to  improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to increase her stock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase stock items for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more stock.

loans.name: Lamzira

texts.en:
Lamzira is a 24-year-old young woman from the village  if Kortskheli. Her family is from occupied Georgia and their main income is government assistance for displacement. This income is insignificant for a 6 member-family and the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Lamzira is a hard working and motivated woman.  She wishes to improve her family's living condition and start an income-generating business. She requested 1,000 GEL to start a retail business to sell kitchen utensils and blankets. She will purchase products at wholesale prices  and then sell them at increased prices to her villagers. 

This new business will give her a chance to satisfy the family's basic needs and will be a great support for them. Lamzira will do her best to reach her main goal and improve her children's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase  kitchen utensils and blankets.

loans.name: Mavis

texts.en:
Mavis is a 21-year-old single woman who lives in the Buhera District of Zimbabwe.  

Since 2012, she has sold clothing at the local flea market. She sells jeans, shoes, hats, socks and other articles. Mavis is also a volunteer Learner Guide at the local school and offers help and support to students with their studies.

Mavis  will purchase bulk quantities of clothing to increase her supplies and boost her profit margin. Her hope is to grow the business and open her own store. This will bring stability to her business and will enable her to provide for her family’s basic needs.

loans.use: to increase her stock.

loans.name: Rosa Victoria

texts.es:
Rosa es una joven emprendedora, tiene 21 años de edad, es soltera y vive en San Juan de Miraflores junto a su familia.
Actualmente está estudiando la carrera de Medicina Humana en la Universidad, le va muy bien, es una joven muy inteligente
Desde hace casi un año se dedica a la venta de calzados en un pequeño negocio que inició con mucho esfuerzo, a su corta edad se ha convertido en una persona exitosa y le va muy bien tanto en el trabajo como en la Universidad.
Rosa está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mercadería para poder surtir el negocio de venta de calzados, de esta manera obtendrá mayores ingresos que podrá utilizarlo para ampliar el negocio
texts.en:
Rosa is a young entrepreneur aged 21. She is single and lives with her family in San Juan de Miraflores. She is currently studying for a degree in human medicine at university, which is going very well, as she is a very intelligent young woman. She has been working selling shoes for one year, a small business that she started with a lot of effort. At a young age she has become a successful person, and both her work and her university studies are progressing well.

Rosa is grateful to Kiva lenders because, with their support, she will be able to buy goods to stock her shoe shop. In this way, she will be able to earn more money, which she can use to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy goods for her shoe shop.

loans.name: Esmie

texts.en:
Esmie is a 19-year-old volunteer Learner Guide who teaches students life skills in Hurungwe District, Zimbabwe. She has also run a small poultry project for over a year. She has grown her poultry business to its current capacity which produces about 60 broiler birds every six weeks.  She sells them to the local residents. 

Esmie intends to purchase chicks, feed and drugs in order to expand her project. Her dream is to create employment in her community.

loans.use: to increase production.

loans.name: Evidence

texts.en:
Evidence is a 19-year-old young woman living in the Buhera District of Zimbabwe. Evidence raises and sells goats to provide food for her community. She is also a volunteer Learner Guide who provides assistance and support to local schoolchildren.

She will use the load to add to her herd and purchase the supplies needed to care for and raise the goats for market. Her increased income will help her to become more financially independent and continue to contribute positively to her community.

loans.use: to purchase goats.

loans.name: Irene Winnie

texts.en:
Winnie is a single mother of 2 children. She resides in the Hurungwe district of Zimbabwe. She is a volunteer Learner Guide in her local school  and delivers study and life skills sessions. 

She operates a small business to sell clothes at the local market. She will use the loan to purchase more clothes, shoes and bags to increase sales and profits. This will greatly improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes.

loans.name: Carlota

texts.es:
La socia Carlota  se sigue dedicando al negocio de crianza de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas,la socia tambien sigue vendiendo verduras como cebollas,zanahorias y tomates, la socia los hace engordar y crecer y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias y mercados, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 4 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los animales. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuyes y gallinas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Carlota works in her business breeding small animals such as guinea-pigs and chickens, which she raises and fattens to sell later at different fairs and markets. She also sells vegetables such as onions, carrots and tomatoes. She works from 8 am to 6 pm. She has already had her business for 4 years, and it is going very well. Her dream is to have premises where she can sell her animals.

Carlota is asking for a loan to buy guinea-pigs and chickens. She is happy because of the loan and promises to make repayments according to the loan agreement.

loans.use: to buy guinea-pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Moleen

texts.en:
Moleen is 25 years old and a married woman with one child.  She resides in Hurungwe district, Zimbabwe. Moleen has been volunteering as a Camfed learner guide, teaching life skills education in local schools to improve the well-being of students by enhancing their learning environment.  She an active member of Cama, Camfed’s alumnae network, who act as a referral point for the needy in the community.

In addition, Moleen rents a table at the local flea market, where she sells products such as bags, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, track suits, and T-shirts. Her mother helps her in her business when she is absent. She has been running this business for almost 6 months now, and it has enabled her to support her family.  

With this Kiva loan, Moleen will purchase bags, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, track suits, and T-shirts to increase her supplies. Her hope is to grow the business and open her own store. This will bring stability to her business and will enable her to provide for her family’s basic needs.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Lamzira

texts.en:
Lamzira is a 45-year-old married woman from the village of Tezeri. She lives with her husband, son, and daughter. 

The family grows beans and corn on a small plot of land. Lamzira's husband sells these seasonal products and earns an  insignificant income.  Lamzira earns additional incomen as a public school custodian. 

This income can't satisfy even basic needs and it's hardly enough to cover all daily expenses. They require some assistance to reach the normal living standard. Lamzira requested a loan to make her current business more productive and to start another business. She plans to sell fruits and vegetables locally. She will sell fresh products from her house and will have her own costumers. 

She is a very enthusiastic and hard working person with a great desire to have better living conditions. This loan will be a support for the family. 

Lamzira is thankful to Kiva Lenders for giving her a chance to increase her income.

loans.use: To start a fruit and vegetable business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fish.

loans.name: Primrose

texts.en:
Primrose is 21years old abd lives in Zimbabwe’s Hurungwe District. She is happily married with one child. 

Primrose is interested in sharing life skills with other young ladies as a member of Cama, Camfed’s alumnae network. When she is not volunteering as a Cama member, Primrose has successfully operated a poultry project for over a year. She employes one person to assist her in this project. She rises 30 broiler chicks per cycle  and desires to raise more.

With the requested Kiva loan, she will buy more chicks, feed and vaccines. Her desire is to expand her project and make more profits so that she will be able to help needy children and take care of her family. She also hopes to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy chicks, feed and vaccines.

loans.name: Brantina

texts.en:
Brantina is a 21-year-old entrepreneur who lives in the Hurungwe district of Zimbabwe. She is a Camfed Learner Guide who volunteers at community schools and teaches life skills to students. 

Last year, she expanded her poultry business to produce about 60 broiler birds every six weeks.  She sells them to the local residents. She started the business in 2013 because she wanted to be financially independent.

She intends to use the loan to purchase more chicks and feed and expand her business. With the proceeds from the business, she intends to pay school fees for her younger sister.

loans.use: to increase the production of broiler chicks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase seeds, pesticides and a fence.

loans.name: Kalala

texts.en: Kalala is 51 years old and married with four children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 11 years. Kalala needs a loan to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gum boots and a spade. She has been a member of SPBD since 2003. Kalala will use the profits from her sales to pay for her families weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gum boots and a spade.

loans.name: Anasitasia Vee

texts.en: Anasitasia is a 30-year-old married woman with two children. She runs a small bakery in her community to earn a living. She has two years of experience with this business. Anasitasia needs a loan to buy bags of flour, sugar, yeast, cooking oil, baking trays, icing sugar, butter and a large stove. She plans to use her profits to pay for her families weekly expenses. Anasitasia has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, sugar, yeast, cooking oil, baking trays, icing sugar, butter and a large stove.

loans.name: Rutendo

texts.en:
At the age of 19, Rutendo lives in the Hurungwe district of Zimbabwe. As a member of Cama, Camfed’s alumnae network, she volunteers to help the needy in her community. Rutendo has been working as a Camfed learner guide, teaching life skills education in local schools to improve the well-being of students by enhancing their learning environment. 

Rutendo is running a poultry business, producing 50 chickens every cycle. With this Kiva loan, Rutendo intends to purchase more chicks, chick feed and vaccines. Her dream is to upgrade her standard of living and further her education.

loans.use: To purchase more chicks, chick feed and vaccines.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her stock.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 23-year-old  married woman who lives in the Buhera District of Zimbabwe. 

Mary raises poultry and produces about 100 broiler chickens every six weeks. She sells them to the local residents. She also volunteers as a Leaner Guide at community schools and provides lessons on life skills.

She will use the loan to purchase broiler chicks, feed, and supplies. She hopes to expand her business, increase her income, provide a better life  for her family, and create financial stability.

loans.use: to purchase  stock items.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is married and has four children. They live in a five bedroom house in Bamenda North West Region of Cameroon.  She has faced many challenges in including the death of her sister, her father, and her brother.

She requests a loan to buy beans, corn, and yams for her restaurant.  She will also buy more plates. She plans to invest part of the loan to sell a variety of drinks in her bar. 

She believes that her business will succeed because she has a good business location and regular customers.  She has worked in this business for a long time. The community benefits from her moderate prices and has the convenience to buy locally produced cooked food and drinks.

She will use the profit to expand her business, pay her children's school fees, save for future investments, and provide medicine for her family. She prefers GHAPE loans because of their low interest rates, convenient repayment intervals, and available training opportunities.

loans.use: to buy food, drinks and firewood.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher is a married man with 1 child. He describes himself as determined and courageous. 

He operates a transportation  business to transports goods using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located in an area with small scale traders and his primary customers are small scale. 

His biggest business challenge is operating the business during the rainy season. He will use 20,000 KES to buy another motorcycle. His business goal is to expand within 5 years. 

This is his first loan with SMEP Micro finance Bank.

loans.use: tobuy another motorcycle.

loans.name: Adela Isabel

texts.es:
Adela, es una mujer de hogar, vive junto a su familia, cada día se dedica al cuidado de su hijo; con la aspiración de apoyar en los gastos de su hogar, hace un año emprendió su propio negocio el cual consiste en venta de ropa y diferentes artículos por catálogo, lo hace casa por casa, todos los días, por su facilidad no representa riesgos y puede estar al pendiente de su familia.
Utilizará el préstamo en la compra de variedad de ropa, lociones, cremas, tratamientos, mascarillas, labiales, sombras, entre otros productos que son parte de los diferentes pedidos con los que cubrirá las demandas de sus clientes, espera tener buenos resultados para progresar poco a poco.
Su sueño es tener un negocio más estable para resarcir su deuda y asegurarle a su hijo un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Adela is a housewife and lives with her family. Each day she takes care of her son. With the ambition of helping with the household expenses, last year she launched her own business, which consists of selling clothing and various catalog items. She does it each day from house to house. Because of her ability, it does not involve risks and she can be watching out for her family.

She will use the loan to buy a variety of clothing, lotions, creams, treatments, face packs, lipsticks, eye shadows and other products which make up the various orders requested by her customers. She hopes to have good results so that she can move forward little by little.

Her dream is to have a more stable business in order to pay off her debt and ensure a better future for her son.

loans.use: To buy a variety of clothing, lotions, creams, treatments, face packs, lipsticks, eye shadows and other products.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
$1000 is offered to Rosita  to improve her business. She has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day. She will buy some additional supplies such as  Fanta, Coca Cola, Sprite. oils, candles, noodles, water, fish, rice, milk, sugar, coffee and cigarettes. She has been involving in this business  since 2002. She feels so comfortable to run her business because she can earn money every day.

Running a business has made Rosita independent because she can be responsible for herself and also helping her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy Fanta, Coca Cola,  Sprite, oils, candles, noodles, water, fish, rice, milk, sugar, coffee and cigarettes.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary has a salon in Hoima, Uganda. She is a single, hardworking woman with four children between the ages of 22 and 16. She started her business so as to educate her children. She dreams of expanding her business into a modern salon providing bridal services that will increase her customers and income at large. However, seasonal customers (there tend to be many at Christmas and Easter) plus competition are still the challenges.

Rosemary will use this loan to buy more cosmetics, braids and shoes to sell.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics, braids and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.en: Saturnina is taking a loan of $800 to improve her business. She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy corn, beans, tomatoes, capsicum, onions and  garlic. She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $600.00. She is a hard working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy corn, beans, tomatoes, capsicum, onions and garlic.

loans.name: Langela

texts.en:
Langela is 19 years old and lives in Hurungwe District of Zimbabwe. She is a member of Cama, Camfed’s alumnae network. She volunteers and teaches life skills to students. 

She has raised broiler chicks  for 3 months to earn a living.  She does not have employees because she does not have enough money to pay for them at this point in time. 

Her poultry business produces about 55 broiler birds every six weeks.  She sells them to the local residents. 

She will use the Kiva loan to grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase more chicks.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.en: Manuel is 21 years old and taking up computer programming at St. Paul Colleges Foundation. With his desires to improve his family's way of living and have a stable job someday, Manuel is very determined to finish even a vocational course. With that he is asking for a loan of 10, 000 PHP from KIVA lenders for his tuition fee. His parents can't pay for tuition due to financial constraint. Manuel believes that this loan will open doors for him and make his dreams into reality. He is very positive that lenders will grant his requested loan.

loans.use: to pay for his tuition fee.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en: Juliana is 66 years old from Gerona, Tarlac. She works as a housekeeper. What she is earning is not enough for her child's education. That is why she wants to ask for financial assistance of 10,000 PHP from lenders for her son's tuition fee. John Rhey, her son, is taking up auto diesel mechanic. He wants to finish his studies not only for himself but also for his family. He believes that his chosen course will be his stepping stone towards his dreams.

loans.use: to pay for the tuition fee for her son.

loans.name: Melenalenuu

texts.en:
Melenalenuu is 47 years old and married with 5 children. She owns and operates a small store to sell a variety of items. She has been doing this for 4 years. 

Melenalenuu needs a loan to buy a new display refrigerator, a chest freezer, snacks, frozen goods, a bag of rice, sugar, canned food, sack of onions and potatoes. 

She hopes to use her profits to  renovated her house and pay for her children's education. 

She became a member of SPBD in 2010 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy a new display refridgerator, a chest freezer, snacks, frozen goods, a bag of rice, sugar, canned food, sack of onions and potatoes.

loans.name: Vailima

texts.en:
Vailima is a 21-year-old single woman with no children. She earns a living by making and selling pancakes. She has 1 year of experience with this business. 

Vailima needs a loan to buy a bag of flour, cooking oil, a large frying pan, a new oven and a bag of sugar. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's  weekly expenses. 

Vailima has been a member of SPBD since 2014.

loans.use: to buy a bag of flour, cooking oil, a large frying pan, a new oven and a bag of sugar.

loans.name: Ma. Nica Niña

texts.en: Ma. Nica Niña is 19 years old from Paniqui, Tarlac and is taking up computer programming. She wants a 10,000 PHP loan from KIVA lenders through ASKI to be able to pay for her tuition fees. She is hopeful to finish even a vocational course to find a job in the future so she could help her parents support their daily needs and the education of her siblings as well.

loans.use: to pay for her tuition fee.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en: Luzviminda is from Paniqui, Tarlac. She is 53 years old and married. She has a son named Romeo who is 17 years old and is taking up automotive servicing. Romeo, who sometimes had difficulties during examinations, is still determined to finish his studies to help his parents. He thinks that the loan of 10,000 PHP is of big help especially to the poor because they will be able to finish their studies without paying too much. With that he is very optimistic that the generous KIVA lenders will grant his mother's loan request.

loans.use: to pay for the tuition fee for her son.

loans.name: Marvin

texts.en: Marvin is 43 years old and is from Paniqui, Tarlac. He is married with three children. He is a carpenter and his wife is a housewife. One of his children, Marvin John, is taking up the study of Auto Diesel Mechanics. Marvin asks for a loan of 10,000 PHP from Kiva lenders because what he earns is not enough to send his son to this vocational course. Marvin is positive that lenders will grant his request.

loans.use: to pay for son's tuition fees

loans.name: Mark

texts.en: Mark is 18 years old and is taking up automotive servicing in St. Paul Colleges Foundation. He took that course because he wants to broaden his knowledge and he thinks that it is the course that can allow him to help his family. To achieve his dreams and continuously attend school, Mark wants to take out a loan of 10,000 PHP because his parents can’t sustain his studies.

loans.use: to pay for his tuition fee.

loans.name: Adrian Paul

texts.en: Adrian Paul is studying in St. Paul Colleges Foundation taking up the study of Computer Hardware Servicing. He chose this course because he is fond of computers. He wants to finish college to help not only his family but also his other relatives. While studying, Adrian is having difficulties determining where to get his allowance and money to pay his tuition fees. That's why he asks for a loan of 10,000 PHP from Kiva lenders. Adrian Paul hopes that his loan request will be granted.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees

loans.name: Klenalyn

texts.en: Klenalyn is 23 years old, taking up the study of Hotel and Restaurant Services. She chose this course because she wants to be able to work in other countries and help her family. She is struggling financially which is why she wants to seek financial assistance from the Kiva lenders, amounting to 10,000 PHP. This loan will be of great help to her family. Thus, she will be very grateful if lenders approve her request. Klenalyn promises that she will persevere to achieve all her dreams.

loans.use: to pay for her tuition fees

loans.name: Jeremiah

texts.en: Jeremiah is 19 years old and is taking up Hotel and Restaurant Services in St. Paul Colleges Foundation. He wants to attain a 10,000 PHP loan from Kiva lenders because he and his family are struggling financially. He knows that the loan will help him and his family cover the school expenses and it will give him the opportunity to take his desired course. After graduating, Jeremiah desires to assist his parents financially. Thus, he is striving to finish even his vocational course.

loans.use: to pay for his tuition fees

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en: A $800 loan is offered to Teodora to improve her business. She opened her second hand store in 2010 with her own finances of $100.00. She will use the loan to buy stock for her store like trousers, shorts, short sleeve and long sleeve shirts. Teodora is generating a good income from selling her second hand items. She has been thinking of running a bigger business and she is living in a town with her family.

loans.use: to buy trousers, shorts, short sleeve and long sleeve shirts.

loans.name: Viktorija

texts.en:
In 1994, Viktorija immigrated to the U.S. with her 18-month-old daughter. At the time, she had just graduated from the University of Latvia with a degree in economics and was looking forward to starting a new life in the U.S. Viktorija aimed to find a job that allowed her to be with her daughter. She found a position as a nanny for a family with three young children close to her daughter’s age. Viktorija began working with young children and discovered that she really enjoyed watching them grow and acquire new skills and knowledge every day. Eventually, Viktorija went back to school, obtaining a degree in early childhood development. She started as an assistant and continued to become a head teacher and eventually a director of a childcare center. 

After many years working in the early childhood development field, Viktorija felt that there was something missing and she could make the field better by creating quality childcare programs. In 2011, Viktorija obtained a license for her first childcare center in Valley Village, CA: A Mother Goose Academy. In 2013, an opportunity came up to take over one of the centers she had run as a director, and Viktorija obtained a license to operate the center under the name of "A Mother Goose Academy of Chatsworth, CA". To build a quality childcare environment takes not only a great amount of hard work but also an investment of financial funds, which is what this Kiva loan will enable her to do.

loans.use: to enhance the overall quality of care and operations of her second facility. Funds will be allocated towards marketing and payroll.

loans.name: Felila

texts.en: Felila is a 55-year-old, married woman with seven children. She has a small plantation and grows cabbages, tomatoes, cucumbers, etc. to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. Felila has requested a loan to buy a spade, rake, wheelbarrow, knives, shovel, etc. She has been a member of SBPD since 2013. With her profits, Felila hopes to extend her business and save for unexpected emergencies.

loans.use: to buy a spade, rake, wheelbarrow, knives, shovel, etc

loans.name: Darren

texts.en: Darren, a 22-year-old from Paniqui, Tarlac, is taking up the study of Hotel and Restaurant Services. He chose this course because he knows that this will be a big improvement in his knowledge in restaurant service. He wants to receive a loan of 10,000 PHP from Kiva lenders, though ASKI, for his daily allowance and for his tuition fees. Darren is optimistic that the generous lenders will grant his request for the loan, which will be of great help for him and for his family.

loans.use: to pay his tuition fees

loans.name: Purevjargal

texts.en: Mrs. Purevjargal, 42 years old, lives with her husband and three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been working as a veterinary physician at an animal hospital. Her husband is a driver and works at a private firm. Their eldest son goes to high school and their other two children stay at home. She is requesting a loan of 2,800 USD to buy vacuum-insulated windows, hardwood floors, and fiberglass for renovations of her home. After renovation, her family will live in a comfortable and warm place, where less coal is burned, releasing less pollutants into the air.

loans.use: to install vacuum-insulated windows and hardwood floors

loans.name: Faustina

texts.es:
La socia Faustina se sigue dedicando al negocio de vebta de verduras como zanahorias,cebollas y tomates y tambien se sigue dedicando al negocio de crianza de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas, la socia los hace engordar y crecer y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias y mercados, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 4 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los animales. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuyes y gallinas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Faustina still has her business selling vegetables such as carrots, onions and tomatoes, and also continues with her business of raising small animals such as guinea pigs and chickens. The member raises and fattens them, and sells them in the various fairs and markets. She works from 8:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m. She has been in this business for four years already, and it is going very well. Her dream is to have a sales outlet where she can sell the animals. 

The member is requesting the loan in order to buy guinea pigs and hens. She is happy about the loan, and promises to make her installment payments.

loans.use: To buy guinea pigs and hens.

loans.name: Jackeline Fiorella

texts.es:
Jackeline es una joven emprendedora, tiene 21 años de edad, es soltera y vive en San Juan de Miraflores junto a su familia.
Es una persona con muchas ganas de salir adelante, actualmente está estudiando la carrera de Ingeniería de Sistemas e Informática. También trabaja en el mercado como vendedora en un puesto, le va muy bien, es muy responsable, trabajadora, honrada, respetuosa y amable con los clientes.
Jackeline está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá arreglar su habitación como pintarrajear las paredes para que pueda vivir de manera más cómoda, de esta manera mejorará su calidad de vida y seguirá luchando para más adelante: "Convertirse en una gran empresaria".
texts.en:
Jackeline is an enterprising young woman. She is 21 years old, single, and lives with her family in San Juan de Miraflores.

She is a person with a great desire to succeed. Currently she is studying to be a computer and systems engineer. She also works at the market as a vendor at a stand. It is going very well. She is very responsible, hard-working, honest, respectful, and friendly with the customers. 

Jackeline is grateful to the Kiva lenders, because with the support they have offered she will be able to do repairs to her home such as plastering the walls, so that she can live more comfortably. In this way she will improve her quality of life and continue striving so that she can someday "Become a successful businessperson."

loans.use: To improve her home.

loans.name: Edwin Abel

texts.es:
Edwin de 32 años de edad,  estudio hasta noveno grado, es casado su compañera de vida  se dedica a los oficios domésticos. Son padres de  3 hijos quienes van a la escuela, él se dedica a la mecánica desde hace 7 años, repara mototaxi en un taller, él también posee una mototaxi con la que presta servicios de transporte, en el pueblo donde vive, la cual es conducida por un amigo de él a quien le paga por la prestación de servicio,  anterior a este trabajo se dedicaba a prestar servicio como motorista, en una comercial del pueblo, y en una ocasión el dueño tenía un taller, y se le fue el ayudante, y lo pusieron a él de ayudante, fue así como aprendió la mecánica.

El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar herramientas de trabajo, como una pulidora y una pistola soldadora, pues piensa poner su taller propio, él cree que con los créditos se le ayudara  poco a poco a tener todo lo que necesita, darle educación a sus hijos y mejorar sus casa, también comprar otra mototaxi, pues considera que tiene buenos ingresos.
texts.en:
Edwin is 32 years old, married, and went as far as ninth grade in school. His life companion is a housewife. They are the parents of three children who go to school. 

He has been a mechanic for seven years, and repairs mototaxis in a workshop. He also owns a motor taxi with which he provides transportation services in the town where he lives. It is driven by a friend of his, whom he pays for providing the service. Before he did this work he was driver for a local store. At one time the owner had a workshop and the helper left, so they hired him as the helper. That was how he learned to be a mechanic.

The loan he is requesting is to buy work tools such as a polisher and a welding done, as he intends to set up his own workshop. He believes that the loans will enable him to have what he needs, little by little; to educate their children; improve their home and also to buy another mototaxi, as he feels he has good earnings.

loans.use: To buy work tools such as a polisher and a welding gun, as he intends to set up his own workshop.

loans.name: Emilio

texts.es:
Emilio, compro una vaca e insumos agrícolas, con el capital que se le facilito por medio de Kiva anteriormente, lo que le ha ayudado a tener una mejor cosecha de granos básicos, más derivados de la leche con los que ofrece a su familia una mejor alimentación y puede comercializarlos con sus vecinos.
En esta ocasión está solicitando capital para invertirlo en insumos agrícolas para cultivar granos básicos, comprara abono, semilla, fertilizantes, insecticidas, herbicidas y pago de mozos, que le ayuden a realizar los trabajos.
texts.en:
Emilio bought a cow and agricultural supplies with the working capital he was provided through Kiva previously. This has helped him to have a better harvest of staple grains and also milk products that he can sell to his neighbors, and with which he provides his family a better diet. 

On this occasion he is requesting working capital so that he can purchase agricultural supplies for growing basic staples. He will buy manure, seeds, fertilizers, insecticides, herbicides, and pay for labor, which will help him to carry out the work.

loans.use: To buy manure, seeds, fertilizers, insecticides, herbicides, and pay for labor.

loans.name: Nellie

texts.en: Nellie, 41 years old, is married with four children. Her husband is an electrician, and what he earns is sometimes not enough for the family. And to support their daughter’s schooling, she wants to avail herself of a loan of 10,000 PHP from KIVA lenders. Sarah is a first-year student taking up hotel and restaurant services. Due to financial difficulties, sometimes it comes to a point that she will skip classes because her parents can’t provide her daily allowance. With this loan, her mother can save for her daily allowance, since they will use this loan for her tuition fee.

loans.use: to pay her daughter's tuition fee

loans.name: Natalia Andrea

texts.es:
Natalia es una joven de 20 años, trabaja en una empresa comercial como asesora, vendedora y promotora de distintos productos hace 3 años.
Hoy en día ha decidido independizarse y comenzar a ganar sus propios ingresos, es por esto que desea aplicar la experiencia adquirida durante todos estos años en la puesta en marcha de un negocio de venta de mercancía como ropa, calzado y accesorios americanos.
Estos elementos los venderán en principio a sus amigos, familiares y vecinos.
Ella pide un aliento económico para la compra de surtido y así capitaliza su actividad, permitiéndole iniciar son su negocio y cumplir su sueño de tener un gran almacén de ropa con ingresos estables y ofreciendo empleos.
Es una joven emprendedora y dedicada, tiene grandes ideas y es muy simpática.
texts.en:
Natalie, age 20, has been working for a commercial company as an advisor, seller, and promotor of different products for three years.  She has now decided to become independent and to start earning her own profits.  That is why she wishes to apply the experience that she has acquired during alll of these years.  She wants to set up a business of selling merchandise like clothes, shoes, and American accessories.  She will sell these items in the beginning to her friends, relatives, and neighbors.

She is requesting financial assistance to buy stock and capitalize her business activity.  This will allow her to start her business and fulfill her dream of having a large clothing store with stable income that provides employment to others.  She is an enterprising and dedicated young woman.  She has big ideas, and she is very nice person.

loans.use: to buy stock to start her business.

loans.name: Maria Lucia De Fatima

texts.es:
Maria lleva 10 años como estilista en el municipio de Medellín, allí tiene ubicado su propio salón de belleza en el cual ofrece distintos servicios de belleza.
Su objetivo principal es acreditar su negocio y tener unos clientes fieles.
Ella es conocida por su buen servicio y calidad en sus trabajos.
El crédito es solicitado para la compra de una vitrina y productos de belleza como tratamientos y cremas para el cabello.
Con esta actividad ha podido sacar adelante a sus hijos y les ha dado una buena educación.
texts.en:
Maria has been a hair stylist in the Medellin municipality for ten years.  That is where she has her own beauty salon in which she offers different beauty services.

Her main objective is to finance her business and to have loyal customers.  She is known for her good service and the quality of her work.

She is requesting the loan to buy a display case and some beauty products like treatments and hair creams.  With this business activity she has been able to get her children ahead, and she has given them a good education.

loans.use: to buy a display case and to stock hair products.

loans.name: Priscila Del Carmen

texts.es:
Priscila, vive con su esposo de 46 años de edad y sus hijos de 20 y 15 años de edad;  se dedica a vender tamales y yuca entre otros antojitos, además cultiva granos básicos, el negocio nace por la necesidad de apoyar en los gastos de su familia.
Invertirá en la compra de aceite, tomates, repollo, pollo, leña e insumos agrícolas como abono, semilla, fertilizantes y plaguicidas, así tendrá la materia prima para elaborar la venta de antojitos y cultivar maíz para asegurar una buena alimentación a su familia, espera mejorar sus ingresos para resarcir su deuda.
Su sueña es hacer mejoras en su vivienda y ofrecer un mejor estilo de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Priscilla lives with her 46-year-old husband and their children, who are 15 and 20. She sells tamales, cassava, and other corn-based dishes, and also grows staple grains. Priscilla started these two businesses out of necessity; she needed to make a financial contribution to meeting the family's expenses.  

Priscilla will invest the loan funds in the purchase of cooking oil, tomatoes, cabbage, chickens, wood, and farming supplies such as manure, seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides. Some of these supplies are the raw ingredients she needs to prepare the dishes she sells; other are essential to growing the corn that ensures a healthy diet for her family. 

Priscilla hopes to boost her income in order to repay her debts. Her ambition is to make improvements to her home and offer a better lifestyle to her family.

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil, tomatoes, cabbage, chickens, wood, and farming supplies such as manure, seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides.

loans.name: Jose Wilson

texts.es:
Quien se desempeña en el negocio de la agricultura se le puede escuchar una frase celebré “seguir adelante” y es en base a esa reconocida frase que los campesinos salen día a día a realizar esta hermosa labor en el campo.
Entre este nicho de productores se encuentra Juan, un hombre el cual fue criado toda la vida por campesinos forjándolos con sus bellos valores, uno de los que más podemos destacar es el trabajo y en base a este valor Juan quiere aumentar su producción y venta de ganado bovino.
Sabe que para mejorar en el negocio es necesario invertir y para ello recurre a una ayuda crediticia la cual usara para la compra de ganado y gallinas con el único objetivo de progresar y sostenerse en esta ya complicada economía en la que se desenvuelve el mundo hoy en día y poder mantener a sus seres queridos protegidos y resguardados bajo su manto.
texts.en:
People who farm for a living often hear the expression "get ahead," which isn't just a cliché; it is the motivation that drives farmers to do noble work in their fields. 

Juan is one such farmer, a man who was raised by parents who were also farmers, and who instilled in him their sound values. One of the most notable of those values is labor, which is the basis for Juan's ambition to boost his production and cattle sales.  

Juan recognizes that his business requires investments in order to grow, so he's applying for a loan for the purchase of cattle and chickens. The current global financial situation is complicated, and Juan's overriding goal is to grow and sustain his business. Then he will be able to can provide for his loved ones and keep them secure in the family's home.

loans.use: to purchase livestock and chickens.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
María, realiza las actividades agrícolas (siembra de maíz y frijol) como una fuente de ingresos para costear los gastos de su hogar. También elabora tamales de pollo para vender al detalle y al por mayor; Ella es casada, vive con su esposo de 40 años de edad y dos hijos de 19 y 15 años de edad. Todos colaboran en el negocio. 
El capital que requiere lo utilizara para comprar semilla, abono, plaguicidas, herbicidas e insecticidas, para cultivar maíz y frijol, espera aprovechar los insumos agrícolas para preparar el terreno y sembrar sin ningún problema.
Su sueño es cubrir las necesidades básicas de su hogar y estabilizar su economía para poder cancelar su deuda.
texts.en:
María is a farmer and grows corn and beans to earn income for household expenses. She also prepares chicken tamales and sells them retail and wholesale. María is married to a 40-year-old husband and the couple has two children, ages 19 and 15. The whole family works to produce the corn and bean crops and prepare tamales for sale.     

María will use the funds from this loan to to purchase seeds, manure, pesticides, herbicides, and insecticides for her crops. She hopes to use these supplies to prepare the soil and plant the crops successfully. 

María's ambition is to meet her family's basic needs and pay off her debts, which would stabilize the family's finances.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, manure, pesticides, herbicides, and insecticides.

loans.name: Faimasasa

texts.en:
Faimasasa is a 41-year-old married woman who has four children. To make a living, she has farmed a small plantation for the last three years. She grows cabbage, beans, cucumbers, and other vegetables.  

Faimasasa  is requesting a loan to buy bush knives, weed sprayer, fertilizer, and other farm tools. She has been an SBPD member since 2014. Faimasasa hopes to save the profit from the farm for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy bush knives, weed sprayer, fertilizer, and an ax

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase supplies for crop maintenance.

loans.name: Subiyanto

texts.en:
Subiyanto runs a small stall selling mobile phone airtime credits and mobile accessories. He lives in Purwokerto, a semi-urban area about 10 hours from Jakarta. Subiyanto is married and living with three people in the family home. As seen in the picture, he is with his customer.

Subiyanto began working with Ruma two months ago because he wanted to increase his income.  He feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments. As the business continues to run, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends

loans.name: Angelyn

texts.en:
Angelyn is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Angelyn is 28 years old and has three children who are currently in school.

Angelyn has a business buying and selling ready-to-wear clothes in the Philippines. Angelyn has requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock of ready-to-wear clothes to sell to her customers.

Angelyn has been in this business for one year. In the future, Angelyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ready-to-wear clothes to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Janeth

texts.es:
La socia Janeth  se sigue dedicando al negocio de crianza de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas, la socia los hace engordar y crecer y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias y mercados, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los animales. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuyes y gallinas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Janeth is continuing with her business of raising small animals like guinea pigs and chickens. The member fattens them and then sells them in different markets and street fairs. She works from 8 am until 6 pm. She has been in this business for 5 years and things are going well for her. Her dream is to have her own stall where she could sell the animals.

She is requesting a loan to buy guinea pigs and chickens. She is grateful for the loan and promises to pay her installments on time.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Rafael De Jesus

texts.es:
Rafael, tiene un hogar integrado por su compañera de vida y tres hijos; su negocio consiste en cultivar jícama, maíz y frijol, es un negocio que aprendió en su familia, trabaja de seis de la mañana a una y media de la tarde. No tiene otro ingreso económico.
Invertirá el crédito en la compra de semilla, fertilizantes, plaguicidas, insecticidas y herbicidas, con los que le dará un buen desarrollo a sus cultivos, espera tener una mayor producción para ampliar su cartera de clientes y así mejorar la situación económica.
Su anhelo es seguir trabajando para ampliar su negocio, brindarles una carrera universitaria a sus hijos, cancelar su deuda y remodelar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Rafael is a farmer and grows corn, beans, and jícama [an edible tuber]; he lives with his wife and their three children. Rafael learned to farm form his parents, and now works from six o'clock in the morning until one o'clock in the afternoon. Farming is his only source of income. 

Rafael will invest the funds from this loan in the purchase of seeds, fertilizers, pesticides, insecticides, and herbicides that he'll use to ensure healthy growth of his crops. 

Rafael hopes to boost production, grow his customer base, and improve his financial situation. His ambition is to keep working on the expansion of his business, provide for his children's education through college, pay off his debts, and renovate the family's home.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, pesticides, insecticides, and herbicides.

loans.name: Camille

texts.en: Camille is 19 years old and is taking up Computer Programming. She has two siblings. Her father is the only one working in their family. He is a driver. Her mother stays at home to do the household chores and takes care of her youngest sibling. Camille chose this course because somehow she already has knowledge about computers.  She wants to seek financial assistance from the Kiva lenders amounting to PHP 10,000 to sustain her studies and pay for her tuition fee.

loans.use: To pay for her tuition fees

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
In 2004, Martin started to make mole at home for family events. His mole recipe was well received by friends and family and Martin steadily came to the idea of branding his mole in order to sell it to the public. The idea of expanding was a great opportunity for Martin to sell his products to the U.S. market however, he did not have a stable job and he decided to take on the challenge of expanding and exporting the product on his own. The first step was to begin exporting by first obtaining the proper permits from the FDA. Ever since then, Martin has slowly been exporting products from Mexico to the U.S. The long-term objective is to progress into a successful commercial distribution center and increase its product depth and breadth. 

This Kiva loan will allow Martin to expand his business and make his dreams of introducing quality mole to the U.S. market a reality.

loans.use: to expand his business making mole and distributing his products in the United States.

loans.name: Delgermaa

texts.en: Mrs. Delgermaa, 35 years old, lives with her only son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. She has been working as a beautician at a beauty salon for more than 10 years. Her son goes to school. Using her previous loan, she has purchased home appliances that made her living comfortable. Now she is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT to buy hair straigtener, blow dryers and a curling iron for better service. Upgrading tools will attract more customers, which will generate more income and improve her living standard. She wants to educate her son at the best school in Mongolia.

loans.use: to buy hair straightener, blow dryers and a curling iron

loans.name: Lheric

texts.en: Lheric, 18 years of age, is taking up Computer Programming at St. Paul Colleges Foundation. She wants to finish school to help her family with their daily expenditures. Her mother is a housewife while her father works in a town lottery. Because they struggle financially, she wants to seek PHP 10,000 financial assistance from the Kiva lenders to help her pay for her tuition fee. She hopes that lenders will help her achieve all of her dreams in life thru granting her requested loan.

loans.use: To pay for tuition fees

loans.name: Bryan

texts.en: Bryan is taking up Computer Programming at St. Paul Colleges Foundation. He chose this course because he wants to be challenged and be a web developer. He has seven siblings and their family’s income comes from his father who is a tricycle driver. He is requesting a loan of PHP 10, 000 to pay for his tuition fee. Bryan said that if Kiva lenders approve his loan, it will be a big help in reaching his dreams.

loans.use: To pay for his tuition fee

loans.name: Einar Octavio

texts.es:
Einar es un hombre emprendedor y trabajador del campo, siempre con su mirada puesta en un futuro prospero y unos sueños cumplidos.
El trabaja en diferentes fincas realizando jornales de trabajo pero desea obtener ingresos extra a través de la colocación de una tienda de abarrotes en el municipio de El Carmen De Viboral.
Tiene un pequeño local y necesita ayuda para comprar todos los mobiliarios como vitrinas, estanterías, enfriadores, y surtido de productos de la canasta familiar.
Con estos elementos podrá sacar adelante su proyecto y ofrecerá empleo a uno de sus familiares para que le ayude en el negocio.
La idea es poder dedicarse en pleno a esta actividad y dejar de trabajar en jornales.
texts.en:
Einar is an enterprising man and agricultural worker. He has always had his mind set on a prosperous future and his dreams fulfilled. He works in different farms doing day labor but he wants to make extra money through the establishment of a grocery store in the municipality of El Carmen De Viboral.

He has a small location and needs help to buy all the furnishings, like display cases, shelving, refrigerators and a stock of basic food items. With these items he can move forward with his project and offer employment to a member of his family to help him with his business. His idea is to devote himself full-time to the business and stop working as day labor.

loans.use: to buy furnishings to start his store and to buy stock.

loans.name: Adela

texts.en:
Adela is 38 years old and married with one kid.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more items like biscuits, soft drinks and other groceries.

Adela has borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and earns an income from clothing sales.

Adela aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like biscuits, soft drinks and other groceries to sell

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en: Jenny is 22 years old and single with two children. She makes and sells fans, traditional baskets, table mats, etc. to earn a living and has been doing this for more than three years. Jenny has requested a loan to buy varnish, paint, threads, a paint brush, etc. She plans to use her profits to built a small flea market to sell her business. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy varnish, paint, threads, and a paint brush

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is 48 years old and blessed with four children. She was has been engaged in buying and reselling fruits and vegetables within her community while her husband works on their farm. Despite the hardships of life, they aimed to educate all of their children so that they will become professionals and have a good job someday. Two of her youngest children are still studying in secondary and tertiary school. Due to the high cost of school fees, they cannot afford to finance all of their schooling. Therefore, Josephine wants to access financial assistance from Kiva lenders through ASKI for PHP 8,000 to pay for the tuition fees, school uniforms and allowances of her daughter who is now in college taking a Bachelor of Science in Mechanical Engineering. She believes that this financial assistance will be a great help for her to support the education of her daughter.

loans.use: to pay for the tuition fees, school uniforms and allowances of her daughter

loans.name: Alilyn

texts.en:
Alilyn is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 41 years old, and all of her children are in school.

Alilyn's house was destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. She has restarted her agriculture business and is committed to regain what she lost. 

Alilyn is taking out a PHP 9,714 housing loan through NWTF in order to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.

Alilyn has been with NWTF since 2012 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. 

In the future, Alilyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
Liezel works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by Super Typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her general store business and is now requesting a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she can build a house for her family.

With your help, Liezel will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

In the future, Liezel would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Lama

texts.en:
Lama is a 52-year-old married woman with 10 children. 

She has a small plantation and grows taro, taamu, yams, bananas, etc., to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than four years.

Lama has requested a loan to buy chemicals, bush knives, weed sprayer, etc. She has been a member of SBPD since 2008. With her profits, she hopes to build a new house for her family.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, bush knives, weed sprayer, axe, etc.

loans.name: Maselina

texts.en:
Maselina is 37 years old and a single woman with four children. She runs a small business selling noodles, pancakes, ice pops, etc. in her community and has been doing this for three years.

Maselina has requested a loan to buy bags of flour, boxes of noodles, boxes of twisties, soft drinks, cookies, etc. 

She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Maselina would love to continue her business for the improvement of her family’s living.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, boxes of noodles, boxes of twisties, soft drinks, cookies, etc.

loans.name: Juana De La Concepcion

texts.es: Juana de la concepción mayor de edad madre soltera de cuatro hijos tres mayores e independiente y con una aun bajo su responsabilidad por su discapacidad el cual acude a una escuela para niños con capacidades diferentes, originaria del municipio de Chinandega ubicado en el occidente del país, Juana es una microempresaria y administradora de sus propios negocios el cual consiste en una hermosa pulperia y en la compra venta de mercadería en general ubicados en su casa de habitación donde ofrece al publico su productos como: arroz, azúcar, frijoles, aceite, detergentes, jabón, golosinas, leña, productos congelados, gaseosas, jugos, huevos, cigarros, papel higiénicos, salsas de tomates, mostaza, inglesas, tomates, cebollas, bananos verdes, sardinas, bolsitas de tangs,
