bolsitas de avenas, pinolillos entre otros al igual que comercializa mercadería en general como: variedades estilos de ropa nueva, usada, zapatos, bolsos, cosméticos, trajes para niños, productos plásticos entre otros, Juana se caracteriza por ser una mujer trabajadora, responsable, con ganas de superación personal, en sus ratos libres le gusta disfrutar con su hija dándole toda su atención y disfrutar con ella momentos maravillosos al realizar distintas actividades y es un gozo de alegría el ver una respuesta positiva en su hija,esta niña es mi motor todos los días para salir adelante y darle lo mejor,  sus compras de la pulperia las realiza al contado en distribuidoras y mercados de esta localidad, y las de la mercadería las realiza tambien al contado en otro departamento, sus ventas son al contado y en algunas ocasiones al crédito, tiene clientes fijos y eventuales, inicia su jornada diaria desde muy temprano abriendo las puertas de sus negocios para brindarle una mejor atención a sus clientes, uno de sus sueños aun es el de terminar de construir su casa de habitación para así brindar una mejor atención a sus clientes en ambos negocios y tambien el brindarle un techo digno donde vivir a su hija, el objetivo de este nuevo financiamiento es para invertir en capital de trabajo en la compra de productos de consumo del hogar diario como: granos básicos,productos congelados, productos perecederos, gaseosas, jugos, golosinas, mercadería en general entre otros mas. Juana agradece mucho el apoyo que los inversionistas Kivas les ofrece a personas de bajos recursos económicos..-
texts.en:
Juan de la Concepción is an older single mother with four children, three independent adults and one still in her care because of a disability.  She's from the town of Chinandega, located in the western part of the country.

Juana's a small business entrepreneur who runs her own businesses: a nice grocery store and a business buying and selling general merchandise.  Both are located in her home, where she sells to the public: rice, sugar, beans, oil, detergent, soap, snacks, firewood, frozen products, soda, juice, eggs, cigarettes, toilet paper, tomato sauce, mustard, sauces, tomatoes, onions, plantains, sardines, containers of Tang beverage and of oatmeal, pinolillo [a corn and cacao beverage], and other products.  She also sells various styles of new and used clothing, shoes, bags, cosmetics, children's outfits, plastic products, and other general merchandise.

Juana is known for being a hardworking, responsible woman with a great desire for self-improvement.  She likes to spend her free time with her daughter, giving her all her attention and enjoying wonderful moments with her in various activities.  It's a pleasure for her to see a positive response from her daughter: "This child is my reason for getting ahead every day and giving her the best."

She makes her purchases for the store in cash at distributors and markets in the town.  She also purchases her merchandise in cash in another department.  She makes her sales in cash and sometimes on credit.  She has regular and occasional customers.  She starts her work day very early, opening the doors of her businesses to give her customers better service.

One of her dreams is still to finish building her house so she can provide better customer service in both businesses.  She also wants her daughter to have a decent home to live in.

The goal of this new loan is to invest in working capital and buy basic grains, frozen food, perishables, soda, juice, snacks, a variety of merchandise, and other staple products.

Juana's very grateful for the support that Kiva investors give to low-income people.

loans.use: to stock her store

loans.name: Tautala

texts.en: Tautala is 54 years old and married with nine children. She runs a small business selling tomatoes, cucumber, etc in her community and has been doing this for five years. Tautala has requested a loan to buy chemicals, bush knives, a weed sprayer, a shovel, etc. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Tautala hopes to continue doing her business for the improvement of her family.

loans.use: to buy seeds, bush knives, a weed sprayer, and a shovel

loans.name: Seynabou's Group

texts.fr: le groupe a été crée le 06 Mars 2008 et est composé de femmes issues du différentes quartiers. Leurs activités sont: l’élevage le commerce et la couture. Seynabou l'emprunteur vedette est la responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 56 ans, mariée et mère de 05 enfants. Elle fait le commerce de vaisselle et ustensiles de cuisines. Elle s'approvisionne a Dakar revend dans son quartier. Elle a de la clientèle et donne en générale sa marchandise à crédit elle fait le marché ambulant. elle compte acheter 100000F , 200000F d'habillement le  100000 pour acheter la vaisselle. Avec ses bénéfices elle compte épargner dans le Banc Villageois, appuyer son mari dans la gestion de la famille pour le petit dé-jeûner et le dîner des enfants et gérer ses affaires personnelles
texts.en:
This group was created on March 6, 2008, and it consists of women from various districts. Their activities include animal farming, commerce and sewing. 

Seynabou is the featured borrower and head of the group. She is 56 years old and married with five children. She sells dinnerware, cooking utensils, etc. 
She buys her merchandise in Dakar and conducts her sales as an itinerant vendor around her neighborhood, usually on credit. She has quite a few customers. 

She plans to buy 100,000F worth of dinnerware and 200,000F worth of clothing. She intends to use her profits to bolster her savings within the Banc Villageois, to help her husband in managing the family with respect to the children’s breakfast and dinner, and to manage her own personal affairs.

loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils and clothing for resale.

loans.name: Ma. Shirley

texts.en:
Ma. Shirley is 44 years old and married with five children.  With two children in school, Ma. Shirley works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Shirley's business and family home were destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Ma. Shirley has restarted her general store business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Ma. Shirley has taken a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF in order to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using the loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Ma. Shirley is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in the future, would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Lene

texts.en:
Lene is 50 years old and widowed with four children. With two of her children in school, Lene works very hard to provide for them.

Lene's business and family home were destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. Lene has restarted her agriculture business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Lene has taken a PHP 9,714 housing loan through NWTF in order to rebuild her family home. She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Lene is committed to rebuild her devastated life, and in the future, would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Valeria

texts.en:
Valeria is taking a loan of $800.00 to improve her business. 

She is running a mini-shop that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store, such as shorts, short sleeved and long sleeved shirts, and also clothes for the children to church.

She opened her second hand a year ago with her own working capital of $600.00.  She is a hard-working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy  shorts, trousers, short sleeved and long sleeved shirts, and also clothes for the children to wear to church

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Mercedita is 40 years old and all of her children are in school.

Her house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her general store business and is committed to regain what she lost. Mercedita is taking out a PHP 10000 Housing loan through NWTF in order to purchase property materials and pay construction labor to build her a house for her family.

She has been with NWTF since 2012 in her quest to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. In the future, Mercedita would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase property materials and pay construction labor

loans.name: Maricsa Mabel

texts.es:
Maricsa, se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de ganado de engorde, el negocio lo aprendió de su esposo y ya tiene 9 años de estar funcionando, trabaja de seis de la mañana a una de la tarde. María vive con su esposo y tres hijos de 21, 19 y 17 años de edad.
Comprará tres novillas con un precio de $ 370. 00 C/U., con lo que podrá ampliar su zona de comercialización, espera tener más ingresos para incluir la venta de aves de corral, pagar sus deudas y cubrir los gastos de su hogar.
Su sueño es aumentar el número de cabezas de ganado y que su negocio sea autosuficiente.
texts.en:
Maricsa raises and sells livestock that she has fattened. She learned the business from her husband and has been doing it for 9 years. She works from 6 in the morning to 1 in the afternoon. She lives with her husband and three children, ages 21, 19, and 17.

She will buy three heifers at a price of $370 each. With them she will be able to expand her sales zone. She hopes to have more income to include selling barnyard fowl, to pay her debts, and to cover the household expenses.

Her dream is to increase the number of head of livestock and to have her business be self-sufficient.

loans.use: buy three heifers at a price of $370 each.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 53 years old, married and has one child. 

Rosemarie and her family survived Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

Rosemarie is taking a housing loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Rosemarie has been with NWTF borrower since 2012. She plans to recover through her general store business.

With your help, Rosemarie can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of Super Typhoon Haiyan. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Fuifui

texts.en:
Fuifui is 36 years old and a single woman with one child. 

She runs a small business selling pancakes in her community and has been doing this for two years. Fuifui has requested a loan to buy bags of flour, sugar, yeast, cooking oil, etc. 

She joined SPBD in 2014 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Fuifui will save for her kids' education and support her family financially.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, sugar, yeast, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Batchuluun

texts.en:
Batchuluun, 31 years old, lives with his wife  and newly-born infant in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. 

He has been rendering taxi service to local people since 2011. His wife currently stays at home, looking after their child. Using his previous loan, he has installed vacuum insulated windows into his house and insulated it with fiberglass. 

Now he is requesting a loan of 1,800,000 MNT to buy shingles in order to repair his roof. After repairing the roof, his family will live in a more comfortable and warmer place.

loans.use: to buy shingles in order to repair the roof

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es: Teresa de Jesús, 30 años de edad acompañada madre de tres hijos los cuales todos son menores de edad, aun bajo su responsabilidad, de origen chinandegana ubicado en el occidente del país, siempre sea caracterizado por ser una  mujer muy trabajadora responsable, ella ya ha trabajado con fundación y ha demostrado ser muy buena  paga en tiempo y forma,es una microempresaria y administradora de su propio negocio el cual consiste en la compra venta de mercadería en general que consisten en vender productos de cosméticos como: bases, cremas de cuerpo, crema faciales, anti arrugas, anti ojeras, desmaquilladores, mascarillas, vanidad, bliss, pintura de labios, punturas de uñas,  shampoo, rinses, perfumenes, variedades estilos de ropa de niños, adultos, zapatos, sandalias entre otros el cual distribuye su mercadería de forma ambulante. La rutina diaria de Teresa es de 10 horas desde la 8: am hasta las 6: pm, la mayor parte de su inventario están en cuentas por cobrar porque la mayor parte la trabaja por encargos y algunos que vende por afuera, sus compras las realiza al contado en distribuidoras y mercados de mayoreo de otro departamento, tiene clientes fijos y eventuales sus ventas son al contado y al crédito los cuales recupera quincenalmente, el objetivo de este nuevo financiamiento es para invertir en la compra de cosméticos como: maquillajes, cremas faciales, delineador, shampoo, variedades estilos de ropa, sandalias, zapatos, entre otros mas, este negocio el cual tiene 9 años de estar funcionando en la actualidad ha obtenido logros y ha podido obtener algunos logros que ha sido ir mejorando su casa e incrementar un poco mas su negocio productos de muchos sacrificios y esfuerzos. Uno de sus sueños es que sus hijos sean personas de bien y profesionales . Teresa agradece la ayuda que le brinda el inversionista kiva a los pequeños comerciantes para tener un medio de trabajo propio para poder sobrevivir con sus familias en un país que tiene tantas carencias y falta de recursos para nuestras futuras generaciones.
texts.en:
Teresa de Jesús is 30 years old, is in a common-law relationship and mother to three children who are dependent on her. She is a native of Chinandega in the west of the country. She has always been hard-working and responsible. She has already worked with the Foundation and has a track record of paying on time.

She is a micro-entrepreneur and manager of her own business which consists of buying a variety of merchandise, selling cosmetics like cosmetic bases, body cream, facial cream, anti- wrinkle cream, make-up remover, mascara, vanity cases, Bliss products, lipstick, nail polish, shampoo, rinse, perfumes, a variety of children's and adult's clothing, shoes, sandals, amongst others. She sells them in the streets. Her daily routine is 10 hours of work from 8 am until 6 pm. The majority of her inventory is in accounts collectable as most of her work is by order with some other sales. She makes her purchases in cash in the markets and at wholesale distributors in another Department. She has both regular and casual customers. Her sales are in cash and on credit which she collects every fortnight.

The objective of this loan is to invest in buying cosmetics like make-up, creams, shampoo, perfume, dresses, shoes, sandals, amongst others. She has had this business running for 9 years and has obtained some achievements such as having made improvements to her house and expanding the products in her business through much effort and sacrifice. One of her dreams is for her children to grow up to be good people and professionals.

Teresa is grateful for the support that the lenders at Kiva provide for small businesses so that they can have their own work to support their families. Nicaragua is a country that has much scarcity and lack of resources for the future generations.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics like make-up, creams, shampoo, perfume, dresses, shoes, sandals, etc.

loans.name: Johana Esther

texts.es: Johana Esther, casada originaria de chinandega ubicado en el occidente del país, zona que se caracteriza por ser productivamente comercial, ubicado en el occidente del país, se caracteriza por ser una mujer trabajadora, responsable y con muchos deseos de superación personal, buscando un medio digno de salir adelante es que se decide  poner su pulperia donde ofrece productos de consumo del hogar diario como: arroz, azúcar, frijoles, aceite, jabón, detergentes, pastes de baños, cloro, papel higiénicos, toallas sanitarias, salsas de tomates, mostazas, inglesas, sopas maggis, sobres de avenas, pinolillos, sardinas, golosinas, productos congelados, gaseosas, jugos, leche, entre otros mas, negocio el cual son tres años de tenerlo y poco a poco ha logrado ir incrementando su inventario, el cual lo inicia con fondos propios productos de sus ahorros, uno de sus sueños es poder tener su propia casa y establecer mejor su negocio para así agrandarlo mas al igual que el de poder terminar sus estudios ya que sus padres de escasos recursos no pudieron apoyarla en terminar una carrera la cual hoy con su esfuerzo y sus ingresos del negocio sueña con terminar y ser una profesional. el objetivo de este financiamiento es para invertir en capital de trabajo en la compra de productos de consumo como: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, productos congelados, golosinas, chinerias entre otros mas.-
texts.en:
Johana Esther is married and is originally from Chinandega, which is in the Western part of the country. The area is known for being commercially productive.

Johana is a hard-working and responsible woman who desires personal success. She wants a dignified way to move forward so she decided to open a grocery store, where she sells consumer household products such as rice, sugar, beans, cooking oil, soap, detergent, toothpaste, chlorine, toilet paper, sanitary napkins, tomato sauce, mustard, Worcestershire sauce, soup, oatmeal, cornmeal, sardines, sweets, frozen products, soft drinks, juice, milk, and other items.

She has had her business for three years and little by little, she has been able to increase her inventory. She started the business with her own funds from her savings. One of her dreams is to have her own home and better establish her business to grow it even more. She also wants to finish her education since her parents had few resources and couldn't help her finish. Today, with her effort and income from the business, she dreams of finishing and being a professional.

The goal of this loan is to invest in working capital to buy products such as rice, beans, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, frozen products, sweets, general items, and more.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and stock up her grocery store by buying consumer household products such as rice, sugar, beans, coffee, salt, detergent, and other items.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is a 32-year-old woman who is married, with four children. 

She runs a business selling clothes in her community. She has four years of experience with this business. Elena has requested a loan to buy a sewing machine, scissors, thread, needles, material, etc. 

She plans to use her profits to built up a new sewing shop. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, scissors, thread, needles, material, etc.

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es: Marisol vive en concubinato y tiene un hijo.  Ella vive en la comunidad de Akherana en una casa de adobe  que es de su propiedad Marisol se dedica a la producción de leche  y necesita un prestamo para comprar una vaca lechera Aunque el concubino de Marisol trabaja como ayudante en la colocación de pisos de machimbre, lo que ambos ganan no alcanza para financiar el proyecto de Marisol de incrementar su produccion lechera  por eso es que ella necesita su ayuda
texts.en:
Marisol is in a common-law relationship and has one child. She lives in her own adobe house in the community of Akherana. Marisol works in milk production and needs a loan in order to buy a dairy cow.

Even though Marisol’s partner works as an assistant in charge of installing wood floors, both of them do not earn enough to finance her project to increase milk production. For this reason, she is in need of assistance.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Vicente De Jesus

texts.es:
Vicente, mejoro la productividad de sus cultivos, no tuvo problemas de plagas, sus ingresos son mejores y le permiten cancelar sus compromisos económicos, su familia mantiene el mismo número de miembros.
Como está convencido de los buenos resultados que tiene al invertir créditos en su negocio se decidió por un nuevo préstamo que en esta oportunidad le servirá para comprar hierro, láminas, tubos, electrodos y algunas herramientas para equipar su taller de estructuras metálicas.
texts.en:
Vicente improve the productivity of his crops and experienced no pest problems. His earnings improved, which allowed him to meet his financial obligations. His family remains the same size.

Convinced by the good results that he received as a result of investing loans into his business, Vicente decided to request a new loan. He is taking this opportunity to buy iron, metal sheets, tubes, electrodes, and other pieces of equipment in order to outfit his metal shop.

loans.use: to buy iron, metal sheets, tubes, electrodes, and other pieces of equipment.

loans.name: Joana Jane

texts.en:
Joanna Jane is a diligent student studying at Nueva Vizcaya State University, taking up Hotel, Restaurant and Tourism Management. She aims to finish her chosen course so that she will find a good job someday and help her parents financially, and to have a bright future. 

Her parents are both farmers, and their income is not sufficient to pay for all her necessities in school. With that, Joanna Jane is seeking financial assistance of PHP 10,000 to pay for her tuition fees and miscellaneous fees. She believes that this financial assistance will be a great help for her to continue her studies.

loans.use: to pay for her tuition fees and miscellaneous fees.

location.town: Brgy. Ineangan, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes is a hard-working mother who is into the hog-raising business to generate additional income. She is 35 years old and blessed with five children.

They are currently residing in a rural community and make their living through farming. She and her husband aim to continue sending their children to school so that they will become professionals in the future. 

Her eldest child is now in tertiary education while the others are still at the elementary and secondary levels. Due to insufficient income, they could not afford to finance all the school fees for their children. For this reason, Mercedes would like to access an educational loan of PHP 10,000.00 from Kiva lenders through ASKI to pay the tuition fee and miscellaneous fees of her daughter who is taking AB English at Nueva Vizcaya State University. 

Mercedes is hoping that she will receive her requested loan to provide the necessities of her daughter.

loans.use: to pay the tuition fee and miscellaneous fees for her daughter

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy vehicles for spare parts.

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es:
Jorge, le parece agradable el servicio que se le ha brindado y por los buenos resultados que obtiene de los créditos, se decidió a solicitar un nuevo préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de abono, herbicidas, plaguicidas e insecticidas, para continuar cultivando granos básicos. 
Con ayuda del crédito anterior evito que algunos fenómenos naturales dañaran su cosecha, la productividad ha sido mayor, su familia se mantiene y cancelo su deuda.
texts.en:
Jorge enjoys the service he has been offered and, because of the good results he gets from the loans, he decided to request another loan.  He's going to invest in buying soil amendments, herbicide, pesticide, and insecticide to keep on growing basic grains.

With the help of the previous loan he avoided his harvest being damaged by natural phenomena, his productivity has been greater, his family is provided for, and he paid back his debt.

loans.use: to buy soil amendments, herbicide, pesticide, and insecticide

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en: Trinidad is 55 years old, married, and blessed with four children. They are currently residing in a rural community and make their living through farming. The couple values education, thus they are very determined to send their children to college. But due to the high cost of school fees, she would like to avail a loan of PHP 20,000 to pay for the tuition fees, books, and uniforms of her youngest daughter. She hopes that she will get her loan request to provide all the necessities for her daughter in school.

loans.use: to pay for the tuition fees, books, and uniforms of her youngest daughter

loans.name: Jusabel

texts.en:
Jusabel is 18 years old and presently studying for the bachelor of science in electronics and communications engineering.  She dreams of becoming a successful engineer someday and having a stable job to support her parents financially. 

Due to financial hardship her parents cannot afford to finance all her school fees. For this reason, Jusabel wants to access an educational loan of PHP 20,000.00 to pay for her tuition fees, books, and school uniforms. She hopes that Kiva lenders will grant her loan request for her to be able to continue her studies.

loans.use: to pay for her tuition fees, books, and school uniforms

loans.name: Donero

texts.en:
Donero, 47, finished primary school. His wife provides domestic duties. They have six children who live with them.

Donero is primarily a corn and rice farmer, but he also cultivates sorghum.

They have two yoked calves and want to buy more. They want to buy them for foraging. He works on rented land that is one kilometer from his home. 

He'll invest the loan in buying some herbicides and fertilizers to cultivate his crops.

loans.use: to buy herbicides and fertilizers to cultivate his crops

loans.name: Carmen Luisa

texts.es:
Carmen es una mujer trabajadora, tiene 49 años de edad y vive en Ica junto a su familia.
Estudió la carrera profesional de Educación y desde hace más de 14 años trabaja como profesora en un colegio prestigioso. Tiene 3 hijos quienes son su mayor orgullo y por quienes poco a poco ha salido adelante para poder brindarles una mejor calidad de vida.
Carmen está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá comprar un televisor para su vivienda, de esta manera podrá disfrutar de sus momentos libres junto a sus hijos y así seguirá esforzándose para poder cumplir una de sus mayores metas: "Convertirse en una próspera empresaria".
texts.en:
Carmen, 49, is a hardworking woman who lives in Ica with her family.  She studied education and has worked for more than 14 years as a teacher in a prestigious school.  She has three children.  They are her greatest pride, and she has gotten ahead little by little so she can give them a better quality of life.

Carmen is grateful to the Kiva lenders because with their support she'll be able to buy a t.v. set for her home so she can enjoy her free time with her children.  That way she'll keep on making an effort to be able to achieve one of her biggest goals: to become a prosperous entrepreneur.

loans.use: to buy a television set

loans.name: Antonia Angelica

texts.es:
Antonia, con ayuda de los créditos sigue progresando en el negocio de venta de ropa, ha mejorado su inventario, tiene mejores ganancias, mantiene su buen record crediticio y junto a su familia tiene  un mejor estilo de vida.
Con el firme propósito de mantenerse en el mercado con prendas novedosas, variadas en estilos, colores, tallas y precios, opta por un nuevo préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de pantalones, faldas, camisas, blusas, camisones, ropa interior y vestidos, de esta forma sus clientes encontraran lo que necesitan en su puesto de venta.
texts.en:
With the help of loans, Antonia continues to make progress in her business selling clothing.  She has improved her inventory, has better profits, maintains a good credit record, and has a better lifestyle with her family.

Her sound objective is to stay in the market with innovative garments in a variety of styles, colors, sizes, and prices.  She decided to get another loan to invest in buying pants, skirts, shirts, blouses, nightgowns, underwear, and dresses.  That way her customers will find what they need in her sales stall.

loans.use: to buy pants, skirts, shirts, blouses, nightgowns, underwear, and dresses

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 31 years old and has five children.  She is married and has four children who are in school.

She and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. She is taking out a housing loan amounting to PHP 9,485 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Rowena has been with NWTF as a borrower since 2012. She plans to recover through her general store business. With your help, she can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In future she  would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Jennelyn

texts.en:
Jennelyn is 25 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Her business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her food vending business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

She has taken a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF in order to purchase materials to rebuild her family home. She is using the this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Jennelyn is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in future would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Shanny

texts.en:
Shanny is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Shanny is 24 years old and has two children who are in school.

Shanny's house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her general store business and is committed to regain what she lost. Shanny is taking out a PHP 9,914 housing loan through NWTF in order to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.

Shanny has been with NWTF since 2012 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. In the future, Shanny would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Moesama

texts.en:
Moesama is 65 years old and is a married woman with give children. She runs a small business selling tomatoes, cucumbers, etc. in her community, and she has been doing this for four years.

Moesama has requested a loan to buy seeds, bush knives, weeds sprayer, chemicals, etc. She joined SPBD in 2000 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Moesama would love to continue doing her business for the best improvement of her family.

loans.use: to buy seeds, bush knives, weeds sprayer, chemicals, etc.

loans.name: Recilla

texts.en: Despite financial hardship, Recilla and her husband has the determination to uplift their status of living and educating their five children. As one way of generating income, Recilla has been engaging in a hog-raising business. Her youngest daughter is now in college taking up a food commercial course. She chose to take this course because she wants to put up her own restaurant in the future. Due to the high cost of school fees, Recilla could not afford to finance all her daughter's school fees. For this reason, she would like to take out an educational loan of 10,000 PHP to pay for the tuition fees, books and school uniforms of her daughter. She believes that this financial assistance will be a great help for the future of her child.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees, books and school uniforms of her daughter

location.town: Brgy. Mangayang,Dupax del Sur, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Lizabelle

texts.en: Lizabelle is 20 years old and presently studying for a Bachelor of Science in biology. She aims to finish her college degree and find a profitable job someday. Due to the high cost of school fees, her parents cannot afford to finance all her schooling. Having the desire and determination to earn a degree, Lizabelle wants to access financial assistance from KIVA lenders through ASKI in the amount of 15,000 PHP to pay for her tuition fees, miscellaneous fees and school uniforms. She believes that this financial assistance will be a great help for her to continue her studies and hopes that someday, she will become successful in her chosen field.

loans.use: to pay for her tuition fees, miscellaneous fees and school uniforms,

location.town: Brgy. Villa Flores, Sta. Fe, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Nith

texts.en:
Nith, 54, lives in Svay Chek District, Bantheay Meanchey Province, Cambodia. He is a respectful father of three children. To ensure his students can get a further education, Nith and his wife work extremely hard on the farm land on which they grow rice and sell the products to the local dealers. The net profit that this guy can make is USD 5 per day.

Nith wishes to promote his family's healthy condition by using a hygienic latrine, yet the money that he has saved is not enough. He is now borrowing a loan from HKL to build a latrine for the sake of his family members. He would like to thank lenders for the financial support via HKL, which provides him with a much lower interest rate than its general loan product

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Jerriel

texts.en: Jerriel is a 20-year old student studying at Kings College of the Philippines taking up an automotive course. He aims to continue and finish his chosen course hoping that someday, he will become a professional and have a stable job. Due to the high cost of school fees, his parents cannot afford to finance some his necessities in school. For this reason, Jerriel wants to access financial assistance from Kiva lenders amounting to PHP 10,000  to pay for his tuition fees and school uniforms. He hopes that lenders will approve his requested loan for it will really pave the way for him to achieve all his dreams, not only for himself but for his family as well.

loans.use: to pay for his tuition fees and school uniforms

loans.name: Suluga

texts.en: Suluga is 41 years old and a married woman with two children. She runs a small business selling pancakes in her community and has been doing this for more than four years. Suluga has requested a loan to buy bags of flour, sugar, yeast, oil, etc. She joined SPBD in 2000 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Suluga will love to continue doing her business to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy bag of flour, sugar, yeast, oil, etc.

loans.name: Estefany Yiomira

texts.es:
Estefany es una joven emprendedora, tiene 19 años de edad, es soltera y vive en Cañete junto a su familia.
Desde hace dos años se dedica a la venta de ropa, le va muy bien porque es una persona muy trabajadora, responsable y con muchos deseos de superación.
Su mayor motivación en la vida es su familia, es por ellos que trabaja incansablemente para poder ofrecerles mayores oportunidades.
Estefany está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mercadería por temporada de invierno para que de esta manera pueda tener mayores ingresos. Así, seguirá esforzándose para poder cumplir una de sus más grandes metas: "Seguir una carrera universitaria".
texts.en:
Estefany, 19, is a young entrepreneur.  She's single and lives in Cañete with her family.

She has sold clothing for two years.  It's going very well for her because she's a very hardworking and responsible person with a great desire for self-improvement.

Her family is her biggest motivation in life.  She works tirelessly for them so she can give them greater opportunities.

Estefany's grateful to the Kiva lenders because with their support she'll be able to buy seasonal winter merchandise so she can earn more income.  That way she'll keep on working hard to achieve one of her biggest goals: to get a college education.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Gina is 45 years old and has four children who are in school.

Gina has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has requested a 16,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fishing net and other equipment.

Gina has been in this business for 14 years. In the future, Gina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing net and other equipment.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Gina is 29 years old, and three of her children are in school.

Gina has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for thirteen years. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

In the future, Gina would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Jose Irene

texts.es:
José, opta por solicitar más capital para comprar hierro, cobre, aluminio y un pick up; lo que le permitirá en continuar en el negocio de compra y venta de chatarra y teniendo ingresos que necesita para subsistir.
El financiamiento anterior le fue de mucha ayuda para mantener se trabajando, tuvo mejores ganancias con las que mantiene su buen record crediticio y cubre  los gastos del hogar.
texts.en: José chooses to request more capital to buy iron, copper, aluminum, and a pickup, which will allow him to continue in the business of buying and selling scrap metal and having income that he needs to survive. The previous funding helped him a lot in keeping himself working. He had better earnings with which he maintains his good credit record and covers the expenses of the home.

loans.use: to buy iron, copper, aluminum, and a pickup.

loans.name: Ruben

texts.en: The client is 59-years-old and lives in his own house with his wife and children. He works the land together with his wife. Their main crop is rice which they sell in the different markets in their area. The client is requesting a loan to buy inputs for his crops like fertilizer, manure, pest control, herbicides, etc. so that he can continue farming and have a source of income. He hopes to enjoy a better quality of life together with his family.

loans.use: to buy inputs for his crops like fertilizer, manure, pest control, and herbicides

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en: Leonora lives in San Roque with her spouse and four children. She and her spouse acquire income through rice and corn farming and a hog raising business too. She uses their income for daily meals, bills at home and education expenses. However, she has insufficient funds for school fees due to the high cost of tuition fees and allowances; thus, she is asking for a loan of PHP 8,000 from Kiva lenders to pay for her daughter's tuition fees. Her daughter, Rosalinda, is a freshman student taking up a Bachelor of Science in Hospitality and Industry Management. Rosalinda wants to be successful in her chosen field; thus, she is studying hard. She hopes that lenders will help her achieve what she desires by granting her mother's requested loan.

loans.use: to pay the tuition fees for her child

loans.name: Ferolini

texts.en:
Ferolini is 50 years old and is a married woman with nine children. She runs a small business selling cucumbers, tomatoes, etc. in her community and has been doing this for more than three years. 

Ferolini has requested a loan to buy seeds, bush knives, weeds sprayer, chemicals, etc. She joined SPBD in 2000 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Ferolini hopes her business will be the best income for family.

loans.use: to buy seeds, bush knives, weeds sprayer, chemicals, etc.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Elena is 38 years old and has two children who are in school.

Elena has a fishing business in the Philippines. Elena requested a PHP 9,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fishing nets and other equipment.

Elena has been in this business for six years. In the future, Elena would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other equipment.

loans.name: Jose Ronnie

texts.en:
Jose Ronnie is 43 years old and a single man. He is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Jose Ronnie has a fishing business in the Philippines. Jose Ronnie requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Jose Ronnie has been in this business for six years. In the future, Jose Ronnie would like to save money to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Rowena is 41 years old and has two children who are in school.

Rowena has a fishing business in the Philippines. Rowena requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Rowena has been in this business for 17 years. In the future, Rowena would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en: Elena, 48 years of age, is married to an overseas Filipino worker. The couple is blessed with two children. They are harmoniously residing at Brgy, Culalabat, Cauayan City, Isabela. Elena has managed a retail store and a direct selling business in their village for almost six years now. Due to insufficient funds, she would like to request a loan amounting to PHP 20,000 to pay for the tuition fees of her child, Ariane Joy. She wants their children to have a quality education, thus, she perseveres to earn a higher income. Ariane Joy wants to take up a BS in Education because she wants to help her parents uplift their living. She wants to achieve all her dreams to become a successful teacher someday.

loans.use: To pay for the tuition fees of her child, Ariane Joy.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Margie works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Margie is borrowing PHP 24,000 through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment for her fishing business.

Margie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Juan Angel

texts.es:
Juan, es un vendedor de CDS y DVDS, también ofrece el servicio de payaso para diferentes eventos como: cumpleaños, fiestas patronales, eventos en escuelas, etc., su negocio nace hace cuatro años y lo realiza por la necesidad de contar con recursos económicos con los que cubre gastos familiares; está acompañado, su pareja vende de forma ambulante agua, refrescos, sodas y jugos.
Invertirá el préstamo para pagar la reparación del equipo de sonido de su negocio, es una herramienta que necesita y no cuenta con los recursos económicos para realizar dicha acción. Espera mantenerse trabajando para mejorar su situación económica.
Su sueño es seguir ampliando su negocio, mejorar el estilo de vida de su familia y cancelar sus deudas.
texts.en:
Juan is a seller of CDs and DVDs, and he also offers a clown service for different events such as: birthdays, patron saint’s festivities, school events, etc. His business was born four years ago and he made it due to the need to have economic resources, with which he covers family expenses. He is in a relationship and his partner sells water, soft drinks, sodas, and juices on the street. 

He will invest the loan to pay for the repair of the sound equipment of his business. It is a tool that he needs and he does not have the economic resources to carry out said action. He hopes to keep himself working to improve his economic situation. His dream is to continue expanding his business, improve the style of life of his family, and repay his debts.

loans.use: to pay for the repair of the sound equipment of his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs for her coffee crops

loans.name: Recelex

texts.en:
Recelex, 32 years old, is a farmer married with one kid. His partner is a housewife. Since he was 19 years old, Recelex has made a living in agriculture, work that his parents taught him after he left his studies. It is difficult for him to get another job because of his level of schooling, and that is why agriculture is his source of income.

He will use the loan to buy agricultural supplies such as sulfate, fertilizer, manure, and poison for pests, among other things, which will help him obtain better crop results and more earnings. His dream for the future is to help his children with their studies and to have better work opportunities, as well as to improve his family's quality of life, because they have very few economic resources.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies such as sulfate, fertilizer, manure, and poison for pests.

loans.name: Nelda

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Nelda works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Nelda is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

Nelda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Maritza Esperanza

texts.es:
Maritza, es propietaria de una venta de tortillas, las cuales ella misma elabora, el negocio funciona desde hace cinco años, trabaja de diez de la mañana a siete de la noche, el oficio lo heredo de su familia, por el momento no representa dificultades; ella es acompañada, vive con su compañero de vida, ambos son padres de una joven de 19 años de edad.
Comprará maíz, leña, gas propano, cal y bolsas, le ayudara a trabajar por un largo periodo de tiempo, ahorrar en la compra por mayor, aumentar su producción, tener mejores ganancias y atraer nuevos clientes, espera poder cancelar su deuda adquirida.
Maritza sueña con estabilizarse económicamente para poder comprar su casa propia.
texts.en:
Maritza owns a tortilla-sales business, which she herself cooks. The business has been in operation for the last five years. She works from 10:00 to 19:00. She inherited the business from her family and so far she has not run into difficulties.

She is in a relationship and lives with her life partner. They are the parents of a 19 year old daughter.

Maritza will buy corn, firewood, propane gas, lime and bags. This will help her in many ways: help her run the business for a long time, save money by buying in wholesale, increase production, raise profits and attract new customers. She hopes to be able to repay the loan.

Maritza dreams with reaching economic stability and with being able to buy her own home.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, propane gas, lime and bags.

loans.name: Ma. Helen

texts.en:
Ma. Helen is a 52-year-old, married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Ma. Helen has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Ma. Helen requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell.

Ma. Helen has been in this business for twenty years. In the future, Ma. Helen would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Pologa

texts.en:
Pologa is a 47-year-old married woman with five children. She runs a business of selling lavalava (a traditional Polynesian cloth worn as a skirt by men and women) in her community. She has five years of experience with this business.

Pologa has requested a loan to buy design boards, materials, paint, sponges, paint brushes, etc. 

She plans to use her profits to extend her business. She joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy materials, paint, design boards, sponges, paint brushes, etc.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 46 years of age.  She is married to a farmer and blessed with three children. Alma and her husband get their income through rice farming where they earned PHP 50,000 last cropping which they used for their daily expenditures and as a rolling capital for their farming business. As a mother, Alma wants her children to finish their college education.  Because of that she is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 10,000 from Kiva lenders through ASKI to pay for the tuition fees, books and uniforms for her son, Allan Justin.

Allan Justin wants to take up an automotive course for he believes that through that he can improve as God’s gift to him. Also, with a college diploma he is certain that he can reach his goals in life and help his family uplift their status of living.

loans.use: To pay for the tuition fees, books and uniforms for her son.

loans.name: Nestor

texts.en: Nestor is a hard working father of three children. He operates their tricycle transportation business. Aside from the transportation business, Nestor is also engaged in retailing grocery items and a snack foods business. His wife serves as his partner in managing their retail business. Nestor and his wife have the same goal. They wanted to succeed with the business they have now and expand soon. In connection with their goal, Nestor is asking for a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy drinks, canned goods, and many more grocery items to sell. He believes he will earn a higher income from his present business and will use it as revolving capital to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy drinks, canned goods, and many more grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
As a married mother of eight children, Josie works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming corn and rice. Josie is borrowing PHP 4,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to buy farm lands.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Edna works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming corn and rice. Edna is borrowing PHP 4,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Maria Aurelia

texts.es: María de 54 años de edad se dedica al cultivo de maíz desde hace varios años, adicional a eso también tiene un negocio de venta de comida ubicado en su casa, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra cubrir gran parte de los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, Vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar uno de sus hijos reside en estados unidos y le ayuda económicamente, Maria está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc.  y asi poder continuar con su trabajo para que ella y su familia puedan tener una mejor calidad de vida sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Maria is 54 years old and she is dedicated to the harvesting of corn, for several years now, additionally, she has a food-selling business located in her house. What she earns from her work allows her to cover a big part of her home expenses. She lives in her own house with family, one of her son’s resides in the United States and helps her out economically. 

Maria is requesting a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizer, compost, pest controls, herbicides, etc. so that she can continue working and so that she and her family can improve their wellbeing without any limitations.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer, compost, pest controls, herbicides, etc.

loans.name: Vicenta Del Socorro

texts.es: Vicenta del Socorro, mayor de edad casada con tres hijos independientes, origen Chinandegana, zona que se caracteriza por ser productivamente comercial y turística, es una microempresaria y administradora de una hermosa pulperia donde ofrece productos como: granos básicos, gaseosas, jugos, chineria, cosméticos, pan, frijoles cocidos, leche, productos congelados, tomates, cebolla, chiltomas, bananos verdes, leña, cigarros, mecates, sal, ropa interior, bolsitas de shampoo, golosinas, galletas, pastes de baños, papel de regalo, pastas de dientes, jabón, detergentes entre otros mas, sus compras las realiza al contado en distribuidoras y camiones distribuidores que le dejan la mercadería en la puerta de su casa,  sus ventas son al contado y en algunas ocasiones al crédito a clientes fijos,los cuales recupera semanal o quincenal, Vicenta se caracteriza por ser una mujer trabajadora, responsable en su forma de pagos, luchadora que empezó desde muy abajo para ir creciendo poco a poco en su negocio hasta tener lo que tiene hoy en día al igual que logro sacar adelante a sus hijos y verlos realizados en todos unos profesionales, uno de sus sueños es poder crecer mas en su negocio para asi tener mejores ingresos su demanda ha crecido bastante gracias a la buena atención que les brinda a sus clientes inicia su jornada diaria desde muy temprano abriendo las puertas de su negocio y cerrando algo tarde para asi cubrir con las necesidades de sus clientes, Vicenta agradece mucho el apoyo que los inversionistas kivas les ofrece a personas de bajos recursos económicos.
texts.en:
Vicenta del Socorro, an older woman who is married with three grown children, is from Chinandegana, an area known for commerce and tourism. Vicenta is a small-businesswoman and the administrator of a lovely grocery store where she sells items such as basic grains, soft drinks, juices, low-cost items, cosmetics, bread, baked beans, milk, frozen foods, tomatoes, onions, sweet peppers, green bananas, firewood, cigarettes, ropes, salt, underwear, shampoo, candies, cookies, bath loofahs, wrapping paper, toothpaste, soap, detergents, and other things. She makes her purchases in cash from distributors and delivery trucks that leave the merchandise at the door of her house. She makes her sales in cash, and sometimes she makes them on credit to her steady customers. She collects on the credit every week or 15 days.

Vicenta is characterized as being a hardworking woman, responsible with her payments, and a fighter who started out small and grew little by little with her business until she got what she has today. She is also known for helping her children get ahead and seeing them all become professionals.

One of her dreams is to be able to grow her business more in order to have better income. Her demand has grown enough thanks to the good attention her customers bring her. She starts her workday very early, opening the doors of her business, and closing them somewhat late in order to take care of her customers' needs. Vicenta is very grateful for the support that the Kiva lenders give to people of lower financial means.

loans.use: to invest working capital and stock her grocery store by purchasing basic grains, frozen foods, perishables, candies, low-cost items, etc.

loans.name: Esmeralda Rosa

texts.es:
Esmeralda es una mujer emprendedora, tiene 41 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene un hijo y vive en Cañete con su familia.
Su hijo es su mayor motivación para salir adelante, es por él que Esmeralda se esfuerza cada día para poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
Desde hace varios años se dedica a la venta de comida y le va muy bien porque es muy trabajadora, innovadora, responsable y porque siempre ofrece productos de calidad.
Esmeralda está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá remodelar su vivienda como pintarrajear las paredes, para que de esta manera mejore su nivel de vida. Así, ella seguirá esforzándose para poder cumplir su mayor sueño: "Tener su propio restaurante".
texts.en:
Esmeralda is an entrepreneurial woman. She is 41 years old, a single mother, has one son, and lives in Cañete with her family. Her son is her greatest motivation to get ahead. It is for him that Esmeralda exerts herself each day in order to be able to improve his quality of life. For several years she has worked in food sales and it goes very well for her because she is very hardworking, innovative, and responsible, and because she always offers quality products.
 
Esmeralda is grateful for the Kiva lenders because with the support they have provided her, she will be able to remodel her home like plaster the walls, so that in this manner she can improve her standard of living. In this way, she will continue making an effort to be able to accomplish her great dream: “To have her own restaurant.”

loans.use: to remodel her home (plaster the walls of her home).

loans.name: Sabina Cely

texts.en: Even not having children, Sabina Cely is still diligent to uplift their living conditions by running a sari-sari store business. Her husband is a tricycle operator in their village. She has been running the business for 12 years and hopes to extend the run of the business as her daily source of income. She wishes to increase her profit from the business to be able to meet their daily basic needs with her husband and their adopted child. Sabina Cely wishes for a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy noodles, spices, condiments, breads and drinks to sell. She will use the loan wisely to develop the business she has now and one she may have someday.

loans.use: to buy noodles, spices, condiments, breads and drinks to sell.

loans.name: Norberto

texts.en:
Norberto used the previous loan to buy cement for the construction of his house for a rental. He is a farmer who grows crops like rice and corn to supplement his other businesses like piggeries and rentals. He has a dream of seeing his children attain higher levels of learning. He is a very enterprising man who started from a meek background selling a few pigs and graduated to weekly trading of at least eight pigs. Unpredictable weather changes are what he usually complains of.

Norberto intends to use the loan to buy fertilizer, manure and pesticides for his business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, manure and pesticides for his business.

loans.name: Evelio

texts.es: Evelio de 37 años de edad vive con su esposa y sus hijos, el se dedica a trabajar en taller de mecánica  automotriz, con lo que logra de su trabajo logra solventar algunas necesidades de su hogar, Evelio está solicitando un crédito para la compra de pintura, barniz, aceites, y demás herramientas para seguir con su trabajo y así obtener mejores ganancias para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida sin limitación alguna.
texts.en: Evelio, 37 years old, lives with his wife and children. He works in an auto mechanic shop. With the money he makes from his work, he pays for some household necessities. Evelio is requesting a loan to purchase paint, varnish, oil, and other tools to continue his work and generate better income to give his family a better quality of life without any restrictions.

loans.use: to purchase paint, varnish, oil, and other tools.

loans.name: Esperanza Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario esta integrado por tres socias una de ellas es la coordinadora doña Elizabet es una mujer emprendedora que administra su negocio desde hace 15 años, la socia se dedica a la venta de ropa y productos varios como bisutería, cosméticos perfumes etc. La socia actualmente recibe la ayuda de su hermano el cual le ayuda a vender, cobrar y a atender a los clientes mientras ella no está en el negocio. Con el crédito doña Elizabet quiere reforzar su negocio con la comprar de más productos como pantalones, camisas, materiales para hacer bisutería y a la vez alcanzar una de sus metas que es ampliar el negocio para que sus ventas aumenten. Con los créditos que ha obtenido la socia ha conseguido más independencia económica y la consolidación de su negocio. Otra de las socias es doña Ana de 44 años se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, la señora Josefa de 45 se dedica a l venta de ropa.
texts.en: The solidarity group is formed by three members. One of them is the coordinator, doña Elizabet. She is an entrepreneurial woman who has run her business for the last 15 years. The member works in the sale of clothing and various products like costume jewelry, cosmetics, perfume, etc. The member currently receives the help of her brother, who helps her sell, cover, and attend to the customers while she is not in the business. With the loan, doña Elizabet wants to strengthen her business with the purchase of more products like pants, shirts, and materials to make costume jewelry, and at the same time reach one of her goals which is to expand the business so that her sales grow. With the loans that she has obtained, the member has gotten more economic independence and consolidation of her business. Another one of the members is doña Ana, 44 years old, who works in the sale of fruits and vegetables. Señora Josefa, 45 years old, works in clothing sales.

loans.use: to buy clothing merchandise.

loans.name: Gonzalo Adalberto

texts.es:
Gonzalo, tuvo como resultado de la inversión anterior en su negocio una mejor cosecha de maíz, pipían y plátano, elimino las amenazas de plagas, sus ingresos han sido mayores, sus clientes están satisfechos, no represento dificultades para cancelar sus cuotas y ofrece a su familia una vida más confortable.
Nuevamente invertirá en su negocio por lo que acude a nuestra institución a solicitar más capital que será de mucha ayuda para comprar abono, plaguicidas, fertilizantes, insecticidas, semilla y pago de mozos, preparará el terreno, eliminara la maleza y  dará a sus cultivos un buen desarrollo. Foto fue tomada en el tractor con el que prepra la tierra.
texts.en:
Gonzalo, as a result of the last investment in his business, had a better harvest of corn, chilies, and plantains. He got rid of the thread of plagues. His income has been better; his customers are satisfied, and he does not have any difficulties making his payments and giving his family a more comfortable life.

He will invest in his business once more, and for that, he has turned to our institution to request more capital, which will be of great help for purchasing compost, pesticides, fertilizers, insecticides, and seeds. It will also pay for helping hands. Gonzalo will prepare the land, take out the weeds, and give his crops a good (chance to) develop.

The picture was taken on the tractor that he uses to prep the land.

loans.use: to purchase compost, pesticides, fertilizers, insecticides, and seeds, and to pay for help.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase merchandise to stock his clothing sales business.

loans.name: Rosa Cecilia

texts.es:
Rosa es una mujer emprendedora, tiene 23 años de edad, es soltera y vive en  Cañete junto a su familia.
Es madre soltera por lo cual ella sola tiene que velar por el bienestar de su pequeño hijo. Sin embargo, ella ha sabido salir adelante con mucho esfuerzo para poder ofrecer a su hijo un mejor futuro.
Desde hace varios años se dedica a la venta de calzados, le va muy bien porque es muy responsable, trabajadora y dedicada a su labor.
Rosa está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mercadería para implementar el negocio de venta de calzados, de esta manera sus ventas incrementarán y seguirá trabajando para tener su "Propio negocio".
texts.en:
Rosa is an enterprising woman. She is 23 years old and single. She lives in Cañete with her family.

She is a single mother, so only she is looking out for her little child's wellbeing. However, with a great deal of effort, she has figured out how to get ahead in order to be able to offer her child a better future.

For several years, she has worked selling shoes. This is going very well for her because she is very responsible, hardworking, and dedicated to her work. Rosa is grateful to the Kiva lenders; with the support they have provided, she will be able to buy merchandise to carry out her shoe sales business. This way, her sales will increase and she will continue working toward having her "own shop."

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her shoe sales business

loans.name: Bendicion Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario está integrado por tres socias y coordinado por doña Andrea, es una mujer emprendedora, tiene un hijo de 14 años que aun depende de ella, la socia tiene un negocio que consiste en vender ropa usada en su comunidad, ha estado en este negocio alrededor de 4 años y cuenta con la ayuda económica de su hijo mayor. El crédito lo solicita para la compra de paca de camisetas, pantalón, vestidos, camisolas etc. Con los créditos anteriores  ha comprado un televisor, muebles, comida para su familia además ha reinvertido en su negocio. La meta de la socia es quedarse a vivir permanentemente en el departamento de Managua ya que viaja todos los días para poder vender sus productos. Otra de las socias es la señora Nora de 40 años de edad comerciante en su comunidad, Ángela de 44 años de edad dedicada a la venta de cosméticos en su comunidad.
texts.en: The solidarity group is formed by three members and is coordinated by doña Andrea. She is an entrepreneurial woman, and has a 14-year-old son who still depends on her. The member has a business that consists of selling used clothing in her community. She has been in this business for around four years, and she relies on the economic help of her eldest son. She requests the loan for the purchase of packages of shirts, pants, dresses, sports shirts, etc. With the previous loans she has bought a television, furniture, food for her family, and in addition she has reinvested in her business. The member’s goal is to stay living permanently in the department of Managua, now that she travels everyday to be able to sell her products. Another one of the members is señora Nora, 40 years of age, a businesswoman in her community. Ángela, 44 years of age, works in the sale of cosmetics in her community.

loans.use: to buy new merchandise.

loans.name: Los Volcanes Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario esta integrado por tres socias una de ella es la coordinadora doña Norma ella es fuerte, independiente y emprendedora que ha luchado con su negocio desde hace 10 años, la socia se dedica a la venta de hielo y refrescos. Con el crédito doña Norma planea comprar más materiales y tener más variedad en sus productos, ella quiere comprar frutas y verduras como chayote, papas, pipianes, ayotes, yuca etc. Una de las metas de la socia es superarse más y poco a poco lo ha ido logrando gracias a los créditos que ha obtenido en el pasado ya que estos le han dado una mayor estabilidad económica. Otra de las socias es Jessica de 22 años se dedica a la venta de ropa, doña Ignacia de 66 años se dedica a la venta de nacatamales
texts.en:
The solidarity group has three members.  One member is Norma, the coordinator, a strong, independent, enterprising woman who has been fighting through her business for 10 years.  She earns a living selling ice and drinks.  Norma plans to buy more materials with the loan and have more variety in her products.  She wants to buy fruits and vegetables such as chayote, potatoes, squash, ayote, yucca, etc.  One of her goals is to keep improving and little by little she has been succeeding thanks to the loans she has obtained in the past, which have given her more financial stability. 

 Another member is Jessica, 22 years old, who earns her living selling clothing; the third is Dona Ignacia, age 66, who sells nacatamales.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables for making drinks

loans.name: Dorys Catalina

texts.es: Dorys Catalina mayor de edad casada con dos hijos mayores de edad e independientes originaria de uno de los municipios de Chinandega, zona que se caracteriza por ser productivamente comercial en la azúcar, el ron, y la caña, se caracteriza por ser una mujer emprendedora con muchos deseos de superación personal, es una microempresaria y administradora de una tienda de ropa usada y nueva ubicada en su casa de habitación, donde ofrece variedad y calidad de ropa nueva y usada al igual que ofrece productos de cosméticos como: perfumenes, cremas faciales, permanentes, tintes, maquillajes, entre otros, sus compras las realza al contado en mercados de mayoreos sus ventas son al contado y al crédito a clientes fijos y eventuales los cuales recupera quincenal y semanal lo invertido, Dorys con muchos sacrificios y esfuerzo logra sacar adelante a sus hijos, uno de sus sueños es poder comprar su casa y el de incrementar mas su inventario de mercadería,apoyar a sus hijos para que salgan adelante aun mas  el objetivo de este nuevo financiamiento es para invertir en capital de trabajo e surtir su inventario en la compra de mercadería en general como: variedades estilos de sandalias, zapatos, blusas, pantalones, trajes de niños y niñas, short, camisolas, bisuterías, adornos, cosméticos, entre otros mas, Dorys agradece mucho el apoyo que los inversionistas kivas les ofrece a personas de bajos recursos económicos.
texts.en:
Dorys Catalina is older with two grown and independent children. She is from one of the municipalities of Chinandega, a zone known for its commercial production of sugar - rum and cane. Dorys is known for being an entrepreneurial woman with many dreams of getting ahead personally. She is a small-businesswoman, and she runs a used and new clothing shop out of her home. She offers a variety of quality new and used clothing. She also offers cosmetic products such as perfumes, facial creams, hair perms, dyes, make up, etc. She makes her purchases in cash at the wholesale markets. She makes her sales in cash and on credit to her steady customers. She eventually collects on the credit on a weekly or biweekly basis.

Dorys, through much sacrifice and effort, helps her children get ahead. One of her dreams is to be able to purchase her home. (Other dreams are to) invest more in her merchandise inventory and support her children to be successful. The goal of this new loan is to invest working capital and to stock her inventory by purchasing merchandise in general, such as a variety of styles of sandals, shoes, blouses, pants, children's clothes, shorts, sports shirts, costume jewelry, accessories, cosmetics, etc. Dorys is very grateful for the support that the Kiva investors give to people of lower financial means.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise in general such as cosmetics, shoes, sandals, blouses, pants, costume jewelry, etc.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en: At her age of 58, Remedios works as an assistant in maintaining hotel cleanliness for her relative while running her vending business. Her husband works as a room boy in the hotel. Remedios has three adult aged children and from her salary in her work she is able to meet their daily needs. Remedios runs a vegetable vending business as an additional source of living. She wants to have savings since she is growing older. Remedios is requesting a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy various types of vegetables to sell to her customers. By availing herself of the loan, Remedios believes she will sell more and get more earnings as well. She will save some of it so that whatever future emergencies will come, at least she will have money to get.

loans.use: to buy various types of vegetables to sell

loans.name: Eder Joel

texts.es:
Eder es un joven emprendedor, tiene 28 años de edad, y vive en La Tinguiña junto a su familia.
Su mayor motivación para salir adelante es su familia, es por eso que siempre da lo mejor en todo lo que hace.
Desde hace casi 1 año trabaja brindado servicios de transporte con una mototaxi que alquila y le va muy bien porque es muy trabajador, responsable y porque se preocupa por el bienestar de los pasajeros y por respetar las leyes de tránsito.
Eder está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá remodelar su habitación, arreglará el piso y colocará mayolicas para que de esta manera su cuarto sea más cómodo y así pueda mejorar su calidad de vida. Gracias a esto él seguirá esforzándose para más adelante poder cumplir su más grande sueño: "Construir su casa de material noble".
texts.en:
Eder is an enterprising young man, 28 years old, and lives in La Tinguiña with his family.    His main motivation to get ahead is his family, and for them he always does his best in everything he does.   For almost  a year he has offered transportation service with a rented mototaxi and this is going well for him because he is very hard-working and responsible and because he is careful about the safety of his passengers and respects the traffic laws.

Eder is grateful to the Kiva lenders because with their help he will be able to remodel his room.  He will fix the floor and lay ceramic tiles so that his room will be more comfortable and he will have a better quality of life.  Thanks to this he will continue trying to fulfill his greatest dream in time, "to build his house of durable materials".

loans.use: to remodel his room (tiling the floor)

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is 35 years old and married. He works as a farmer. He is engaged in the farming business. He learned to cultivate from the person he works with. He is requesting this loan to purchase manure for his crop, a quintal of fertilizer, and two sacks of sulfates to fertilize his crops in order to have a good harvest.

His dream for the future is that his children study and grow up with a good education. The loan will help him have basic grains, which are his family's daily bread.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and two sacks of sulfates to fertilize his crops

loans.name: Laura Mercedes

texts.es: La señora Laura independiente, emprendedora y trabajadora que ha luchado por 18 años por mantener su negocio con el cual logra cuidar  a sus dos hijos menores de 13 y 7 años. Doña Laura se dedica a la venta de productos varios pero en especial a la venta de productos ferreteros y motobombas, su esposo le ayuda en el negocio vendiendo y recibiendo mercadería. Con el crédito la doña Laura invertirá en la compra de productos ferreteros como martillos, tornillos, desatornillador, clavos y más motobombas y con sus ventas aumentar sus utilidades y mejorar aún más el negocio, con los créditos anteriores la señora Laura ha comprado más productos ya que antes no vendía productos ferreteros ni motobombas.
texts.en: Laura is independent, enterprising, and hardworking. She has fought for 18 years to keep her business going, with which she manages to care for her 2 youngest children, ages 13 and 7. Laura sells various products, particularly hardware and water pumps. Her husband helps her with her business by selling and receiving products. With this loan, Laura will purchase hardware products such as hammers, screws, screwdrivers, nails, and more water pumps. With her sales, she will increase her profits and improve her business even more. Laura has bought more products with the prior loans since previously she didn't sell hardware or water pumps.

loans.use: to buy hardware products such as hammers, screws, screwdrivers, nails, and more water pumps.

loans.name: M. Ashraf

texts.en: M. Ashraf is from Lahore, Pakistan. He is 38, married and has two children. He is a friendly, hardworking, and honorable person. He owns a construction material shop in which he sells cement, bricks, sand, concrete and provides sheltering services also. Recently he invested his savings on buying bricks. But he ran out of money to purchase other construction material such as cement and sand. As he does not have sufficient resources to buy material, M. Ashraf has applied for a loan to purchase concrete, cement and tiles to increase his monthly turnover. This will be his first loan. As he is the sole earner in the family and the major source of income comes from this business, he wants his business to flourish so that he can provide a better standard of life for himself and his family.

loans.use: to buy concrete, cement and tiles to resell.

loans.name: Aguilino

texts.en: Aguilino, 61 years old, lives in his own house with his wife and his four children. He has made his living in agriculture for many years. His main crops are corn and rice. Aguilino is applying for a loan to buy agricultural inputs like fertilizers, compost, pest control, herbicides, seeds, etc., in order to be able to continue with his crops and to be able to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs like fertilizers, compost, pest control, herbicides, seeds, etc.

loans.name: Sam

texts.en: Sam is 39, a widow, and a garment worker. She lives with her four children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. Two of her children are garment workers, too. The others are students. All of them can earn approximately $15 per day. Now she would like to apply for a loan of $600 to build a new bathroom. This loan will help her live in a better condition that will encourage her to be more hardworking. In the future, she is going to buy some cows for her children to feed at home and support her children to finish high school.

loans.use: to build a  new bathroom

loans.name: Misimoa

texts.en: Misimoa is a 27-year-old married woman with three children. She wants to start a pancake business, selling them to the members of her community so she could help out her family financially. That is why she has just joined the SPBD program in order to gain access to financial assistance. She plans to use this money to purchase sacks of flour, sugar, baking powder, cooking oil and a cooking stove to start up her pancake business. She plans to save the profits she will get from her sales so that she would be able to provide for her family's essential needs.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of flour, sugar, baking powder, cooking oil and a cooking stove.

loans.name: Aleta
