Zoila asks for a loan to purchase milk in bulk in order to continue making cheese, since this is her only source of income and, in this way, be able to provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase milk in bulk.

loans.name: Martha Alicia

texts.es: Martha de 26 años de edad vive con su esposo y su hija de 3 años de edad. Ella se dedica a trabajos domésticos y también le ayuda a su esposo en la agricultura. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora quien desea dar mejores condiciones a su familia. Martha solicita este  crédito a FUSAI para encementar el patio de su casa ya que es insalubre para su niña de tres años. Con el crédito comprará cemento, arena y grava.
texts.en: Martha, 26 years old, lives with her husband and their 3-year-old daughter. She takes care of the household chores and also helps her husband in agriculture.  She is a very hard-working woman who wants to improve her family's condition. Martha asks FUSAI for this loan to cement the patio of her house since it is unhealthy for her three-year-old daughter.  With the loan, she will purchase cement, sand and rock.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, and rock to cement the floor of the house.

loans.name: Zilpa Aminadab

texts.es: Zilpa tiene  30 años de edad y se caracteriza por ser una mujer luchadora quien se gana la vida trabajando como empleada en una institución cercana a su localidad y además es ayudante en una  pupuseria. Ella está solicitando este crédito a FUSAI para comprar lamina galvanizada, polines y pagar mano de obra para que le cambien el techo de su vivienda dado que se encuentra deteriorado.
texts.en: Zilpa is 30 years old and can be characterized as a determined woman who earns her living as an employee at a nearby business and also is an assistant in a general store.  She is asking FUSAI for this loan to purchase galvanized metal sheeting, purlins, and to pay labor costs to replace the roof of her house since it is in bad condition.

loans.use: to purchase galvanized metal sheeting, purlins, and to pay labor costs to repair the roof of her house.

loans.name: Felipe

texts.en: Felipe is a 47-year-old married man with three children. He is a businessman who deals in the produce trade. He supplements his income with agriculture, specifically growing rice. He has a rice plantation and other gardens that can fetch him a good income at the end of a month. He also grows vegetables and sells them. He says he works seven days a week, though he has laborers who help him on Sundays under his supervision.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seed, and pesticide

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 10 pieces of réal wax pagnes, 5 boxes of hair extensions, 30 handbags and 5 boxes of creams.

loans.name: Elvia Cecilia Eloisa

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Las Divas De Tosagua, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora Elvia, tiene 54 años de edad, está separada pero  de esa relación tiene un hijo  mayor de edad que aun vive en su casa.
Doña Elvia para salir adelante y para que a su hijo nunca le faltara nada hace muchos años adecuo un local en su casa en la cual surtió una pequeña tienda de víveres, ella además de víveres  también vende productos de Avon y Yanbal  (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Con lo que le quedo de ganancias con el crédito anterior ella empezó con la venta de productos naturales ropa, joyas y productos para el hogar con lo cual está mejorando sus ganancias y su vida por el bienestar de su familia.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar víveres, ropa, productos naturales y productos Avon y Yanbal. Está en el Grupo De Crédito hace 4 años y le gusta por la ayuda que siempre le dan en el grupo. Sus metas son seguir adelante mejorando su vida cada vez más.
texts.en:
In the city of Tosagua, the borrower group Las Divas de Tosagua meets every two weeks. This place is known for being very dynamic where the majority of the inhabitants work in agriculture and raising animals, because it is an area with lush vegetation. 

In this place, lives Elvia. She is 54 years old and separated but from that relationship has an adult child who lives in her home. To get ahead and so that her son wouldn't lack anything, many years ago she established a retail space in her house where she stocks a small store with general products.  In addition to these products she also sells Avon and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and accessories for women). With what she had from her previous loan, she began to sell natural products, clothing, jewelry, and household products with which she is improving her earnings and her life for the well-being of her family. 

She will use this loan to purchase supplies, clothing, natural products and products from Avon and Yanbal. She has been part of the borrower group for the past 4 years and she likes it for the help that the group always gives her.  Her goals are continue improving her life more and more.

loans.use: to purchase supplies, clothing, natural products and products from Avon and Yanbal.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase sand and cement to repair the pila (a large water basin) and the bathroom.

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr:
Madame AWA est née en avril 1984 à KADIOLO, mariée, mère de 5 enfants, elle réside avec son époux et leurs enfants dans une famille traditionnelle à MEDINE un quartier populaire dans la ville de Sikasso 3ième région administrative de la république du MALI. 
Cette brave femme après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès s’est initiée aux activités d’achat et de vente des oignons et des cubes maggi.  Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché.
A fin de satisfaire le besoin de sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle sollicite auprès de l’Institution de Micro Finance Soro Yiriwaso un deuxième prêt individuel commerçant. Le prêt antérieur a été correctement remboursé.
Ce prêt lui permettra de faire l’achat de 10 paniers de 50 kg d’oignon, 5 cartons de cube maggi pour la revendre en détail au marché à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit.  
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 35 000 francs CFA par mois. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
Awa was born in April 1984 in Kadiolo. She is married and the mother of 5 children and lives with her husband and their children in a traditional family in Medine, a popular district of Sikasso town, in the third administrative region of the Republic of Mali.

Having tried several businesses without any success, this hard-working woman has started buying and selling onions and Maggi stock cubes. She gets her supplies at the Grand Market. She is requesting her second individual business loan from the MFI Soro Yiriwaso in order to satisfy the needs of her growing clientèle. The previous loan was properly repaid. This loan will enable her to buy 10 50-kilo baskets of onions and 5 boxes of stock cubes which she will resell at the market for cash or credit to a retail clientèle made up of men and women. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 35 000 francs. This profit will enable her to repay the loan and its interest and to build her savings.

loans.use: to buy onions and Maggi stock cubes.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
A 1,000 USD loan is offered to Virginia to improve her business. She is married and has one child. She has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day. She will buy some additional supplies such as fish, biscuits, oils, milk, bread, noodles, sugar, and coffee. She has been involving herself in business activities since 2011. She feels so comfortable to run her business because she can earn money every day.

Running a business has made Virginia independent because she can be responsible for herself while also helping her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future. She is happy with this loan because it is offered to poor people to improve their living conditions. Her husband is a teacher.

loans.use: To buy fish, biscuits, oils, milk, bread, noodles, sugar and coffee

loans.name: María Gaudelia

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Las Divas De Tosagua, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 47 años de edad, está separada pero  de esa relación tiene cuatro hijos, dos ellos mayores de edad y dos de 12 y 10 años que estudian en colegio y escuela.
Doña María es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto sacar adelante a sus hijos se dedica a la venta de ropa y  productos de Belcorp (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta,  realiza sus recorridos  cuatro días por semana para dejar y cobrar sus productos que da a crédito. Ella también para obtener ingresos extras cría pollos y chachos. Tiene más de 11 años que se dedica a estas actividades.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa, perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y alimentos para  pollos y chanchos. Ella está desde  el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito le gusta por la puntualidad de los créditos. Sus sueños son seguir adelante y tener buena salud.
texts.en:
In the city of Tosagua, the credit group Las Divas de Tosagua meets every two weeks. This place is known as being very dynamic, and the majority of the inhabitants work in agriculture and raising animals, since it is an area of lush vegetation.

In this place lives María. She is 47 years old and separated, but from that relationship she has four children, two of whom are adults and two are 12 and 10 years old and are secondary and primary school students.  

María is a housewife who, in order to earn her own resources, and with this get her children ahead, works selling clothing and Belcorp products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume and accessories for women). She sells door to door and does her rounds four days per week to leave and collect for products that she gives on credit. Also, in order to earn extra income, she raises chickens and pigs. She has worked for over 11 years in these lines of work.

This loan is to purchase clothing, perfumes, creams. cosmetics, and feed for chickens and pigs. She has been a part of this credit group since the beginning and she likes it for the punctuality of the loans.  Her dreams are to continue on and to have good health.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, perfumes, creams, cosmetics and feed for chickens and pigs.

loans.name: Magdalena Maribel

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Las Divas De Tosagua, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora Magdalena, tiene 43 años de edad,  está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos mayores de edad, dos de ellos aun viven con ella. Su esposo es chofer.
Doña Magdalena es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa,  cosméticos y productos naturales de la marca Garden con lo cual tiene mucha clientela. Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella realiza recorridos  cuatro días por semana para dejar  y cobrar los productos que deja a crédito. Tiene más de 6  años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual se gana algo por el bien de su familia.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa,  cremas, cosméticos y productos naturales. Ella está desde  el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. Sus sueños son seguir mejorando su negocio.
texts.en:
In the city of Tosagua, the credit group Las Divas de Tosagua meets every two weeks. This place is known as being very dynamic, and the majority of its inhabitants work in agriculture and raising animals, as it is an area of lush vegetation.

In this place lives Magdalena. She is 43 years old, married, and from this relationship has three adult children, two of whom still live with her. Her husband is a driver.

Magdalena is a housewife who, in order to earn her own income, and with this help her husband with the household expenses, works selling clothing, cosmetics and natural products of the Garden brand, with which she has many customers. She sells door to door and does her rounds four days per week in order to leave and collect for the products that she leaves on credit. She has worked for over 6 years in this line of work, with which she earns something for the good of her family.

This loan is to purchase clothing, creams, cosmetics and natural products.  She has been part of the credit group from the beginning and likes it for the help that the loans offer.  Her dreams are to continue improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, creams, cosmetics and natural products.

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr:
Madame AWA est née vers 1964 à SAN, mariée, elle vit avec son époux dans une famille traditionnelle à SANOUBOUGOU I un quartier populaire dans la ville de Sikasso 3ième région administrative de la république du MALI. 
Cette brave femme après avoir mené beaucoup d’activité sans succès s’est initiée des activités d’achat et de vente des cubes maggi, des vinaigres, des eaux de javelles, des concentrées de tomate. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché.
A fin de satisfaire le besoin de sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle sollicite auprès de l’Institution de Micro Finance Soro Yiriwaso un treizième prêt individuel commerçant. Les prêts antérieurs ont été correctement remboursés.
Ce prêt lui permettra de faire l’achat de 7 cartons de cube maggi, 10 cartons de vinaigres, 10 cartons  d’eau de javelle, 5 cartons de concentrée de tomate pour la revendre en détail au marché à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit.  
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 105 000 francs CFA par mois. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
Awa was born around 1964 in San. She is married and lives with her husband in a traditional family in Sanoubougou I, a popular district of Sikasso town, in the third administrative region of the Republic of Mali.

Having tried several businesses without any success, this hard-working woman has started buying and selling Maggi stock cubes, vinegars, household bleaches and tomato concentrate. She gets her supplies at the Grand Market. She is requesting her 13th individual business loan from the MFI Soro Yiriwaso in order to satisfy the needs of her growing clientèle. The previous loans have been properly repaid. This loan will enable her to buy 7 boxes of stock cubes, 10 boxes of vinegar, 10 boxes of bleach and 5 boxes of tomato concentrate which she will resell at the market for cash or credit to a retail clientèle made up of men and women. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 105 000 francs. This profit will enable her to repay the loan and its interest and to build her savings.

loans.use: to buy condiments and bleach.

loans.name: María Cecilia

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Las Divas De Tosagua, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 29 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 9, 8 y 6 años que estudian en escuela. El marido es ganadero.
Doña María como buena esposa que es realiza el crédito para ella y para  su esposo,  ella se dedica a la venta de productos Avon  y Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). El se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado para lo cual se desplaza a los campos aledaños a comprar vacas o chanchos para luego llevarlos a los sitios de faenamiento, la carne vende en los mercados de la localidad y ciudades vecinas. Ella sale a ofrecer sus productos por la ciudad, son 8 años que lleva con sus ventas con lo cual se gana algo por el bien de su familia. 
Este crédito es para comprar cosméticos, perfumes, cremas y ganado. Lleva 5 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son de mucha ayuda para su familia. Sus sueños son tener un camión para que su marido realice su labor.
texts.en:
In the city of Tosagua, the credit group Las Divas de Tosagua meet every two weeks. This place is known for being very dynamic and the majority of its inhabitants work in agriculture and raising animals, as it is an area of lush vegetation. 

In this place lives María. She is 29 years old and in a common-law marriage from which she has three children, ages 9, 8, and 6, who are students. Her husband deals in livestock. 

María, the good wife that she is, takes out the loan for herself and for her husband. She works selling Avon and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and women's accessories). He works buying and selling livestock for which he travels around the nearby fields to purchase cows or pigs to later bring them to slaughter houses. He sells the meat in local markets and those in nearby cities. She sells her products in the city, she has been selling them for 8 years; with that she earns something for the good of her family.

This loan is to purchase cosmetics, perfumes, creams, and livestock. She has been a part of the credit group for 5 years and she likes it because the loans are very helpful for her family. Her dreams are to have a truck with which her husband can do his work.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics, perfumes, creams, and livestock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Safiatou

texts.fr:
Madame SAFIATOU  est née vers 1968 à SIKASSO, mariée, mère de 4 enfants, elle réside sous couvert de son époux et leurs enfants dans une famille traditionnelle à KABOILA II un quartier populaire dans la ville de Sikasso 3ième région administrative de la république du MALI. 
Cette brave femme après avoir mené beaucoup d’activité sans succès s’est initiée aux activités d’achat et de vente des pagnes wax réal. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché.
A fin de satisfaire le besoin de sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle sollicite auprès de l’Institution de Micro Finance Soro Yiriwaso un quatrième prêt individuel commerçant. Les prêts antérieurs ont été correctement remboursés.
Ce prêt lui permettra de faire l’achat de 30 pièces de pagne wax réal pour la revendre en détail au marché à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit.  
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 58 000 francs CFA par mois. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
Safiatou was born around 1968 in Sikasso. She is married and the mother of 4 children and lives with her husband and their children in a traditional family in Kaboila II, a popular district of Sikasso town, in the third administrative region of the Republic of Mali.

Having tried several businesses without any success, this hard-working woman started buying and selling réal wax pagnes (highly colourful and decorative West African clothing). She gets her supplies at the Grand Market. She is requesting a 4th individual business loan from the MFI Soro Yiriwaso in order to satisfy the needs of her growing clientèle. The previous loans have been correctly repaid. This loan will enable her to buy 30 pieces of réal wax pagnes which she will resell at the market for cash or credit to a retail clientèle made up of men and women. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 58 000 francs. This profit will enable her to repay the loan and its interest and to build her savings.

loans.use: to buy réal wax pagnes.

loans.name: Antonia Digna

texts.es: Doña Antonia se dedica al comercio, tiene su pequeño establecimiento en donde vende productos variados como ropa interior, lima para pedicure, fajas y calzados en un mercado de Managua, ella solicita el crédito para continuar mejorando las condiciones de su vivienda con el crédito anterior realizo un cuarto en el cual ahora sus hijos disfrutan de privacidad y comodidad, dejo pendiente levantar el muro perimetral que ahora desea retomar ya que es de vital importancia para la seguridad de su hogar y sobre todo de la familia.
texts.en: Antonia works as a merchant. She has a small business where she sells a variety of products such as underwear, files for pedicures, girdles, and shoes in a market in Managua. She asks for the loan to continue improving the condition of her house. With the previous loan, she built a room in which her children now enjoy privacy and comfort. She still has the perimeter wall to complete which she wants to work on again since it is of vital importance for the security of the home, and above all, of her family.

loans.use: to purchase concrete blocks, cement, sand, iron and wire.

loans.name: Ana Virginia

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Las Divas De Tosagua, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora Ana, tiene 30 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de  8, 7  y 3 años, los dos mayores estudian en escuela. Su esposo es artesano.
Doña Ana es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de productos naturales de la marca Garden, son cuatro años que vende estos productos y tiene muchos los clientes, como son tratamientos continuos y cada vez que los visita les deja nuevos productos, ella  deja a crédito y cobra cada semana. Así ella se gana algo que le sirve para  la educación de sus hijos.
Este crédito es para comprar todo tipo de productos naturales Garden. Lleva 5 ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito le gusta porque los créditos le permiten financiar su negocio. Sus sueños son que sus hijos tengan una buena educación.
texts.en:
In the city of Tosagua, the credit group Las Divas de Tosagua meet every two weeks. This place is known for being very dynamic and the majority of its inhabitants work in agriculture and raising animals, as it is an area of lush vegetation.

In this place lives Ana. She is 30 years old, married, and from this relationship has three children, ages 8, 7, and 3.  The two older ones are students. Her husband is a craftsman. 

Ana is a housewife who, in order to earn her own income and with this help her husband with the household expenses, works selling Garden brand natural products. She has sold these products for four years and has many customers, since they are continuous treatments and every time that she visits them, she leaves new products. She leaves them on credit and collects every week. In this way, she earns something that she uses for her children's education.

This loan is to purchase all types of Garden natural products. She has been in the credit group for 5 loan cycles and she likes it because the loans permit her to finance her business. Her dreams are that her children have a good education.

loans.use: to purchase natural products.

loans.name: Jiguisseme 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe JIGUISSEME 1 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans, ont en moyenne 3 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à BLENDIO un village dans la commune de NIENA dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est de riz avec madame SALIMATA débout à la deuxième position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme  JIGUISSEME 1. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 1 sac de 50 kg d’engrais, 1 bidon d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0. 5 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 73 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Jiguisseme 1 group are married women who on average are 39 years old with three children, living for the most part in traditional families in Blendio, a village in the Niena commune, which is part of the Sikasso circle, in the third administrative region of Mali.

They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution in carrying out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their third agricultural loan cycle with the institution, and previous loans have been repaid in full.

The crop cultivated is rice featuring Mrs. Salimata, who is standing in the second position from left to right in the photo of this Jiguisseme 1 group of women.

She will use her loan to buy one 50-kilo bag of fertilizer, one container of herbicide, and pay for plowing to maintain 0.5 hectares (about 1.24 acres). After harvest the crop is sold at village level and in Sikasso, to a clientele composed of men and women, for cash and on credit. 

She expects to make average profits of 73,000 CFA francs per crop year, which will enable her to pay off her loan and also help her husband with daily expenses.

loans.use: buy fertilizer, herbicide, and pay for plowing

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry, 22 years old, is a married Ugandan man blessed with 2 children aged between 5 and 3, but only one is in school. He is engaged in boda-boda (motorcycle) transport, a popular youth activity in Uganda from which he earns a living.

He needs a loan to buy iron sheets for roofing his residential house and he dreams of buying his own personal car. His challenge is bad roads leading to constant mechanical problems, therefore an expense for him.

loans.use: to buy iron sheets for roofing his residential house

loans.name: Tania Carolina

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Las Divas De Tosagua, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora Tania, tiene 20 años de edad, es madre soltera de un hijo de un año de edad. Ella vive en casa de los padres.
Doña Tania con la intención de ganar algo por su cuenta para  salir adelante con su pequeño hijo  se dedica al comercio, ella vende zapatos  por catalogo, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes más conocidos. Lleva 3 años con su negocio y le gusta porque se gana algo y está atenta a las necesidades de su pequeño.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar zapatos de todo tipo. Lleva 2 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos financia mejor su negocio. Sus sueños son darle lo mejor a su pequeño.
texts.en:
In the city of Tosagua, the credit group Las Divas de Tosagua meet every two weeks. This place is known for being very dynamic and the majority of its inhabitants work in agriculture and raising animals, as it is an area of lush vegetation.

In this place lives Tania. She is 20 years old and is a single mother of a one-year-old child. She lives in her parents' house. 

Tania, with the intention to earn something of her own in order to get ahead with her little boy, works in sales. She sells shoes from a catalog. She sells from door to door and also sells in her house where some of her most known customers come. She has been in this business for three years and she likes it because she earns something and also can take care of her little one's needs.

She will use this loan to purchase all sorts of shoes. She has been in the credit group for 2 years and she likes it because the loans finance her business better. Her dreams are to give her little one the best.

loans.use: Comprar zapatos.

loans.name: Saidkul

texts.en:
Saidkul is a kind man. He lives with his wife, 6 children and some grandchildren in a big house which is located in a rural area.

Saidkul grows agricultural products such as crops, wheat, and potatoes on 3 hectares of land. He has been busy with this business for more than 30 years. He is an experienced farmer, and his wife helps him with growing agricultural products. Saidkul is also feeding some cows. He is a very hardworking man. 

Saidkul needs financial support because his smaller son wants to be married, but Saidkul has not enough money to pay for marriage party expenses. He is asking for a loan of 7,500 somoni to organize a wedding party for his son. This loan will help to create a family in Tajikistan.

loans.use: to organize a wedding party for his son

loans.name: Carmelo

texts.es: Carmelo: Es un hombre trabajador. Tiene 41 años de edad casado, tiene 2 hijos menores de edad. Desde su niñez  se ha dedicado a trabajar en la agricultura, tiene una finca de 30 hectáreas, ubicada en la comunidad de Columbus a 100 km del Municipio de Puerto Cabezas, la cual es destinada a la actividad pecuaria: acopio y venta de bovinos y cerdos. Solicita su primer financiamiento para comprar 47 lechones de cerdos, engordarlos y comercializarlos.  Su sueño es aumentar el peso de los bovinos y los cerdos  e incrementar  el hato de ganado y fortalecer los ingresos económicos de la familia.
texts.en: Carmelo is a hard-working man. His is 41 years old, married, and has 2 children who are minors. Since his childhood, he has worked in agriculture. He has a 30 hectare farm, located in the community of Columbus, 100 km from the municipality of Puerto Cabezas, which is dedicated to livestock raising, the collection and sale of cows and pigs. He asks for his first loan to purchase 47 piglets, fatten them, and sell them. His dream is to increase the weight of the cows and pigs and increase the herd of livestock and strengthen the family's economic earnings.

loans.use: to purchase 47 piglets, fatten them and sell them

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Marbely

texts.es: Marbely: Es casada, tiene 32 años de edad con 2 hijos, en edad escolar. Desde hace 5 años vivía en una casita pequeña de tambo de madera. Su esposo es conductor de camiones. Solicita su primer financiamiento para construir su vivienda de concreto, comprar materiales para mejorar su cocina: Pantri, azulejos, cemento, hierros, tubos PVC. Su sueño terminar de construir su vivienda de concreto.
texts.en: Marbely is married, 32 years old, with 2 school-aged children. For the past 4 years, she has lived in a small wooden house on stilts. Her husband is a truck driver. She asks for her first loan to construct her concrete house, and purchase materials to improve her kitchen: cabinets, tiles, cement, iron, and PVC tubing. Her dream is to complete the construction of her concrete home.

loans.use: to purchase materials to improve her kitchen such as cabinets, tiles, cement, iron, and PVC tubing.

loans.name: Modesto

texts.es: Modesto: Es un hombre luchador, originario de Puerto Cabezas, tiene 61 años de edad, casado, tiene 2 hijos mayores de edad. Su esposa es ama de casa. Desde hace aproximadamente 16 años vivía en una casa de tambo de madera, habitada por 6 personas, trabaja en una institución del gobierno central.  Con los préstamos anteriores otorgados por PANA PANA, le han permitido construir poco a poco su vivienda de concreto. Solicita financiamiento para terminar de construir su vivienda, comprar los materiales de construcción: cemento, zinc, hierro, arena fina, arena gruesa, madera. Su  sueño es vivir de manera segura y digna.
texts.en: Modesto is a determined man, originally from Puerto Cabezas. His is 61 years old, married, and has 2 adult children. His wife is a housewife.  For approximately 16 years, he has lived in a wooden house on stilts with 6 people living in it. He works in a central government office. With previous loans granted by PANA PANA, he has been able to build his concrete house little by little. He asks for a loan to finish the construction of his house, and purchase construction materials: cement, zinc, iron, fine sand, course sand, and wood. His dream is to live in a safe and dignified way.

loans.use: to complete the construction of his concrete house.

loans.name: Yuri

texts.es: Yuri: Es una joven, sociable, originaria de Puerto Cabezas, tiene 25 años de edad,  casada, tiene 2 hijos menores, el mayor de 8 años cursa su segundo grado de primaria. Su esposo es comerciante. Con el objetivo de tener su propia fuente de ingresos, desde hace 6 años inicio su negocio de venta de repuestos de bicicletas y venta de frito. Solicita su primer financiamiento para diversificar su negocio, comprar en Managua ropa usada y venderla a precios accesibles. Su sueño es tener una boutique de ropa usada para varones.
texts.en: Yuri is a sociable young woman, originally from Puerto Cabezas. She is 25 years old, married, and has 2 young children. The older, 8 years old, is in second grade at the primary school. Her husband is a merchant. With the objective of having her own source of income, 6 years ago she started her business selling spare parts for bicycles and fried food. She asks for her first loan to diversify her business, to purchase used clothing in Managua and sell it at accessible prices. Her dream is to have a boutique of men's used clothing.

loans.use: to purchase used clothing in Managua.

loans.name: Ana Isabel

texts.es:
Ana es una mujer de 51 años de edad viuda y madre de dos hijos.
Ana quedó viuda hace varios años, con su esposo juntaron un pequeño capital económico con el que ahora ella trabaja. Sus hijos; el mayor ya es profesional  y vive en otro lugar, su hija se encuentra estudiando en la universidad y también trabaja, pesé a todas las dificultades Ana pudo hacer estudiar a sus hijos y educarlos bien.
El único sueño de Ana es ver a su hija salir profesional y trabajando. Ella aporta económicamente con las ventas de la tienda y vende; azúcar, arroz, pan, gaseosas, golosinas, etc., Ana necesita ayudar a su hija a comprar material de estudios, para lograr hacer eso tiene que abastecer su tienda y con los beneficios ayudar a comprar materiales de estudios a su hija.
Es por ese motivo que Ana solicita un préstamo para abastecer su tienda y con los beneficios ayudar a pagar los estudios de su hija.
texts.en:
Ana is a 51-year-old woman, a widow and mother of two children.

Ana became a widow a number of years ago, and with her husband they had saved a small amount of economic capital, with which she works now. Of her children, the older is already a professional and lives in another place, her daughter is a university student and also works. Despite all the difficulties, Ana could allow her children to study and educate them well. 

The only dream Ana has is to see her daughter become a working professional. She supports herself with the sales from the store. She sells sugar, rice, bread, soft drinks, snacks, etc. Ana needs to help her daughter purchase school supplies. To manage this, she needs to stock her store and with the profits help her daughter purchase school supplies.

It is for this reason that Ana asks for a loan to stock her store and with the profits, help her daughter pay for her education.

loans.use: to stock her store and with the profit, pay for her daughter's education

loans.name: Sanata

texts.fr:
Madame SANATA  est née vers 1968 à SIKASSO, mariée, mère de 8 enfants, elle réside sous couvert de son époux et leurs enfants dans une famille traditionnelle à HAMDALLAYE un quartier populaire dans la ville de Sikasso 3ième région administrative de la république du MALI. 
Cette brave femme après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès s’est initiée aux activités d’achat et de vente des pagnes wax réal, des savons en poudre “omo, kline”. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché.
A fin de satisfaire le besoin de sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle sollicite auprès de l’Institution de Micro Finance Soro Yiriwaso un deuxième prêt individuel commerçant. Le prêt antérieur a été correctement remboursé.
Ce prêt lui permettra de faire l’achat de 15 pièces de pagne wax réal, 5 cartons de savons en poudre “omo, kline” pour la revendre en détail au marché à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit.  
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 42 000 francs CFA par mois. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
Sanata was born around 1968 in Sikasso. She is married and the mother of 8 children and lives with her husband and their children in a traditional family in Hamdallaye, a popular district of Sikasso town, in the third administrative region of the Republic of Mali.

Having tried several businesses without any success, this hard-working woman started buying and selling réal wax pagnes (highly colourful and decorative West African clothing) and washing powder (e.g. Omo and Kline). She gets her supplies at the Grand Market. She is requesting a second individual business loan from the MFI Soro Yiriwaso in order to satisfy the needs of her growing clientèle. The previous loan was properly repaid. This loan will enable her to buy 15 pieces of réal wax pagnes and 5 boxes of washing powder which she will resell at the market for cash or credit to a retail clientèle made up of men and women. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 42 000 francs. This profit will enable her to repay the loan and its interest and to build her savings.

loans.use: to buy 15 pieces of réal wax pagnes and 5 boxes of washing powder.

loans.name: Fotemogoban 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe FOTEMOGOBAN 1 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 33 ans, ont en moyenne 2 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à KAPALA une commune dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est de mil avec madame  AFOU  débout à la deuxième position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme   FOTEMOGOBAN 1. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 1 sac de 50 kg d’engrais, 1 bidon d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,5 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 73 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et son intérêt, aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The 10 members of the Fotemogoban 1 group are married women with an average age of 33 and, on average, 2 children. They mostly live in traditional families in Kapala, a commune in the Sikasso Circle, third administrative region of Mali. They are working with Soro Yiriwaso in order to be able to carry out their agricultural activities during the rainy season. This is their 3rd loan from the MFI Soro Yiriwaso. The previous loans have been correctly repaid.

Afou, standing second on the left in the picture, grows millet.  Thanks to her loan, she plans to buy one 50-kilo bag of fertiliser and a can of herbicide and to pay the wages of the labourers she needs to maintain half a hectare of land. After the harvest, the produce is sold for cash or credit in the village and in Sikasso to a clientèle composed of men and women. She expects to make an average profit of 73 000 francs per crop cycle. This profit will enable her to repay the loan and its interest and to support her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertiliser and herbicides and to pay the labourers' wages.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in the year 2012 and she appreciates the programs, services and continuous education of the coop. She is a member in good standing and very active in attending the various programs and services that the cooperative offers.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 7,000. This loan is intended to purchase piglets and feeds.

Estrella dreams of nothing more than a happy, healthy life and an adequate income out of her business.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and feeds.

loans.name: Fotemogoban 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe FOTEMOGOBAN 2 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 33 ans, ont en moyenne 2 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à KAPALA une commune dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est de mil avec madame MINIAN débout à la deuxième position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme   FOTEMOGOBAN 2. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 1 sac de 50 kg d’engrais, 1 bidon d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,5 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 73 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et son intérêt, aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The 10 members of the Fotemogoban 2 group are married women with an average age of 33 and, on average, 2 children. They mostly live in traditional families in Kapala, a commune in the Sikasso Circle, third administrative region of Mali. They are working with Soro Yiriwaso in order to be able to carry out their agricultural activities during the rainy season. This is their 3rd loan from the MFI Soro Yiriwaso. The previous loans have been correctly repaid.

Minian, standing second from the right in the group picture, grows millet. She plans to use her loan to buy one 50-kilo bag of fertiliser and a can of herbicide and to pay the wages of the labourers she needs to maintain half a hectare of farmland. After the harvest, the produce is sold for cash or credit in the village and in Sikasso to a clientèle composed of men and women. She expects to make an average profit of 73 000 francs per crop cycle. This profit will enable her to repay the loan and its interest and to support her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertiliser and herbicide and to pay the labourers' wages.

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.es:
Trinidad es una mujer de 30 años de edad vive con su pareja y es madre de 1 niño.
Ella concluyó sus estudios secundarios y empezó a estudiar peluquería para poder acceder a un trabajo. Comenzó a trabajar como ayudante de peluquera durante tres años y a medio tiempo mientras el demás tiempo lo ocupaba con su bebe, el niño ya creció y ahora tiene 5 años asiste a la escuela y estudia. Trinidad quiere independizarse considera que ya tiene la experiencia suficiente para tener su propia peluquería. La idea de su vida es tener su propia peluquería y administrarla también está planeando la organización del lugar; la ubicación y el material necesario. Trinidad ya alquiló un ambiente, lo amobló  y cuenta ya con algunos clientes pero todavía le faltan materiales de trabajo como vitrinas y accesorios de peluquería para poder competir en el mercado.
Es por ese motivo que Trinidad solicita un préstamo para comprar una vitrina y accesorios de peluquería para pagar los gastos de su bebé.
texts.en:
Trinidad is a 30-year-old woman who lives with her partner and is the mother of one child.

She finished her secondary schooling and started to study hairdressing in order to be able to have a job. She started to work as an assistant hairdresser for three and a half years while the rest of the time, she took care of her baby. The child grew and now is 5 years old and goes to school and is a student. Trinidad wants to become independent and thinks she now has sufficient experience to open her own beauty salon. Her idea for life is to have her own beauty salon and run it, she is also planning to organize the place, the location and necessary materials. Trinidad already rented the location, furnished it and has some customers, but she lacks working materials such as display cases and beauty salon accessories to be able to compete in the market.  

For this reason, Trinidad asks for a loan to purchase a display case and beauty salon accessories and to pay her baby's expenses.

loans.use: to purchase beauty salon accessories and with the profits, pay the costs of her baby.

loans.name: Jiguisseme 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les 7 membres du groupe JIGUISSEME 3 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans, ont en moyenne 4 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à BLENDIO un village dans la commune de NIENA dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est de riz avec madame SAFIATOU débout à la première position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme  JIGUISSEME 3. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 1 sac de 50 kg d’engrais, 1 bidon d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0. 5 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 73 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The seven members of the Jiguisseme 3 group are married women who on average are 35 years old with four children, living for the most part in traditional families in Blendio, a village in the Niena commune, which is part of the Sikasso circle, in the third administrative region of Mali.

They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution in carrying out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their third agricultural loan cycle with the institution, and previous loans have been repaid in full.

The crop cultivated is rice featuring Mrs. Safiatou, who is standing in the first position from right to left in the photo of this Jiguisseme 3 group of women.

She will use her loan to buy one 50-kilo bag of fertilizer, one container of herbicide, and pay for plowing to maintain 0.5 hectares (about 1.24 acres).

After harvest the crop is sold at village level and in Sikasso, to a clientele composed of men and women, for cash and on credit.

She expects to make average profits of 73,000 CFA francs per crop year, which will enable her to pay off her loan and also help her husband with daily expenses.

loans.use: buy fertilizer, herbicide and pay for plowing

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta, 58 years old and married, is a resident of Sta. Filomena Dipolog City.

She earns a living through rice farming and vegetable gardening.

She has been a member of PMPC for two years and enjoys the privileges of being a member of the cooperative. Now, she is applying a loan of PHP 11,000 to purchase fertilizers and pay labor costs for rice field and land cultivation.

Violeta deeply wishes to remain a member in good standing with PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pay labor costs for rice field and land cultivation.

loans.name: Richard

texts.es: El señor Richard, vive con su concubina la señora Lizeth y su pequeña hija en la población de entre ríos, en una casa alquilada desde hace aproximadamente 5 años. El señor trabaja como mecánico arreglando motocicletas en un local alquilado, su larga experiencia en el área hizo que cada vez más clientes llegaran hasta su taller para poder hacer reparar sus motocicletas pero además de reparar sentía que hacía falta algo más entonces decidió comprar su rectificadora de cilindros y poder de esa forma aumentar sus ingresos ya que es el único taller de la zona donde realizan esta actividad, la inversión para la compra de esta herramienta fue un poco elevada por lo que le falto dinero, por ello decidió solicitar un préstamo para iniciar la construcción de su vivienda en su lote urbano que fue adquirido con mucho esfuerzo, donde podrá vivir de manera más cómoda y tranquila junto a su familia.
texts.en: Richard has lived with his partner Lizeth and his young daughter in a town between rivers, in a rented house for approximately 5 years. He works as a mechanic fixing motorcycles in a rented space. His extensive experience in the area brings more and more people to his shop to repair their motorcycles but in addition to repairs, he felt that he was lacking something else, so he then decided to purchase a roll grinder, and to be able in this way to increase his income since his is the only shop in the area that does this. The investment for the purchase of this tool was a bit high, and for this he lacks money. For this reason, he decided to ask for a loan to begin constructing his house on an urban lot that was acquired with a great deal of effort, where he will be able to live in a more comfortable and peaceful way with his family.

loans.use: to build his house.

loans.name: Jiguisseme 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les 10 membres du groupe JIGUISSEME 2 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans, ont en moyenne 3 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à BLENDIO un village dans la commune de NIENA dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est de riz avec madame BARAKISSA M  débout à la première position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme  JIGUISSEME 2. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 1 sac de 50 kg d’engrais, 1 bidon d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0. 5 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 73 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.

The ten members of the Jiguisseme 2 group are married women who on average are 36 years old with three children, living for the most part in traditional families in Blendio, a village in the Niena commune, which is part of the Sikasso circle, in the third administrative region of Mali.

They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution in carrying out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their third agricultural loan cycle with the institution, and previous loans have been repaid in full.

The crop cultivated is rice featuring Mrs. Barakissa M., who is standing in the first position from left to right in the photo of this Jiguisseme 2 group of women.

She will use her loan to buy one 50-kilo bag of fertilizer, one container of herbicide, and pay for plowing to maintain 0.5 hectares (about 1.24 acres).

After harvest the crop is sold at village level and in Sikasso, to a clientele composed of men and women, for cash and on credit.

She expects to make average profits of 73,000 CFA francs per crop year, which will enable her to pay off her loan and also help her husband with daily expenses.

loans.use: buy fertilizer, herbicide, and pay for plowing

loans.name: Jiguisseme 4 Group

texts.fr:
Les 7 membres du groupe JIGUISSEME 4 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans, ont en moyenne 4 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à BLENDIO un village dans la commune de NIENA dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est de riz avec madame AMINATA débout à la première position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme  JIGUISSEME 4. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 1 sac de 50 kg d’engrais, 1 bidon d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0. 5 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 73 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The seven members of the Jiguisseme 4 group are married women who on average are 37 years old with four children, living for the most part in traditional families in Blendio, a village in the Niena commune, which is part of the Sikasso circle, in the third administrative region of Mali.

They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution in carrying out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their third agricultural loan cycle with the institution, and previous loans have been repaid in full.

The crop cultivated is rice featuring Mrs. Aminata, who is standing in the first position from right to left in the photo of this Jiguisseme 4 group of women.

She will use her loan to buy one 50-kilo bag of fertilizer, one container of herbicide, and pay for plowing to maintain 0.5 hectares (about 1.24 acres).

After harvest the crop is sold at village level and in Sikasso, to a clientele composed of men and women, for cash and on credit.

She expects to make average profits of 73,000 CFA francs per crop year, which will enable her to pay off her loan and also help her husband with daily expenses.

loans.use: buy fertilizer, herbicide, and pay for plowing

loans.name: Somala

texts.en: Somala is 20 years old. She is a student and lives in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. Due to lack of financial support, she would like to apply for a loan of $2,625 for her tuition fee in Medicine for two and a half years. This loan will help her graduate. In the future, she wants to be a good doctor.

loans.use: To pay for her tuition fee

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Hardworking mother best describes Julieta, 32 years old, residing in the municipality of Molave, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines.  

The wage that her husband gets isn’t enough to sustain their daily needs. Julieta has been in business more than a year now.
 
Julieta wants to expand her dry goods retailing business. She wants to gain more profit and to have enough to sustain her family, especially for her children, and she would like to be able to send her son to college. 

In order for her to make her wish possible, she needs PHP 20,000 additional capital and will use the money to expand her business. She intends to purchase inventories of ready-to- wear (clothes) and dry goods for resale. She hopes to live a comfortable life someday with her family.

loans.use: to purchase inventories of ready-to-wear and dry goods for resale.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in the year 2012 and she appreciates the programs, services and continous education of the cooperative. She is a member in good standing and very active in attending the various programs and services that the cooperative offers.

She is requesting a loan intended to buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides for her garden.

Vilma dreams of nothing more than to have a happy, healthy life and an adequate income out of her business.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and insecticides.

loans.name: Kutbiya

texts.en: Kutbiya is a kind woman. She is married and raises 3 children. Her husband is an entrepreneur. Kutbiya has worked in a local hospital as nurse for more than 4 years. She is hardworking woman and does her job well. She uses her salary to buy food items for her household. Kutbiya is going to buy a fridge and vacuum cleaner for her household but her saving is not enough for it. She is asking for a loan of 3000 Somoni to buy a fridge and vacuum cleaner. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy a fridge and vacuum cleaner for her household

loans.name: Editha

texts.en: Editha is 53 years old, married and has two children. One of her children is working abroad and sends them financial support to provide their needs. Editha doesn’t want to depend only on her child's support; that’s why she set up her sari-sari store business as her source of income. Now, Editha is selling a variety of grocery items, feed for hogs, and rice grain. Editha is aiming to increase her earnings. She is requesting a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy feed, rice, and grocery items to sell. She hopes for continued growth of her business to have a stable source of income that allows her to sustain all their needs. She will do her best to make her business stable and soon will no longer ask for her child's assistance.

loans.use: to buy feed, rice, and grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
Teresia is a 28-year-old lady who is married. Together with her spouse they have been blessed with two children who are 7 years and 1 year old.

Teresia sells second hand clothes, a business she has done for the last  three years, earning a monthly income of Kshs. 10,000.

Teresia has requested a loan of Kshs. 30,000, which she will use to purchase bales of second hand clothes for resale. With the profits from the loan, Teresia will be able to educate her child as well as expand her current business.

Teresia's desire is to have a prosperous life.

loans.use: to purchase bales of second hand clothes

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is from Sta. Filomena Dipolog City. She is 43 years old, married, and has three children.

In 2012, Imelda applied for membership with PMPC. Hearing all the benefits, she never hesitated to become a member. She maintains the status of being a member in good standing and repays her obligations in a timely manner.

Recently, Imelda asked for financial assistance of PHP 7,000 to purchase piglets and feeds. Through this, she hopes to increase her income and expand her business. She has found assistance for her family's financial needs through Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative and she is very thankful with all her heart.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and feeds.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her as she was able to buy the needed spare parts of her tricycle unit. Her loan helped not just in her business but also in the education of her children. Her income from the business is assisting their everyday household expenditures. Her husband is helping her in generating income to provide for their family. 

She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of their tricycle unit. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her family's daily needs and her children's educational expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Marites dreams to have other sources of income and hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to find strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and the maintenance of her tricycle unit

loans.name: Jorge Stefan

texts.es: Jorge Stefan: Es un joven luchador, tiene 29 años de edad, originario de Waspan, casado, tiene 4 hijos menores de edad. Desde la edad de 18 años se trasladó al municipio, por motivos de estudios universitarios. Desde más de dos década, ha  utilizado la letrina tradicional con fosas y en tiempo de invierno, prevalecen problemas para acceder a la letrina, debido a la humedad. Solicita su primer financiamiento para construir un servicio higiénico, a través de un sistema de  inodoro ecológico, con su lava mano, con la sumersión de un barril plástico para el almacenamiento de materia liquida y sólida con un sistema de filtración .Su sueño es establecer una micro empresa de mecánica de automotriz.
texts.en: Jorge Stefan is a striving young man. He is 29 years old, is from Waspan, is married and has four young children. He moved to the city at the age of 18 due to his university studies. For more than two decades, he has used a traditional pit latrine and he still has problems accessing the latrine in the winter due to the humidity. He is asking for his first loan to build a bathroom with an ecological toilet and a sink for handwashing, along with the installation of an underground plastic drum for the storage of liquid and solid material and a filtration system. His dream is to start a small business as a car mechanic.

loans.use: to build a bathroom with an ecological toilet system

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 70 years old and married with five children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like sugar, soft drinks, coffee, milk, cream, spices, etc.

Judith has borrowed and repaid 26 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane.

She aspires to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like sugar, soft drinks, coffee, milk, cream, spices, etc.

loans.name: Adelia

texts.en:
Adelia is 28 years old and she is now applying for a loan of $800.00 to improve her business.  She opened her kiosk in 2000 with her own working capital of $20.00.  She earns a good income from her business.

She will use her loan to buy some stock to keep in her store such as shirts, pants, sugar, coffee, oils, and body lotion. She is a very hardworking woman and doing business has become her regular activity for the past 14 years. She wants to make her business bigger and improve her living conditions in the future.

loans.use: To buy shirts, pants, sugar, coffee, oils, and body lotion.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 38 years old and has one child.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from buying and selling jewelry and ready-to-wear goods. 

Rowena requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Rowena has borrowed and paid nine loans from NWTF before this loan. 

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Desida

texts.en:
Desida is 41 years old and married with three children who are in school. Desida works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, and groceries to sell.

Desida has been in this business for 2 years. 

In the future Desida would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Afouchata

texts.fr:
Madame AFOUCHATA est née vers 1967 à ZISILO C/SIKASSO, mariée, mère de 7 enfants, elle réside sous couvert de son époux et leurs enfants dans une famille traditionnelle à SANOUBOUGOU II un quartier populaire dans la ville de Sikasso 3ième region administrative de la république du MALI. 
Cette brave femme après avoir mener beaucoup d’activité sans succès madame AFOUCHATA s’est initiée des activités d’achat et de vente des ignames, des légumes, des gombos. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché.
A fin de satisfaire le besoin de sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle sollicite auprès de l’Institution de Micro Finance Soro Yiriwaso un onzième prêt individuel commerçant. Les prêts antérieurs ont été correctement remboursé.
Ce prêt lui permettra de faire l’achat de 5 sacs de l’igname, 6 sacs de légumes, 8 sacs de gombo sec pour la revendre en détail au marché à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit.  
EIle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 72 000 francs CFA par mois. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
Mrs. Afouchata was born around 1967 in Zisilo C/Sikasso. She is the married mother of seven children, and lives with her husband and their children in a traditional family in Sanoubougou II, a populous area of the city of Sikasso, in the third administrative region of the Republic of Mali. 

After conducting a lot of unsuccessful activities, this courageous woman began retailing yams, vegetables, and okra. She resupplies at the main market.

To satisfy the needs of an increasing number of customers, she is requesting an eleventh individual commercial loan from the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution. All previous loans have been fully repaid. 

This loan will enable her to buy 5 bags of yams, 6 bags of vegetables, 8 bags of dried okra, for retail sales at the market, to a clientele composed of men and women, for cash and on credit.

She hopes to attain average monthly profits of 72,000 CFA francs, which will enable her to pay off the loan and its interest, and put the remainder into savings.

loans.use: buy food products

loans.name: Aurora

texts.en:
Aurora is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her as she was able to buy the needed products and supplies for her farm. Her loan also helped in her poultry business. Her loan helped not just in her businesses but also in the education of her children. Her income from the business is assisting their everyday household expenditures. Her husband, who is an assistant manager, helps her in providing for their family.

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy fertilizer and farm inputs needed in her business. Her profits from her business will definitely help sustain her family's daily needs and her children's educational expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Aurora dreams that her business will last longer and hopes to give her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, and this is where she finds strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer and farm inputs needed in her business

loans.name: Leslie Verenisse

texts.es:
Leslie es una joven emprendedora, tiene 19 años de edad, es soltera y vive en Quilmana junto a su familia.
Desde hace casi un año se dedica a la venta de productos domésticos como, sartén, ollas, vasos, etc. Le va muy bien porque es una persona muy responsable, trabajadora, innovadora y con muchas ganas de salir adelante.
Leslie está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá comprar vitrinas para que de esta manera pueda exhibir sus productos y tener mayores ventas. Gracias a esto ella seguirá esforzándose para apoyar a su familia y más adelante poder cumplir su más grande sueño: "Ser una gran empresaria".
texts.en:
Leslie, 19, is a young entrepreneur.  She's single and lives in Quilmana with her family.

She has sold household products for almost a year: pots, pans, glasses, etc.  It's going very well for her because she's a very responsible, hardworking, and innovative person who very much wants to get ahead.

Leslie's grateful to the Kiva lenders because with their help she'll be able to buy display cases to show her products and make more sales.

Thanks to this she'll continue to work hard to support her family, and later she'll be able to realize her big dream of being a great business owner.

loans.use: to buy a display case for beauty products

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Lilian works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from a restaurant.  

Lilian is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance for her motorcycle transport business.

Lilian has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her business.

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn is 39 years old and married with five children who are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Jenelyn has borrowed and repaid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the business buying and selling charcoal for 7 years and also earns an income from buying and selling rice, and also from motorcycle transport.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: M. Ramzan

texts.en:
M. Ramzan is a 36-year-old married man living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. He is the father of five children; he is a welder and provides welding services in his community. 
He manufactures motor bike spare parts,doors and windows which are usable in houses. He has been providing door-to-door services to weld broken iron accessories as well.
He wants to grow his business by purchasing iron rods; in fact, he has taken an order for manufacturing iron beds, but does not have enough cash in-hand to buy initial raw material. In addition, a few days ago his welding plant has become out-of-order due to overheating and he needs to replace it with a new one. He wants to buy a new welding plant and iron rods, but he does not have cash in hand due to lot of household expenses. 
Therefore, M. Ramzan has requested a loan from Brac who is an active field partner of Kiva, so that he would be able to buy a welding plant and iron rods to fulfill the order of manufacturing iron beds. He thanks Kiva and field partner Brac Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy irons rods for manufacturing charpai.

loans.name: M. Shahzad Naseem

texts.en:
M. Shahzad is 34 years old and is living with his family in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.
 
He has been running a small general store for five years. Previously he was employed in a firm at a low salary. After resignation, he established a general store with his savings. 

His shop is situated at a populated area and his customer base is large, so he has the opportunity to offer miscellaneous general store items. Therefore he wants to offer all those products that are necessary and consumable in daily use. He wants to offer additional items such as bread, jam, milk, cookies, butter, sandwiches, patties, etc. as well. But the major problem is the shortage of funds.

Therefore, M. Shahzad has requested a loan from Kvia’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so he can buy additional items such as bread, jam, milk, cookies, butter, sandwiches, patties, etc.

He is very glad after taking this loan and hopeful that he will be able to fulfill each request for any item and abstain from disappointing his customers. In this way he will be able to generate maximum profit from the sale of additional items.

loans.use: to buy additional inventories for the general store.

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en:
Brenda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of dried fish to sell for her dried fish vending business.

Brenda has been in this business for 1 year. Brenda earns more income from a general store.

Brenda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Amadeo

texts.es:
Amadeo de 31 años de edad, es un agricultor de la zona. Actualmente no ha podido realizar ningún tipo de estudio académico,  ya que no ha podido tener el tiempo necesario para estudiar.  Está acompañado y tiene dos hijos los cuales están yendo a la escuela,  uno está haciendo 5º grado y el otro está yendo a 2 grado en la escuela de su cantón.

Amadeo  tiene 8 años de dedicarse a la agricultura, anteriormente trabajaba como jornal con uno de los hacendados de la zona; pero su padre le heredo unas tierras equivalente a dos hectáreas  de terrenos;  así que desde entonces trabaja como jornal, cultiva maíz en sus propias tierras.  

El dinero del préstamo será invertido en la compra de semillas para sembrar el maíz y también en la compra de insumos tales como abono, fertilizantes, herbicidas ya que tiene una buena parte de dinero y solo necesita ajustar para poder completar su presupuesto.

Amadeo tiene planeado cultivar toda la tierra que su padre le heredo, ya que solo ha estado cultivando la mitad y este año se propuso ahorrar una parte para trabajar y la otra parte será la del crédito que ha solicitado para cultivar las dos hectáreas y sabe que lo va a lograr con la ayuda de su crédito.
texts.en:
Amadeo, 31 years old, is a farmer in the area. He hasn't been able to complete any kind of formal schooling, since he wasn't able to have the necessary time to study. He is partnered and has two children who are going to school. One is in the 5th grade and the other is in the 2nd grade at a school in his canton.

Amadeo has been working in agriculture for 8 years. Previously he worked as a day laborer with one of the farm estates in the area, but his father left him some land equivalent to two hectares of land. So it was that since then he works as a day laborer, he grows corn on his own land.  

The money from the loan will be invested in the purchase of seeds to plant corn and also purchase supplies such as manure, fertilizer, herbicides since he already has a good part of the money and only needs a loan to be able to complete his budget.

Amadeo is planning to plant all the land that his father left him, since he has only been cultivating half of it and this year he decided to save a part to work and the other part will be from the loan he has requested to cultivate the two hectares and he knows that he will be able to do it with the help of his loan.

loans.use: to purchase seeds to plant corn and also purchase supplies such as manure, fertilizer, herbicides since he already has a good part of the money and only needs a loan to be able to complete his budget.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a furniture for children's rooms.

loans.name: Salim

texts.en:
Salim was born and brought up in Pumwani area, a small town in Kenya's capital city Nairobi. He is married and has two children, and he runs a small business so as to provide for his family. As the sole breadwinner for his family he took it upon himself to start a new business that will enable them to lead a more comfortable life. 

Salim decided to invest in pay-per-use toilets since a nearby marketplace has very few sanitation facilities. He seeks a loan to enable him to purchase and run two Fresh Life toilets. Income raised from the venture will be used to repay his loan and provide a better livelihood for his family.

loans.use: To purchase and run two Fresh Life toilets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a bathroom with an ecological toilet and a sink.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es: El señor Antonio es una persona mayor que  vive en la provincia de Tiraque se dedica a la producción agrícola casi todo el año, es una persona sencilla, responsable con capacidad de gestión, de estado civil viudo pero vive con su hija mayor que le ayuda en el trabajo del campo, para la siembra y cosecha utiliza personal eventual que son del lugar, cuenta con casa propia pero es rustica,  para la realización de su trabajo en el campo utiliza tracción animal para la siembra y labores culturales que son sus propias yuntas, actualmente el señor se ve en la necesidad de solicitar un crédito para la compra de abono y semilla de haba para aumentar su producción agrícola y de esa manera mejorar sus ingresos y la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Antonio is an older person who lives in the province of Tiraque. He works in agricultural production almost the entire year. He is a simple, responsible person with management skills. He is a widower, but lives with his adult daughter who helps him with the work in the field. He uses animal power for planting and cultivating procedure that are his own team. Currently he needs to ask for a loan to purchase fertilizer and broad bean seeds to increase his production and in this way increase his income and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and broad bean seeds.

loans.name: Maria Nela

texts.es:
María es una mujer de 38 años de edad soltera y madre de 3 hijos.
Sus hijos estudian; el mayor en la escuela secundaria y los 2 menores en la escuela primaria.
