Ella se encarga de alimentar a su familiar con su trabajo de venta de ropa, su trabajo es ambulante recorre las ferias de su ciudad ofertando sus prendas de vestir. María necesita comprar ropa por mayor para tener mejores beneficios y pagar los gastos de sus hijos menores. Su mercado tiene gran demanda, ella vende ropa de mujer de temporada y sueña tener algún día su tienda propia.
La necesidad mayor es el cuidado de hijos, tanto la educación como alimentación y María quiere realizar una inversión económica en la compra de ropa para cubrir los gastos de sus niños.
Es por ese motivo que maría solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa por mayor y con los beneficios pagar la educación y alimentación de sus hijos.
texts.en:
María is a single, 38-year-old woman who is the mother of three children. Her children are studying; the oldest is in secondary school and the two younger ones are in primary school. She takes charge of feeding her family with her work selling clothing. She works in an itinerant fashion; she travels among the city's markets offering her clothing. María needs to buy clothing wholesale to have greater profits and to pay her young children's expenses. The clothing market has great demand; she sells seasonal women's clothing and dreams about having her own store some day.

Her greatest need is to care for her children, in terms of education and food, and María wants to make a financial investment in buying clothing to cover her children's expenses. For this reason, María is asking for a loan to buy clothing wholesale and to pay for her children's education and food with the profits.

loans.use: to buy clothing wholesale and to pay for her children's education and food with the profits

loans.name: Mohbiby

texts.en:
Mohbiby is widowed. She is a kind and hardworking woman who is 40 years old. Mohbiby is bringing up 2 children alone.

Mohbiby works hard from early morning until late evening to earn a living. She has been busy with selling women’s clothes in a local market. She has her own selling place, and she always tries to sell fashionable and seasonable clothes to, in this way, attract customers.

She is asking for a loan of 10,000 somoni to buy clothes for increasing her working capital. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy clothes for increasing her working capital

loans.name: Chhan Nay Group

texts.en: Nay is a 48-year-old married woman with three children and two of them are students. She grows fruit trees at home with her husband on her plantation. They live in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. Both of them can earn approximately $20 per day. Now, she would like to apply for a loan of 1,120,000 Riels as a group of four members. They will use this loan to build new latrines. This loan will help her live in a better condition. In the future, she is going to plant rubber trees, renovate her home and support her child to go to university.

loans.use: to build new latrines.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Genesis is 18 years old and is the third of three children in the family. His mother Rosemarie supports the family through her restaurant business in the Philippines.

Genesis is studying petroleum engineering and is currently in the 2nd year of this 5-year course.

Genesis is borrowing 4,876 PHP to pay for tuition fees for the 1st semester of the 2014-2015 school year.

When he graduates, Genesis plans to be a professional engineer to help his parents.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock like bread and biscuits to sell

loans.name: Nexhmije

texts.en: Nexhmije is 41 years old and the mother of five children living in the Ashkali community. While she is a housewife and takes care of the children, her husband collects plastic bags with his tractor. Because of the limited income from his work only, they have not been able to paint their house, which they have just built. She is now requesting a loan to pay for the painting of the house so that it will finally be completed and allow them to enjoy better living conditions. She is very happy for this opportunity and wants to thank all of the lenders.

loans.use: to pay for the painting of her house.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is married with four children who all go to school. She deals in the clothing and textile business in Hoima, Uganda. She is a hard-working lady who desires to expand her business and open up new branches in other areas. However, price fluctuations and high transportation costs hinder her sales. 
She is acquiring a loan to buy more shoes and clothes for selling.

loans.use: to buy more shoes and clothes for selling.

loans.name: Francisca Azucena

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito Las Divas De Tosagua, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora Francisca, tiene 44 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos, tres mayores de edad y una niña de 5 años la cual  estudia en escuela, dos de ellos viven en su casa. El marido es comerciante. 
Doña Francisca como buena esposa que es realiza el crédito para que su esposo lo utilice en su negocio, él se dedica a la venta de carne, cueritos asados, colas entre otras cosas,  todas las tarde el instala una pequeña carreta cerca del mercado local lugar en el cual se agrupan muchas personas que saben de lo deliciosos de los alimentos que el vende, ella por su parte le ayuda preparando todo para cuando el vaya a vender se le haga todo más fácil. 
Este crédito es para  para preparar los alimentos que vende. Esta casi desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan mucho a su marido. Sus sueños son tener un buen restaurante.
texts.en:
In the city of Tosagua, the credit group Las Divas de Tosagua meets every two weeks. This place is known for being very dynamic, and the majority of its inhabitants work in agriculture and raising animals, as it is an area of lush vegetation.

In this place lives Francisca. She is 44 years old and in a common-law marriage in which she has four children, three adults and a five-year-old girl who is a student. Two of them live in her house. Her husband is a merchant.

Francisca, as a good wife, takes out loans for her husband to use in his business. He works selling meat, cueritos asados (grilled pork skin), and colas (pig's tails) among other things. Every afternoon he sets up his small cart near the local market, a place where many people gather who know how delicious the foods are that he sells. She, for her part, helps preparing everything so that when he goes to sell them everything is much easier.

This credit is to purchase the foods that he sells. She has been a member of the credit group almost since the beginning and she likes it because the loans help her husband very much.  Her dreams are to have a better restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase meat, leather, and other supplies.

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es: La señora Graciela vive en la Provincia Loayza, de educación secundaria, de estado civil soltera, desde muy niña vio como trabajaban sus padres y asi aprendió el trabajo de agricultora, las tierras que tiene son herencia de sus padres en las cuales ya tiene cultivado algunos productos y cuenta con plantaciones de frutales, ahora solicita un credito para la ampliacion de su cultivo de piña, de esta forma pretende independizarse y quiere colaborar a sus padres con un ingreso, también tiene planeado estudiar en en la facultad de Agronomía  ya que solo tiene la carrera de técnico superior de agronomía. La señora demuestra muchas de superarse y salir adelante para mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Graciela lives in Loayza province, completed her secondary education, is single, and from very young she saw how her parents worked, and in that way learned the work of a farmer. The land that she has was inherited from her parents, and she already has some crops planted on it, and has a fruit plantation. Now she asks for a loan to expand her pineapple crop, and in this way she wants to become independent and wants to work with her parents with an income. She also plans to study at the Agronomy school since she only has a secondary school diploma in agronomy. She shows a great desire to improve herself and get ahead to improve her life conditions.

loans.use: to expand her pineapple crop.

loans.name: Rowelda

texts.en:
Rowelda is 42 years old and married with four children, two of whom are in school. Rowelda works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell like soap, shampoo, milk, cream, etc. Rowelda has been in this business for 5 years.

In the future, Rowelda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell like soap, shampoo, milk, cream, etc.

loans.name: Ailene

texts.en:
Ailene is 35 years old and has two children, one of whom in school.

She is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Ailene requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Ailene has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Stana

texts.en: Stana is a 38-year-old married mother of three boys. Her husband works in an electrical company and also works together with Stana on their land. They have a greenhouse where they plant different vegetables for personal use and to sell at the market. Stana works very hard in order to provide for her children and her family, whom she loves very much. She feels it is always worth it and is lucky to also love the works she does. At this time, Stana is in need of a loan in order to expand her greenhouse and purchase seeds for planting peppers and other vegetables. With the increase in produce, she will be able to earn more income and afford a better lifestyle for her children. She hopes to give her children a better education and wants to thank all of the lenders for their support.

loans.use: to expand her green house and purchase seeds for planting peppers and other vegetables.

loans.name: Shpresa

texts.en: Shpresa wants to thank all of the lenders for the previous loan which has helped her to repair the saw for her husband’s woodcutting business that he still is operating. They are very poor and live in very bad conditions in an old home in need of urgent renovations. Now, they are requesting a loan to renovate the house and replace the doors and windows. This loan will help them to improve their living conditions and she wants to thank all of the lenders for their continued support and help.

loans.use: to renovate the house and replace the doors and windows.

loans.name: Vebi

texts.en:
Vebi is a father of three children living in the southern part of Kosovo. In order to earn a living, Vebi works as a taxi driver in his area while his wife stays home to take care of the family and their very small house. Vebi has tried, on several occasions, to save the money to build an annex onto his house to increase their space and provide a place for his children. He has not been able to achieve this though, as things always seem to require their monetary attention more. 
Now, for the first time, he is asking and ready to purchase the building materials for this project. This loan will help his children have a place to play, sleep and study, thereby improving their living conditions and quality of life. His goal is to give his children a better future and life as well as education. He promises to pay on time and appreciates all of the support.

loans.use: to purchase the building materials for an annex room.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is a sixty-four-year-old married man with eight children who deals in beans buying and selling in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He has also been dealing in banana-growing and transport business for many years to get additional income. He started buying and selling beans to earn income for improving the livelihood of his family and meet their basic needs. His hardship is that the business is seasonal, given the fact that farmers depend on rainfall for production and price fluctuations when they produce too much. His vision is to own a store in an urban center and buy more motorcycles for his transport business. 
Elisa needs the loan to buy beans and maize for selling.

loans.use: to buy beans and maize for selling.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia es una mujer de 32 años de edad soltera y madre de un niño.
Su vida la ocupa en el negocio de la ganadería, su hijo es un niño de 3 años que ya sabe correr. Lidia lleva la mitad de su vida en la producción de derivados de la leche, específicamente es productora de queso, las necesidades de su negocio básicamente son la leche fresca de vaca, ella necesita producir mayor cantidad de leche para obtener mayor producción de queso. Su sueño es ver a su hijo crecer y estudiar, por eso necesita aumentar su producción quesera mediante la compra de ganado vacuno para obtener mayor producción de leche. Los retos que enfrenta su negocio son llegar a los mercados locales con mayor producción y mejorar la calidad de sus quesos.
Es por esos motivos que Lidia solicita un préstamo para la compra de ganado vacuno para hacer  queso y con los beneficios pagar los gastos de su niño.
texts.en:
Lidia is a 32-year-old single woman and the mother of a son. She makes a living by raising cattle. Her son is three years old and already knows how to run. Lidia has spent half of her life producing dairy products; specífically, she is a cheese producer. Her business needs are basically fresh cow milk. She needs to produce a greater quantity of milk to obtain a greater production of cheese. 

Her dream is to see her son grown and study. She therefore needs to increase her cheese production by buying cattle in order to obtain a greater milk production. The challenges that her business faces are arriving at the local markets with a greater production and improving the quality of her cheeses. For this reason, Lidia is asking for a loan to buy cattle to make cheese and to pay for her son's expenses with the profits.

loans.use: to buy cattle to make cheese and to pay for her son's expenses with the profits.

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en: Gayane is self-employed from Akhuryan village in the Shirak region. She lives there with her husband, father and two children (one son and one daughter). Another son of Gayane serves in the army. Gayane's husband works as a teacher at Akhuryan High School. At the same time, he helps his wife in agricultural activities. They have been running a farm for many years. In particular, they cultivate potatoes and beans. They also keep pigs. Gayane now wants to expand her agribusiness a little bit by making some investments. A loan of USD 2,500 will be used to buy potato seeds, fertilizers and fuel. This large family really tries hard to make ends meet. Let's help them sustain their agribusiness and grow it further.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds (2000 kg), fertilizers (20 bags), and fuel (200 liters).

loans.name: Edije

texts.en:
Edije is a divorced mother of three children. Her life has been very difficult following the divorce and she has to raise her children by herself. In order to provide for them, she works as a cleaner in a clinic and does her best to give everything to her children. The house that she is living in is very old and has unhealthy conditions.  

At this time, she would like to paint the house and replace the windows and doors so that she can prevent more leaking of water and heat during the rainy and cold seasons. Knowing that this is a Kiva loan, she wants to thank everyone for the support and promises to pay on time.

loans.use: to paint the house and replace the windows and doors.

loans.name: Islam

texts.en: Islam comes from the southern part of Kosovo and is the father of two children. He is involved in agricultural work in order to earn a living. He plants potatoes to sell and keeps two cows to sell the dairy products and milk. He has a lot of customers and demand for the products and he would like to purchase a third cow to meet and keep up with all of the demands. He hopes in the future that he will be able to expand his farm more and plant different crops next. He promises to pay the loan on time and wants to thank all of the lenders.

loans.use: to purchase an another milk cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs to assist her tomato crops.

loans.name: Dilbar

texts.en: Dilbar was born in the year 1996. She is a hardworking and clever girl. She graduated school successfully. Dilbar lives with her parents in the south Tajikistan. Dilbar helps her parents to earn a living. She grows vegetables and also offers her services as sewer. She sews national women’s dresses. Dilbar is a very hardworking girl. She has entered the University. Now, she must pay for tuition, but she does not have enough money for it. She is asking for a loan of 3,000 Somoni to pay for tuition. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to pay for tuition.

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.en:
Alfredo previously accessed an 10,000 PHP loan that he utilized to purchase more poultry and feeds for his business. His earnings were a big help in their personal, house hold and business expenditures. 

He would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan which he will be utilizing to buy more poultry and feeds for his business. His profits from his business will definitely help sustain his family's daily needs. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart. 

Alfredo hopes that her business will grow bigger and stronger and she dreams that his family is always in good health. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week. This is where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more poultry and feeds for his business.

loans.name: Maria Rosela

texts.en:
Maria Rosela owns and operates a variety store to earn a living. She has been successful in this business for five years, and she repaid a previous loan used for the business. She also finds ways to improve her income by providing welding services and steel fabrication.

Related to this, she would like to take a new loan to increase her product inventory. She is requesting an amount of 60,000 PHP to buy more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

In the future, Maria Rosela hopes to send all her children to school. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages, needed in her business.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 49 years old and married with eight children. One child is in school, and Josephine works very hard to provide for her children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.Josephine has been in this business for three years.In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en:
Alejandra works hard to support her family. Alejandra is married and has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of dried fish to sell.

Alejandra has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Alejandra would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris is 43 years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a retail business selling gasoline in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase additional gallons of gasoline to sell.

Doris has borrowed and paid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the gasoline business for eight years and also earns an income from fishing.

Doris aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional gallons of gasoline to sell

loans.name: Arminda

texts.en: Arminda is taking a loan of $800.00 to improve her business.She is married, has four children and, of the four children, only three are in school. She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store such as shorts, children's clothing and skirts. She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $300.00. She is a hard-working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future. She lives in a simple house and has animals like goats, buffaloes and cows and her husband is a farmer.

loans.use: to buy shorts, children's clothing and skirts.

loans.name: Emmanual

texts.en:
Emmanual is a 37-year-old man and is married with five children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He has been in tea farming in the rural areas of Kyenjojo. He obtains additional income from a phone-charging business. 

Emmanual started his tea farming business to get more income to provide basic needs for his family from a nearby tea factory that buys his tea. He is faced with a lack of capital to expand his tea estate and would like to buy land to enlarge farm to serve the available market to capacity. 

He is requesting a loan to buy land for growing more tea.

loans.use: to buy land for growing more tea.

loans.name: Ben

texts.en:
Ben lives in Hoima, Uganda, and deals in a transport business alongside the selling of new clothes and farming. He hopes to build a house in town. However, high transport costs hinder his business. 

He is a married, hardworking man charged with a responsibility of taking care of four children aged between 12 and 5; all four attend school.

He is accessing credit to complete payment of his car. He faces a challenge of high fuel prices.

loans.use: to complete payment of his car.

loans.name: Kan

texts.en: Kan is 51 years old, a married woman with 6 children. They live in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She is a copper carver and her husband is a security guard at the Commune Hall. Three of her children are workers and the other children are students. All of them can earn approximately $9 per day. Now she would like to apply for a loan of $300 to build a latrine. This loan will help her and her family live in a better condition to avoid illnesses. In the future, she wants to renovate her house and support her children to finish university.

loans.use: To build a new latrine

loans.name: Ma. Teresa

texts.en:
Ma. Teresa previously accessed a 25,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for a new 30,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Ma. Teresa hopes to have more loyal customers and dreams to give her children a good life and education. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Adora

texts.en:
Adora has faithfully paid back her previous loan, which she used for her business. She has been operating her own direct selling business for many years, and she earns well from this. She had to work hard, with the determination of having a better income, to provide her children with a better education. Having a bigger responsibility requires more effort to provide for their needs, especially for her children.

To improve sales, Adora would like to apply for a new loan to purchase additional merchandise to increase her product inventory. At an amount of 20,000 PHP (Philippines pesos), she could already purchase more quantities of clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products needed in her business. She sincerely lets you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, she hopes for her business to grow bigger and become a mega-business. She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and her business, as well as to draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners and/or clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners.  The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise like clothing, footwear, undergarments and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Federico

texts.en:
Federico previously accessed a 8,000 PHP loan that he utilized to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in his business. His earnings were a big help in their personal, house hold and business expenditures. He also sells charcoal and rice for additional income.

He would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to his inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. His profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain their daily needs. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Federico dreams of having a stall in the market to have more customers. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his life and business every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in his business.

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Annabelle works hard to support her family. She has a business culturing seaweed in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing. Annabelle is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase seaweed seedlings, plastic rope, etc. for her business.

Annabelle has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase seaweed seedlings, plastic rope, etc.

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en: Vincent, a 29-year-old Ugandan, is a married hard-working man with four children, three of whom attend school. He has not only specialized in selling spare parts as his business, but also gone ahead to repair motor cycles and sell bananas locally called matooke from where he earns an additional income. He involved in all those activities as a means of subsiding his income. The loan capital will help him purchase more motorcycle spare parts and lubricants to sell, targeting the most booming business among the Ugandan youth which is boda-boda transport. He dreams of owning a big wholesale store and retail spare parts shop to serve his clients efficiently and effectively.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle spare parts and lubricants to sell.

loans.name: M. Amjad

texts.en:
M. Amjad is 43-year-old married person. He is living in the urban area of Lahore, Pakistan. He is a manufacturer by profession and manufactures auto rickshaw spare parts on demand. He has been manufacturing and generating reasonable income for his family. He is the sole earner for his entire family. He takes contracts from various local companies for manufacturing spare parts. For this purpose he utilizes the lathe machine, tools and cutting tools. 
Recently, he signed a contract for manufacturing a lot of spare parts but does not have enough raw materials. The party paid some cash in advance but some amount is still short to buy raw material. 

This is the reason M. Amjad contacted BRAC and requested a Kiva loan. He plans to buy raw material such as cast iron in large quantity and tools.
In this way he can easily generate additional income for his entire family and cherish his children in well manners.  M. Amjad thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy raw material for manufacturing Rickshaw spare parts

loans.name: Hilal

texts.en:
Hilal has three children. She used to use a sewing machine to make and sell booties. After she had children, she had to find easier work. She began selling cosmetics as well as booties. She chose this work so she wouldn't be idle while she looks after her children and to earn money. She’ll use the loan to buy wholesale cosmetics and increase her sales. Hilal is an honest and hardworking woman.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 
Hilal Hanım,3 çocuklu.  Geçmişte,örgü makinasıyla patik örüp satıyordu.  Çocuklardan sonra işini değiştirmek ve kolaylaştırması lazımdı.  Bunu,kozmetik ürünleri ve elde patik örerek yaptı.  Çocuklarını bakarken boş kalmamak ve para kazanmak için bu işi seçti.  Aldığı kredi,toplu kozmetik ürünleri alıp satışını çoğaltmak.  Hilal Hanım,dürüst ve çalışkan bir kadın.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Nihal

texts.en:
Nihal has owned a clothing shop for 20 years. She sells prayer skirts and dresses as well as “mothers’ dresses.” From time to time, she needs capital, which is why she is getting a loan from Maya. With the loan, she will increase her range of products. Nihal is a hardworking and determined woman.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 
Nihal hanım 20 yıldır hazır giyim dükkanı var.  Anne kıyafetleri ve namaz elbiseleri,namaz etekleri satıyor. Ancak,zaman zaman sermaye ihtiyacı oluyor.  Bu yüzden Maya’dan kredi alıyor.  Aldığı kredilerle çeşitliliği arttırıyor.  Bu kredi ile ürün alacak.  Nihal Hanım çalışkan ve azimli bir kadın.

loans.use: to buy products.

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Nana is a 32-year-old married woman from Zestaponi district.  Because of unemployment, her husband was forced to go abroad to find any job. Nana lives alone and doesn't have her own business activity.

Her husband sends Nana a specified amount of money from his income. This is her only source of existence. Nana lives in poverty and has a great desire to start her own business activity. 

She requested a loan and was approved through a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. This start-up program gives poor people, like Nana,  the chance to start or re-start their own businesses. Nana plans to use the loan to purchase a device to start doing epilation (hair removal).

Nana will get her own customers and generate her own income. Her regular customers will be locals, people from her community. She will be involved in her business and become financially independent.

In regards to the start-up program, Nana will get the chance to live better and is very thankful to all Kiva lenders who will finance her loan through the Kiva website.

loans.use: To buy a device to start doing epilation (hair removal)

loans.name: Ümmühan

texts.en:
Ümmühan sells clothes. When her children were young she had to take a break from working, but, now that they’re older, she wants to return to her job.  She decided to take a loan from Maya to buy ready-to-wear clothes. She’ll use the loan to buy merchandise.
Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 
Ümmühan Hanım,giyim satışı yapıyormuş.  Fakat çocuğu küçük olunca ara vermek zorunda kalmış.  Çocuğu büyüdüğü için işine geri dönmek ve çalışmak istiyor.  Yeniden hazır giyim satışı yapmak için Maya’dan kredi almaya karar vermiş.  Aldığı kredi ile malzeme alacak.

loans.use: to buy ready-to-wear clothes.

loans.name: Ayşenur

texts.en:
Ayşenur worked selling clothes before she got married. When she got married, she had to stop working. She had to work from home and earn money. She began selling cosmetics as well as selling textile products. Needing capital, she decided to apply to Maya. She will use the loan to buy merchandise and earn more. 

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 
Ayşenur Hanım,evlenmeden önce hazır giyim işiyle ilgili çalışıyormuş.  Evlenince işi bırakmak zorunda kalmış.  Evden iş yapmalı ve para kazanmalıydı.  Kozmetik işine girmiş ayrıca tekstil ürünleri satmaya başlamış.  Ancak,sermaye gerekmiş.  MAYA kredisine başvurarak bu sorununu çözdü.  Aldığı kredi,mal almasını sağlıyacak ve daha çok kazanacak.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Felicitas works hard to support her family. She has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Felicitas is borrowing 30,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy additional ingredients like meat, fish and vegetables for her restaurant.

Felicitas has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients like meat, fish and vegetables

loans.name: Ma. Dore

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Ma. Dore works hard to support her family. She has a vegetable-vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice and selling fish. Ma. Dore is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy more vegetables to offer for sale at her vegetable-vending business.

Ma. Dore has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to offer for sale.

loans.name: Vidal

texts.es:
Vidal de 56 años de edad,  es un agricultor de la zona , él solo logro estudiar hasta 4º Grado en escuela de su Cantón,  ya que cuando estaba estudiando su padre que era él que sostenía dicho hogar falleció motivo;  por el cual él dejo sus estudios para trabajar y sostener a su familia, actualmente está casado y tiene tres hijos de los cuales dos de ellos aún están con él  y el otro está acompañado y ya no vive con él.

Vidal es un agricultor  que tiene dos  hectáreas de terreno, las cuales cultiva desde los meses de abril en adelante los cultivos que él trabaja son los de maíz y siembra de jícama , el cultivo del maíz lo aprendió gracias a su padre que cuando estaba vivo lo llevaba a trabajar los fines de semana de este cultivo saca dos cosechas una de invierno y la otra de verano y también hace un cultivo al año de jícama esta la siembra en julio y está sacando su cosecha en noviembre, la distancia de su trabajo le queda a dos kilómetros desde su hogar. 

El dinero de este préstamo será invertido en la compra de semillas de jícama y también en la compra de insumos tales como abonos, herbicidas foliares, fertilizantes ya que esto tiene como presupuesto gastar alrededor de $1,300,  pero ya tiene una pequeña parte de dinero y solo necesita $1,000 para cultivar las dos hectáreas de terreno.

	
Él tiene un sueño en la vida y quiere lograrlo y es poder tener una buena cosecha este año y tener buenos ingresos de su cultivo ya que estará realizando dos tipos de cultivo en el año esto le generara mejores ganancias y poder pagar su crédito y con  las ganancias que le queden pagar un tratamiento de su esposa que necesita cubrir ya que está empezando a padecer una enfermedad respiratoria.
texts.en:
Vidal is 56 years old and is a farmer. He only studied up to Grade 4 in the school in his Canton. His father who was the person who supported the household died so he had to abandon his studies to go work to support the family. Today he is married and has 3 children, two of which are still living with him. The other is married and doesn't live with him.

Vidal is a farmer who has 2 hectares of land where he grows from April onwards. The crops he grows are corn and jícama. He learned to grow corn from his dad while he was still alive. He would take him to work on weekends. He gets two harvests year one in the winter and another in the summer. Also he gets one crop of jícama, that he seeds in July and harvests in November. His fields are two km. distance from his house.

The money from this loan will be used to buy jícama seeds and also buy inputs like manure, foliar sprays and fertilizer. This entails an expense of $1,300 but as he has a small part of that money he only needs $1,000 to cultivate the two hectares of land.

He has a dream in his life and he wants to achieve it. He wants to have a good harvest this year and get good income from his crops as he is doing two types of crops this year. This will generate more income and he can pay off the loan with the profit and that will leaves him to pay for treatment for his wife who has started to suffer from a respiratory disease.

loans.use: to buy jícama seeds and also buy inputs like manure, foliar spray and fertilizer.

loans.name: Lea

texts.en:
Lea is 42 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family, running a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy more groceries for her store.

Lea has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this one. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from farming corn and rice. She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries for her store.

loans.name: Irma

texts.en:
Irma is a 46-year-old married woman who lives in the village of Khelvachauri. She has a husband, pensioner parents-in-law, and a school-age son. Irma's husband is a sailor and generates significant income. In order to be involved in her own business and do her bit for the family's welfare, Irma has opened a grocery store with the family's saved money. Now she needs financial support to purchase additional stock of products and to have money for working capital to continue running her business.

Irma has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan will greatly assist Irma, and she will be able to improve her economic situation and give her family a better style of life. Irma awaits your support and will highly appreciate it.

loans.use: To purchase stock of products and have money for working capital

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa es una mujer de 49 años de edad casada sin hijos.
Su vida la ocupa en su negocio; la elaboración de fuegos artificiales pirotécnicos, su esposo la colabora y se encarga del mismo negocio ambos participan. Estos fuegos artificiales están presentes en casi todo acto social de su comunidad, todos los conocen y siempre son reconocidos.
Teresa aporta a su comunidad constantemente, organizando verbenas de recaudación de fondos para alimentar a los niños de la calle. Teresa no tiene tienda y trabaja a pedido, su sueño es tener su propia tienda y muchos fuegos artificiales en exposición.
Es por esos motivos que Teresa solicita un préstamo para la compra de material de fuegos artificiales para ayudar a los niños de la calle.
texts.en: Teresa is a 49-year-old woman who is married with no children. She makes a living from her business making fireworks. Her husband works with her and is in charge of the same business they both participate in. These fireworks are present at nearly all social events in her community; everyone knows them and they are always recognized. Teresa is constantly supporting her community, organizing fundraisers to feed street kids. Teresa doesn't have a store and she works by request. Her dream is to have her own store and a lot of fireworks on display. For this reason, Teresa is asking for a loan to buy material for fireworks to help street kids.

loans.use: to buy material for fireworks to help street kids

loans.name: Avecenia

texts.en:
Avecenia, 53, is a resident of Tanza, Cavite in the Philippines. She is a widow with two children who help her manage their household and provide for their everyday needs. Avecenia owns a computer shop. She also has a variety store and a ready-to-wear business for additional income.

These computer shops rent computer time for 20 Philippine pesos per hour. Some families still don’t have their own computers so they go to computer shops to encode and print documents. Others rent to connect with their loved ones abroad, and others, specially children and youth, rent to play games. Normally, computer shops open at 8 a.m. and close at 7 p.m. Her regular customers are the children and youth of the community. She earns a minimum 1,500 PHP a day.

Just as any other business owner, she is hoping that her shop will continue to expand with more customers and branches. She dreams that her family will always be in good health and condition. 

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and also to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God that she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional computer parts and supplies needed for her business.

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred lives in Hoima, Uganda and deals in a motorcycle transport (boda boda) business alongside selling motorcycle spare parts. He started his business so as to improve on his standard of living. He hopes to expand his business into new markets. However, high transport and limited capital hinders his business. 

He is a married hardworking man charged with a responsibility of taking care of three children aged between 7 and 6 months; two of them attend school.

He is accessing credit to buy motorcycle spare parts to sell.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Rosa Noemi

texts.es:
Rosa de 55 años de edad, estudio hasta  segundo grado de nivel académico. Es viuda desde hace 8 años en esa relación procreo  4 hijos los cuales solo uno vive con ella y los otros tres están en hogares apartes; con Rosa solo vive un hijo, la nuera y un nieto.

Rosa se dedica a los oficios domésticos y a la crianza de cerdos y gallinas ya que esa es la única fuete de ingresos que ella tiene, engorda los cerdos y los vende con el poco dinero que el hijo aporta a la casa ella compra un cerdo pequeño y de ahí lo vende y así va comprando más de las ganancias que le quedan actualmente tiene tres que ya luego lo sacara a la venta; esto lo aprendió solo ya que la necesidad la hace pensar de como llevar ingresos a la casa. 
     

El préstamo que está solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar 18 pliegos de lámina para ponerle a la casa,  ya que la está reparando;  el inicio de esta casa lo han hecho con puros esfuerzos de ella y el hijo ya que el tiempo de lluvia está bastante fuerte y se están mojando; pero con esto ellos solventan el problema y les ayudara de gran manera porque ya tendrán su casa buena con su techo bueno donde ellos podrán descansar.

El sueño de Rosa es poder tener una granja de cerdos y gallinas ponedoras,  ya que esto da muy buenas ganancias y lo lograra con muchos esfuerzo y trabajo apoyando al hijo en el trabajo.
texts.en:
Rosa is a 55 years old and has been a widow for eight years. She and her husband had four children; three of whom live on their own. One of Rosa's sons, his wife, and their son live with Rosa. 

Rosa works in her home, but also raises pigs and chickens, which is her only source of income. Rosa purchases pigs with the small amount of money that her son contributes to the household, fattens the pigs and sells them. She then uses income from these sales to purchase more pigs to fatten and sell. Rosa began raising pigs out of necessity, to earn income to support her household. 

Rosa is applying for a loan from CREDICAMPO to purchase 18 metal sheets so she can install a roof on her house. Rosa and her son have built the house themselves, but they often get wet during the rainy season. The metal sheets that Rosa will purchase with this loan will solve this problem and ensure that Rosa, her son, and his family have a comfortable home under a solid roof where they'll be able to rest. 

Rosa's ambition is to have a large farm with pig and laying hens, which would provide a solid income; she will realize her goals through her steadfast efforts and hard work, while continuing to support her son.

loans.use: to purchase 18 sheets for installation of a roof on her house.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en:
Hilda works hard to support her family. Hilda is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase a fishing net and other equipment used in fishing.

Hilda has been in this business for 6 years now.

In the future, Hilda would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase a fishing net and other equipment used in fishing.

loans.name: Jonelyn

texts.en:
Jonelyn is 30 years old and married with three children, two of whom are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Jonelyn has borrowed and paid back 8 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the charcoal business for 5 years and also earns an income from farming rice.

She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Willam

texts.en: William is a married man with children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He works in tea farming in the rural areas of Kyenjojo, and obtains additional income from contracts to build houses as a professional mason. He started his tea farming business to educate his children. He is faced with a lack of capital to complete his residential house because money obtained from only selling tea cannot enable him to complete his house. William is requesting a loan to buy roofing materials for his house.

loans.use: to buy roofing materials for his house.

loans.name: Aurea

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Aurea works hard to support her family. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from raising pigs. 

Aurea is borrowing 10,000 Philippine pesos through the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She will use the loan to purchase additional fish to sell in her fish vending business.

Aurea has sustained her business activities through her past  five loans with NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Julieta works hard to support her family. She has a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice. Julieta is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional charcoal to sell.

Julieta has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Houssam

texts.en:
Houssam is a 24-year-old married father of one child. He has been working in an agricultural business for ten years, which has provided him with special talents in his domain. In 2009, he established his own business when he bought a special tractor. Houssam is a hardworking man, who puts so much effort into developing his business to improve his family's living. His good reputation provides him with customers' support and recommendations. 

Unfortunately, Houssam's wife is very sick and needs an urgent surgery, which he can't afford. For this reason, he is acquiring a youth loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to cover the necessary medication expenses.

loans.use: To cover his wife's necessary medication expenses

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely is 68 years old and is a widow with eight children.

Fely works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more snack food, canned goods and other groceries.

Fely has borrowed and repaid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from food vending.

Fely aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more snack food, canned goods and other groceries.

loans.name: Torky

texts.en: Torky has already finished repaying his first and second loans from Kiva Lenders. He has applied for a third loan of 200,000 YER to buy furniture for his house. He took out the first two loans to purchase more phones accessories for his store. Those loans really helped him to improve his business and the living standards of his family. He is very thankful to Kiva lenders for their support until now and he hopes to be financed for this new loan.

loans.use: to buy furniture for his house.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta de 23 años de edad vive con su grupo familiar conformado por su  hijo y su mamá, ella se dedica  a la venta de ropa, lociones, sandalias y ropa interior, con lo que gana de sus ventas ayuda a solventar algunas de las necesidades de su hogar, la clienta está solicitando un crédito a INTEGRAL  para seguir invirtiendo en el negocio comprando más productos por mayor, y así tener junto con su  familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: The 23-year-old client lives with her family, which consists of her child and her mother. She works selling clothes, lotions, sandals and underclothes. With her revenues from her sales she helps to cover some of her household's necessities. The client is requesting a loan from Integral in order to continue investing in her business by buying more items wholesale. In this way she and her family will have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy clothes, lotions, sandals and underclothes wholesale.

loans.name: Liberty

texts.en:
Liberty is 51 years old and married with six children. She earns a living by farming corn and rice in the Philippines. Liberty has been in this business for ten years and also earns additional income from fattening pigs.

Liberty is borrowing 5,000 Philippine pesos through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) in order to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farm. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farm.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en: Leah is 33 years old, married and has two children, who are in school. She is in an agricultural business fattening pigs in the Philippines. Leah has been in this business for one year now and has borrowed six times in the past from Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) to sustain it. Leah requested a 15,000 Philippine peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to purchase additional pigs to raise. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional pigs to raise

loans.name: Nason

texts.en: Nason is a 35-year-old man; married with one child; living in Kasese, Uganda. He has a bakery business, where he makes bread and cakes. He began the business to look after his children and have a better standard of living. Nason wants a loan to buy a baking machine, which will help him increase his productivity to meet high customer demand. Nason is a hardworking person; however, he is faced with the challenge of high costs of production.

loans.use: to buy a baking machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy livestock in order to raise and resale them in the local markets.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente de  25 años de edad se dedica al cultivo de maíz y maicillo, vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia,  con lo que gana de sus ventas ayuda a solventar algunas necesidades de su hogar, el cliente solicita un crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas como fertilizante, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, y mejorar el terreno que muestra la fotografía, y así poder darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The client is 25 years old and grows corn and sorghum. He lives in his own home with his family and sells his products in the various markets located near his home. With what he gets from his sales, he helps to pay for some of his household necessities. 

He is requesting a loan in order to buy agricultural supplies such as fertilizer, manures, pest-control agents, herbicides, to improve the parcel of land shown in the photograph, and to thereby provide his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, manures, pest-control agents, herbicides, and to improve the parcel of land.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta de 26 años de edad, vive con sus hijos en casa propia, ella posee una tienda y una venta de sandalias su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia, con lo que gana de sus ventas logra solventar algunas de las necesidades que se le presentan en su hogar, la clienta solicita un crédito para la compra de mas productos como: granos básicos, golosinas, refrescos, sopas, etc.  y así poder darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The client is 26 years old. She lives with her children in her own home and has a general store and sells sandals. Her business is located in her home. With what she earns from her sales, she manages to take care of some of the necessities that come up in her household.

The client is requesting a loan to buy more products, such as basic dry goods, snacks, soft drinks, soups, etc. That way, she can give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy more products, such as basic dry goods, snacks, soft drinks, soups, etc.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling rice in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase sacks of rice to sell for her rice business.

Lilibeth has been in this business for 6 years. Lilibeth earns additional income from raising pigs.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Marissa works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling used clothing in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs.  Marissa is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy more bundles of used clothes to sell for her used clothing business.

Marissa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more bundles of used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Abegail

texts.en:
Abegail is 37 years old and married.

She earns a living by farming corn and rice in the Philippines. Abegail is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farm.

Abegail has been farming corn and rice  for four years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farm.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 30 years old and married with three children who are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as shampoo, groceries, etc.

Marissa has borrowed and paid 9 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 4 years and also earns an income from seaweed cultivation.

She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Matia

texts.en:
Matia is 26 years old and is married with two children living in Kasese, Uganda. He runs a retail shop with general merchandise. He has been in this business since 2010 and also practices commercial farming, growing crops such as beans and maize to get additional income. He began the business to improve his family's standards of living. 

Matia is a hardworking man dreaming of a wholesale business. He wants money to buy rice, soap, sugar, salt and other general merchandise to sell. High transport costs are a hindrance to his operations.

loans.use: to buy rice, soap, sugar, salt and other general merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies, corn and bean seeds.

loans.name: Reinaldo

texts.es: Reinaldo, tiene 56 años de edad, esta casado, tiene 4 hijos, vive con tres de ellos y su esposa en una aldea del municipio de Gracias, Lempira.   Toda su vida la ha dedicado a la agricultura de granos básicos, la producción que le genera mayor ingreso es el cultivo de café, el cual vende en grano despulpado y seco. Ha obtenido varios prestamos para mantener su finca, actualmente solicita 10,000 Lempiras para comprar abono y foliar para darle asistencia a su finca de café y poder mejorar la producción. Su plan es tener un buen patrimonio que le genere ingresos.
texts.en:
Reinaldo is 56 years old, married and has four children. He lives with his wife and three of them in a village in the municipality of Gracia, Lempira. All his life, he has been a farmer growing basic staples. The crop that generates greatest income for him is coffee. He sells the beans de-pulped and dry.

He has obtained several loans for maintaining his plantation, and currently is requesting 10,000 lempiras for purchasing manure and foliar fertilizer for maintaining his coffee plantation and improving output. His plan is to have a good asset which will generate income.

loans.use: To buy manure and foliar fertilizer for maintaining his coffee plantation.

loans.name: Ishyaka Cb Group

texts.en:
Ishyaka is a group led by Gaudence, who is 49 years old.  The group's name means "zeal" in English. 

Gaudence has been a group leader for the past four years. She sells foodstuffs. The group members sell different items and they all believe they will improve their sales through their loans. 

With this loan, Gaudence would like to buy more beans and sorghum. Her business profits will be used to renovate her house.

As the group leader, Gaudence has her hand raised to identify herself.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs, such as beans and sorghum, to sell.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa owns and operates a variety store business to earn a living. She has been successful in this business for almost 10 years, and she has repaid her previous loan, used for the business. She also finds ways to improve her income by managing a food stall business.

Relative to her business, she would like to take out a new loan to increase her product inventory. She is requesting a loan of 30,000 Philippine pesos to buy more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed for her business.

In the future, Elisa hopes to become more and more successful in her business and also dreams of her children being able to finish their studies and becoming professionals.

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week. There she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God that she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed for her business.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna has faithfully paid back her previous loan which she used for her business. She has been operating her own rug-making business for years and she earns well from this. Having more responsibility requires more effort to provide for their needs, especially for her children. She had to work hard, with the determination of having better income, to provide her children with a better education. 

To improve her profit, Myrna would like to apply for a new loan. With PHP 12,000, she can already purchase more quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread, and other materials for her business. She sincerely lets you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, Myrna hopes to grow her business as well as improve the living conditions of her family and give her children a better education. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread, and other materials for her business.

loans.name: Arturo

texts.es:
Arturo de 45 años de edad,  se ha dedicado al cultivo de maíz. Él  no tuvo la oportunidad de prepararse académicamente, ya que sus padres no estaban de acuerdo a brindarle estudios, ya que eran de las personas que pensaban y decían que del estudio no se tendría ningún tipo de beneficio, actualmente está acompañado y de dicho hogar tiene tres hijos  de los cuales dos están estudiando y el otro está acompañado y ya no vive junto a él.

Arturo es agricultor y desde que era muy pequeño su padre le enseño a trabajar en la agricultura, todas las mañanas salía con su padre a trabajar le ayudaba a su padre a sembrar maíz, frijol y jícama y ahora Arturo alquila una hectárea de terreno para sembrar jícama, estas tierras le quedan a una distancia de dos kilómetros pero esto no es nada de dificultad para realizar esta actividad.

Este crédito será invertido en la compra de semillas, este año que paso no logro comprar la semilla así que un vecino le venderá la cantidad que necesita para sembrar la hectárea de jícama y la otra parte para comparar los insumos para darle mantenimiento al cultivo  hasta que haya dado sus frutos.

él tiene un anhelo muy grande en la vida,  él tiene dos hijos los cuales uno de ellos estará yendo al bachillerato y Arturo tiene planeado comprar todos los útiles escolares para que su hijo no tenga problemas en su estudio y que empiece sus estudios sin problemas y sabe que lo puede lograr con la ayuda de su crédito.
texts.en:
Arturo, 45, has earned a living growing corn.  Currently he's in a relationship from which he has three children; two of them are in school and the other one is in a relationship and doesn't live at home.

Arturo didn't have the opportunity for an academic education because his parents did not agree with sending him to school.  They were people who believed and said that studying wouldn't have any sort of benefit.

Arturo's a farmer.  His father taught him to work in agriculture at a young age.  Every morning he would go out with his father to work.  He helped his father grow corn, beans, and jicama.  Now Arturo rents a hectare of land to grow jicama about two kilometers away, but it's not difficult at all to do this job.

He will invest this loan in buying seeds.  He wasn't able to buy the seed this past year, so a neighbor will sell him what he needs to sow the hectare of jicama.  The other part will be to buy the inputs to take care of the crop until it bears fruit.

He has a great desire in life.  He has two children, one of whom is already pursuing his diploma.  Arturo plans to buy all the necessary school supplies so his son won't have problems in his studies and can begin without any problems.  Arturo knows he can achieve this with the help of his loan.

loans.use: to buy jicama seeds

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 31 years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock of items to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, etc.

Marites has borrowed and paid 8 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 7 years and also earns an income from the retail sale of rice.

Marites aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock of items to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, etc.

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es: Maria, tiene 39 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su pareja con quien tiene una hija y reside en el municipio de San Francisco de Yojoa. Hace 9 años estableció una pulpería donde vende productos básicos como arroz, azúcar, manteca, huevos, pan, carnes,  y otros. El préstamo que solicita es el sexto ciclo y es por 8,000 lempiras, con el cual va surtir  el negocio con productos de la canasta básica como ser granos básicos, manteca, azúcar, pan, condimentos, churros, productos de abarrotes, etc. para aumentar el inventario y las ventas. Su plan es mejorar el local del negocio y su casa.
texts.en:
Maria is 39 years old, and lives in union with her life partner, with who she has a daughter. She lives in the town of San Francisco de Yojoa. Nine years ago she established a small grocery store, where she sells basic products like rice, sugar, butter, eggs, bread, meats, and others. 

This is the 6th loan she is requesting, and it is for 8,000 lempiras. She will use it to supply her business with products of the basic food basket, like staple grains, butter, sugar, bread, condiments, churros, and other groceries. With this, she will increase her inventory and her sales. Her plan is to improve her store and her house.

loans.use: to buy staple grains, butter, sugar, bread, condiments, churros, and different grocery products.
